review_content:
Aroma:  maíz, pan
Apariencia: color dorado, espuma blanca, clara, poca retención. 
Sabor: maíz, cereal
Sensación: carbonatación alta, refrescante, poco amarga

2017. Black Sabbath releases The End live album, a document of their final tour. Ozzy and the gang back for one last ride. Wow. I'll never understand how people think the Dio era is better, and the Oz era supremacy is proven by the fact that NONE of that power metal crap is on this album. I'm drinking miller lite, the beer i am now reviewing, while listening to this album. The fine pilsner taste perfectly complements the music at hand, and at only 96 calories, I can get headbang and the weight right off. Overall, I'd give both Black Sabbath and miller lite a 4.5/5 (I can't give sabbath a perfect score because of Born Again, and no amount of miller lite will let me unhear it).

Tall can from Foodland. Pours a big foamy white head with thick dirty lacing and has a clear straw coloured appearance. Somewhat excessive carbonation. Aromas of corn, grains, bread malt, hints of grass. Flavours are mostly corn and grainy malts. Very light grassy and herbal hop notes. Not much else. Drying mouthfeel. Another bland macro.

12tg year anniversary on site so figure give this brew a rate. Had millions during college but few the last decade or so. Gold pour. Grainy nose and taste faint corn and grass. Really one of the macros I prefer over others.

(bottle 0,355l from online shop americanbeer.cz) Overall: Meh. Extra boring and bland.
 Aroma: Very light corny.
 Appearance: Clear pale golden. Minimal, white head.
 Taste: Light sweet, corny.
 Palate: Light body. Light dry finish.
Ik moet eerlijk zeggen dat dit beter smaakt dan verwacht. Komt waarschijnlijk door de pittige Oosterse hap ernaast 😓 Ik zweet peentjes...

It’s a good beer for a lite beer. The craft beer snobs on this site want it to compete with a founders all day ipa which it is not going to. For mowing the lawn or on the river it’s a great beer Especially when it only has 96 calories. Are there better beers of course but in its style it has the most flavor and is union made
Una cerveza con un sabor y aroma casi inexistente, la malta no se aprecia del todo en el examen olfativo, aunque puede ser refrescante para algunos, el sabor no me convence.

341ml bottle. (4.0% ABV) Pours a clear pale gold with a thin, fizzy, short lived, white head that leaves spotty lacing.  Faint aroma of grainy malt and corn. Sweet flavour of bready malt, corn, grass and mild lemon in a dry finish. Light body with a thin, watery texture and lively carbonation. Refreshing and easy to drink, but so is water. Nothing offensive, just bland.
Don't drink much of them but this is my 2nd favorite light beer. Needs to be ice cold for me to drink. Great with Clamato in winter though.

For a gas station light beer it’s about the best it has a mild grain (saltine cracker) note and a grassy hop undertone though it’s watery it still has actual flavor which is more you can say for bud light

24 ounce can looks like a grain silo. Lovely clear gold pour. Large frothy white head subsides to a scant creamy cap. Faint grainy malt aroma has grassy, mineral notes. First sip is thin and watery. Light grainy notes. A slight bit of citrus and corn syrup on the palate is fleeting. As light pilsners go, this is Lite as advertised.
Pours pale golden with a full, white head.  Aroma is grass and light corn syrup.  Taste is corn syrup, moving to grass.  Finish is the same.
22 ounce, draft at Beef o Brady’s in Stow, Ohio. Smells sweet. Light golden in color. Thin white head. Asteroid sweet. Smooth and light. Sweet aftertaste. Just lawnmower beer to me. Cheers!

It is Miller Lite. It isn't drank by Kings and Queens as much as Bud Light. It is what it is, something to drink and get you drunk. If you are drinking purely for flavor, then enjoy it, it is your life and mouth. If I am going to put more than a few back then this is a go to.

Pours pale golden with a full, white head.  Aroma is grass and light corn syrup.  Taste is corn syrup, moving to grass.  Finish is the same.

Miller lite fire. Too much gas in this can. Want to try it on draft, just because it would taste better. Me and Rec slam these
One of the best cheap beers and low in calories. Good for sporting events and whenever you want just a casual drink.
I mean, technically drinkable. I usually only grab it when my options are limited to Bud, Miller, and whatever random ipa the stadium has. There is almost always a better option.
classica birra industriale, sentori di lattina, mais cotto e verdura cotta.

miller life is my friend. all of you are pretentious as shit. i would die for miller life and none of you mean nearly as much to me.


goodnight xo
Can on a plane. Slight grainy cardboard aroma with corn and skunky notes. Mild sweetish with low bitterness. Weak body. Lame.
12 oz can unfortunately poured into my open pie hole. Could be classified as the worst tasting kat piss ever brewed by sub-humans. Whomever dreamed up this diarrhea water should be executed!

This right here is what you call “A classic frat party beer”, because that’s what it is. Nothing better than slammin a few of these back with the boys on a hot summer day at the beer pong table bumpin some luke Coombs and R kelly.
Taste: 3/10
Experience: 8/10
Price: Cheap
Will it get you drunk?: hell ya brother
This beer is super underrated especially for a light beer prolly the best light beer honestly.
It taste nothing but water. Ad in the middle of super bowl. Famous for its low calories.
Can only be described as a waste of calories! No taste, no strength, no nothing. Didn’t even finish the bottle - a first for me.

Very watery and tasteless. in my opinion a boring beer with no attitude.
But I wouldn´t say no to one a hot summer day.

Can bottle, one of LV liquor stores. Clear golden, white head. Mild grain nose, sweet, quite some corn. Mild sweetness, some bitterness, cooked veggies aboundant. Peppery finish. Light, watery. Could be much worse.

This is an underrated beer. It is excellently made but drunk at far too low a temperature as generally with beer. The low temp hinders the nose and the taste as does guzzling - yeah, I used the word. The surprise was the taste of toffee from such a lightly flavored beer. The web site lists caramel malt which explains the toffee flavor. The nose was clean - no off aromas -with cereal and toffee. 12 oz can   BBY 11/4/19

16 oz can in New York City last week. Better than expected. Well, expectations were kinda low. Seriously, the only thing that makes this light beer is probably the ABV which is under 5%. In Finland most of the mid-range beers were 4.7% so this not that far away e.g. from Lapin Kulta.

My beer standard for many years in the unenlightened days. It’s curious I have not rated Miller Lite yet, that is about to change. I’m drinking from a 12 oz can, a glass would be superfluous. It is ice cold but that is not enough. I determine a grain influence, a touch of hops and water. Carbonation may be its best point. Enough said.
Great beer.  Great choice.  This page indicates that Pilsner is Lager.  A lot of people have a hard time grasping that pilsner is lager.

Went a long time without having this one, and I certainly could have done without. Tastes of fizz with a sour (and not a good sour) backbone and a weird/unpleasant aftertaste. I didn’t finish the can. 2/10
Es un poco amarga para mi gusto , pero dentro de las livianas tiene buen sabor
I've had way too many cans of this in my high school and underage days. Clear golden with ample head. Notes are corn, grain, ash, and barely any hops. Light bodied.
the only good thing about this beer is it is available anywhere you want across the country.

12 oz can left in fridge by friend. Has a sour/tart smell to it. Clear and golden yellow in the glass. Does not have much of a taste to it, it is fizzy, don't taste any malt character or hops. Finish is very forgettable, it does leave a bit of a strange flavor in the back of the throat.
This is a fine Pilsner! The absolute best lite beer!!!  It’s great from a bottle from draft or even a can. The fact that it has such a low rating is absurd
Best consumed icier-than-ice cold and then quickly, quickly my friend before your taste buds awaken.
For a light beer it has the most flavor. A good beer that has taste and not piss water like bud light or natural light. My go to consistent  beer.
Gelbes Bier, Geruch is unangenehm getreidig auch im Geschmack muffig getreidig säuerlich wässrig, so garnicht meins

Aroma is sweet and light. Taste is buttered sweet corn and toasted white bread.  Finish bounces back and forth between a slight hop bitterness and malt sweetness. Quite a bit of carbonation, but that's expected for this style   When you judge this to other light beers it sits on top of the list easily in my opinion.  The light flavor that is there is very clean and crisp and not a hint of anything offensive.  Nice one to put in the fridge when it's on sale and wanting something mellow.
Clear golden thin to no head carbonation is good little lacing smell of grains grassy earthy taste fizzy malts light hops watery really light refreshing

Color amarillo, cristalina. Un dedo de espuma con baja retención. Sin apenas aroma. Gusto muy discreto a cereal, por decir algo. El agua tiene más cuerpo. Muy mala esta birra, el simple hecho de comercializarla es un atraco.
Fairly cheap and good. One of the best and trendier light beer. Be careful of a headache it may give you one when coming down. Doesn’t mix with the sun. Cruise ships sell it at a cheap price.
Pale yellow with thin head and pungent aroma.  Thin body with typical mass market Pilsner taste. Slight sweetness and slight hop bitterness, crisp finish.

(12oz can)
AROMA: light grain?, hint of a dairy, faint uderlyjng notes of lager/pilsner-ness
APPEARANCE: straw yellow, clear, frilly white foam that does fall pretty quick. Ok looking for a pale lager.
TASTE: weak beer, not much malt or hops, does have a pool water or city water taste to it
PALATE: fresh, crisp, fizzy, very light body

OVERALL: ok nose and looks but the flavor is almost un-beer-like. Not sure how to describe the simplicity and.offness of this. But I guess it could be a crisp summer "beer" (beverage)

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.

What can I say about this beer that hasn't already been said? Aroma is a whiff of malt, actually, I can't even call it a whiff more like a puff. Appearance is your standard AAL: pale, straw colored. There are very few qualities about it. Taste: Seriously, is this water? There's very little taste to it. The beer coats my tongue with prickles of carbonation. Overall, I'd steer clear of it, but when offered, and there are no other beer choices around, it'll have to do.

Pours from 12oz bottle a light brew with a vigorous but quickly receding abundant white head. Active carbonation is evident. Very faint aroma of corn and hops. Flavor also very faint, but again graininess and touch of hops. Decent medium mouthfeel and continuing . Leaves a little bitterness with a dry finish.Goes down easy on a hot thirsty day. Cheers for what it is.

I do not like lite beers. If you must drink beer go for the non lite entries. Just tried this at a football game only beer I could find. Actually not terrible. Smooth going down just lacks body. Not really watered down just thin. All other lites never tasted like anything. I might just buy another.

Dose im Flugzeug. Klares Gold-Gelb, etwas Schaum, kleinporig, viel Kohlensäure.
Aroma: Malz, Hopfen, etwas Zitrus.
Geschmack: geschmackloser Antrunk, etwas Getreide und Malz tauchen dann auf. Ein wenig Bitterkeit.
Eigentlich völlig belanglos, noch nicht einmal negativ.
The original. Great taste less filling. Everything else is a knockoff and pisswater in comparison.
It's the best light beer I've had, easy to drink with a trace of good flavor.  There's nothing I can complain about with this beer especially for what it's supposed to be.

About the same as the other lagers, but with a bit more flavor and a bit of an herbal  bite. Doesn’t really stand out which is the trend with most beers I have tasted. I would still drink it again though!

Pours amber with a nice head. Decent carbocations. Aroma of malt and bread. Tastes like a pilsener and has a sweet palate, touch of malt. Crisp mouthfeel. Surprisingly good, easily the best of the cheap beers as it is the only one to have distinguishable elements.
It’s a lite beer people need to stop hating on domestic beers yes they aren’t the best in terms of fullness and flavor but for a beer to just sip on a hot day it gets the job done.

W aromacie wyczuwalna woń jakby kukurydzy i jabłka. Pierwsze łyki bardzo rześkie, z każdym kolejnym, w miarę utraty CO2 coraz większą pustka w smaku. Na koniec zamienia się w gazowana wodę z dziwnym posmakiem. Doskonałe jako napój do popicia kanapki z serem po pracy.

Bue dans l'avion pour aller à San Francisco en cannette. Blonde sans mousse petite carbo. Arôme très agréable d'houblons citronné. Mais l'impression de boire de la flotte. Peu de malt et beaucoup trop légère. A part au nez, pas top...

I get annoyed with people who hate on any kind of domestic American lager. This beer is great for what it is. It’s easy an easy-drinking, fine pilsner. There are some BMC’s that are much much worse. It’s light and crisp and all around just a good ol’ American lager.

24 ounce can into lager glass, best before 6/11/2018. Pours crystal clear pale golden yellow color with a small fairly dense and fluffy white head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of cracker, corn, white bread dough, light biscuit, and herbal/grassy earthiness. A bit too fruity aromas, but not overpowering. Okay aromas with pale malt/corn and light earthy hop notes; with decent strength. Taste of cracker, corn, white bread dough, light biscuit, and herbal/grassy earthiness. Mild herbal, grassy, spicy bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of cracker, corn, white bread dough, light biscuit, and herbal/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Nice robustness of pale malt/grains and light earthy hop flavors; with a nice malt/bitterness balance, and zero cloying/astringent flavors after the finish. Moderately crisp/clean finishing. Perfectly clean on lager flavors, with zero yeast notes present. Lightly increasing dryness from lingering bitterness. Medium-high carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy, and lightly sticky balanced mouthfeel that is good. A bit thin, but not watery finish.Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.2%. Overall this is a very solid light lager. All around good robustness of pale malt/grains and light earthy hop flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink. Nicely flavorful for the low ABV. Clean pale malt/grains and decent earthy hop balance. Definitely one of the better macro light beers available. An enjoyable offering.

I was handed one at my wife work party. I'm rating this honestly, but purely out of spite, since there aren't any good beers here. This is awful. If you are drinking this beer while checking a website like this one, you seriously need to reconsider your life choices.
This beer seems to be the go-to when I was in Cleveland. I’ve never actually had it before until then. The results were: just regular cheap beer. There are much better options out there

Best lite beer. Great for a long day of drinking many. Tailgating at the jets or giants games. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I love Miller Lite. I love it so damn much. I don’t care what you beer snobs say. I love Miller Lite

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

When it comes to a nostalgic beer, this is the beer for me to remember my early 20’s. A very iced cold beer with a hint of flavor. I enjoyed Miller when I was younger, but now I only enjoy the nostalgic fizz it leaves in my memories. Occasionally I grab one and it’s nice, but outside of remembering my younger days it’s a plain beverage. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I️ guess I️ have a soft spot for Miller. I️ just really like it. Bready with a hint of metallic hops and ridiculously drinkable. This is the perfect redneck party beer - and it’s the #1 choice when this redneck wants to party! Roll Tide!
Keg.  Very fizzy, perhaps a bit too much.  Away from AB taste in being a little bit more hoppy.  Still very light and not heavy.  Does have a bit more color and taste than very light beers.
Light yellow in color with weak foam.  Aroma of corn, rice, and hops. Taste of grains, weak hops, light carbonation  The better of the light American Beers. Solid, dependable
473ml can. Clear pale golden with a thin foamy white head. Flavors are corn and lemon with light herbal notes. Light to medium body, moderate carbonation, soft texture.
Oh god this horse piss. But served ice cold in a frosted pint glass and it’s tolerable

Really good for a lite macro lager. The price isn't the best in the world but it's certainly not expensive either. In the middle on this beer. Has a very crisp finish. The light part of it is what makes it not the best macro lager.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I used to love this beer. So good on a hot summer day, since it was so light.
Today??? Not so much.

Where is the taste? The flavor??? The "BEERiness"??

if you are watching calories, sure, drink it.

if you want beer, try a German brew. Any of them.
From backlog, on draft. Light yellow with little white head. Not much aroma or taste.
fine. a bit pricey for what it is but its fine. stable beer of the united states, i looks cool
Incredibly lite, corn flavor is not too apparent, a very moderate malt character. Not much hops. Flavor+hops is still less than a Mexican lager. It's very light and low alcohol to say the least.

Tap version. Absolutely vile. Sickly plastic bag aroma and flavor. No corn, no hops, no malt, just plastic garbage bag. Thin. Small white head with no retention. Both aroma and flavor are gross. I gave it a 2 overall, because at least it’s wet.
Can pour. Surprisingly good aroma - hops and malt. Pours a golden amber. Flavor is almost nonexistent. Very slightly bitter. Light body. It is what it is.

rate beer has it wrong...this is  a pilsner. I find it to be the most drinkable light beer of them all. mich ultra would be next. less filling more taste is right. perfect amount of bitterness and very crisp.
Bottle, in US. Backlog entry. Entering my historic scores for US beers whilst visiting New York. No tasting notes kept, just rating.

I drink this to sober up. Let’s not fool ourselves and pretend you detect a hint of peach or the bottom third develops into hoppy bliss. You drink this because it is cheap and you want to be able to get it up later for the portly girl you have been eyeing by the bathroom all night.
This was the party beer before we were legally allowed to party. Premium beer with a bit of bitterness to it
Uma pilsen leve e refrescante, para se tomar bem gelada e em grandes quantidades.

Miller Lite, pretty simple to understand it's a good premium beer for college kids and to just get hammered.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
For some reason, when I want a cheap light beer I seem to pick on the Miller light.

It's a lot better than I honestly thought it would be. It's not as watery as I expected and it maintains a decent malt characteristic. It's not by any means a great beer, but it is not the worst beer.
Bottle in Viñales, Cuba. Really not a beer worth to try, but, what the hell this was doing in a cuban state runned shop?
Oh my god. This is the worst thing that can happen to a human being. Omg. This is truly horrible.

This beer is nice with a light dinner or loaded baked potato. Easy on the palate and stomach.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On a flight to Seattle. 33cl can poured into a nice plastic cup. Pours clear golden with a collapsing, white head. The weak aroma contains wet corn or maize, some hops. It tastes light bitter, and that’s about it. Very short finish, watery texture, thin body, soft carbonation. What I call water with ambition.

I mean it's better than bud light but I don't like it as much as coors or pbr. Of all the cheap domestics, this is not the worst IMO 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Miller Lite: Both the flavor and body are akin to what it would be like if somebody who ate Doritos and blueberry yogurt four hours ago belched into your face.

It's a beer what's all this flavor talk no matter the beer drink enough they are all good 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft into plastic cup. Mostly head but once that went minimal aroma and flavor. Creamy mouthfeel from all the head. Ok quaffer 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can at a festival. Metallic, corn, wet grsin. Lemon ght, not much flavor. Watery.
One of my favorite Lite and all time Beers from ... my Drinking Days!!!

IF I ever drink this style of beer, it’s this one or PBR. I get a slight but very muted pilsner flavoring. Pale straw coloring, pleasant though weak aroma. Can actually detect some hops. Overall better than Buttwiper but any of these beers don’t rate high because they are just not good beers. If you want flavorless beer for hot day or just don’t actually like beer, then this may be your ticket.

Although this is definitely not in my top 5 light beers, I however still find myself craving Miller Lite at times. As a lot of people's exclusive favorite, I do respect what Miller brings to the table.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On draft at Austin Airport. Pours crystal clear yellow with a solid white head that lasts. Corn, slight green apple skins nose. Aqueous mouthfeel, average carbonation.

Good beer to drink when you don't want to spend a lot or get too drunk, better than Bud for sure

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pale gold with a short-lived white head. Aroma is mildly yeasty. Light bready flavor. Minimal bitterness with a short finish. Perfection, if you are looking for a bland, neutral, uninspired, insipid liquid to drink.
In the beer world we all know where it stands. This beer is for binge drinking at parties and while tailgating. The type of beer you drink after your 6 pack of real beer is finished.

Served on tap at Miller Park. Clear golden color with a white head. A little grain aroma. Not much flavor. I guess some grain. Very light body. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Canned. Pours like piss and looks like it. Tastes like it too. Light as expected.
Better than Bud light! Good for barbecues, getting shitty with your friends. Better than bud.

Bottle poured to pint glass very cold beer 	
Appearance: Light yellow, big white foam 	
Aroma: scent smell of malt, nothing else 	
Taste: not really great, watery	
Mouth feel: very carbonated 	
Overall: good beer, repeat: no look for: no
drank:

Cheap beer, easy go to for an okay buzz. Similar to bud light. Grab a case of bottles and make sure they are ice cold. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clean, golden clear, bubbly and corny. A thin and unimaginative macro brew just like the rest.
My favorite american light beer, not saying much all ratings right down the middle.

Malt Bomb. Flavor is sweet, malty. No hopps. Hard to even drink. Had at the all blacks rugby game 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Yellow, small head, buttery aroma, bread, vegetables, honey, flavor of cardboard, water, bread, newspaper, light bodied.
Bottle at club america, miami airport. Golden color, white head. Aroma has malts. Taste is watery malts, far away there is hint of hops. Not off flavors.

12-ounce bottles in a glass. Knew what I was getting into, but still hadn’t tried it yet, so... Anyway, as in most mass-produced light lagers there was little in the way of flavor. Not as bad as Bud Light, though.
[backlog] 31-03-16 // 946ml bottle shared in Cancun. Not much to say as it taste like nothing. Water with light grains.
NOT(This carefully crafted pilsner uses the finest ingredients and brewing techniques to ensure rich, full-bodied beer taste at only 96 calories)

16 oz can at my house, brought by somebody because they heard I love beer. Pouring this would feel wrong, so I didn’t. Kinda a cool can. Vintage look. Probably the most memorable quality going on here. Drinking this tonight because I felt like eating a little healthier for a change. Just this once. Somewhat typical pale lager aroma, but doesn’t stink, or have anything that screams skunk. Crisp, watery, apple hinted grains with a doubled watery finish. Working my way slowly through these cans, it seems to be a post workout cool down beverage over anything else. Not a whole lot of structure or any real flavor to truly build from. It’s a beer for someone who potentially likes beer, but is in no way ready for commitment. A beer for someone who thinks of growlers as pitchers-to-go. I can jokingly shit on this beer for hours, but really, it’s drinkable, and a top 10 percentile in adjunct lagers, despite being a bottom 10 percent in beer in general. It’s not like some of these pale lagers that taste like the melted ice from the urinal. Horrible situation to be in. Not really here. This beer is wonderfully vacuous and platitudinous. I’ll surly drink this again someday.

12 oz. can from The Burris’. Drank in SE Indiana while watching fireworks and listening to classic rock. Aroma: Only the slightest reference to grain and hop; on the plus side, there isn’t a lot of in your face adjunct action going on. Appearance: Can. Flavor: It’s truly amazing how this can taste like nearly nothing... matches the nose. Palate: Lite body, sticky texture, lively carbonation, abrupt finish. Overall: Pretty much the perfect mindless party beverage. In terms of sheer beer enjoyment, however, it ranks pretty darn low.
0,33 bottle at a hotel bar in detroit - Not much here. It’s a light beer that tastes like nothing. Slight corn maybe.
Not much going on here. Poor overall. Would not buy again unless I was pretty desperate.
Refreshing when served ice cold in the dessert, however not much aroma nor taste. Clear and pale appearance.

RE rating. Its worse than my previous review. its bad, man.

330 ml bottle. Bought in a Jumbo supermarket in Santiago. Really clear color with decent head.little smell, grass, not specially bad. Super waterish and tasteless, i cannot say it’s bad since it’s like drinking water. Not taste in the beggining or the end. For 4,2% it’s actually kind of surprising. Not my kind of thing, but for a person that doesn’t like beer in the beach i guess it’s ok. Probably the bad ratings comes from the bias of commercial beer than many americans have.

Pours a yellow color with a white foam head. Aroma is bread and I got something metallic. Flavor is sweet bread, a little too sweet. Has a thin body. I don’t mind this for a little bit, such as if it’s the only beer being served at a wedding, but the more I drink the less I like it.
Can, Ann Arbor, MI via Kroger. Yellow, frothy head. Very little aroma. Corn and faint pepper. Carbonated sweet flavour. Nothing offensive but very little to say about it.

This is terrible. Why do people drink this? Nothing is good about this.

Can 0,355ltr: Clear golden colored brew with an beery taste, somehow. throw it in the freezer for its freezing, then it’s an decent thirstquenchinger

New york
Clear yellow, small white head.
Aroma of oat and honey

Er hangt een vreemde geur aan, bekend maar ik kom er niet op. De kkleur is mooi blond, er is niet veel schuim op als je hem uitschenkt. Niet enorm veel smaak aan, maar nog wel ok als dorstlesser. De beste van de 3 light-bieren dat ik vandaag gedronken heb

Originally rated on 6/25/08. Not the worst of the light beers out there, its just what you expect from that type of beer, not much flavor, watery, and cheap. Good for a large gathering especially in hot weather.
Tap at Hotel bar, Portland. Colour is clear light orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, sweetness and malts.
Another "sex in canoe" beer. Clean and clear as every lite beer. Slightly better than Bud Lite.
I’m seriously trying to be objective here and I really think while sitting here that Miller lite is better than Bud Light
Can. Take it for what it is. Easy drinking, surprisingly not offensive. The usual disgusting corn taste is not there. Decent carbonation. This is my go to summer baseball/lawn mowing beer.
Has a clear yellow color. Minimal carbonation and mouthfeel. Tastes like any other horrible American macro lager

Had a while back. Rating from memory. Pours a clear light yellow with a white head. Slight aromas of corn malt. Taste the same with some hop at the finish. Brewed about a mile from my house. Smells so good in the air to taste so bland in the bottle.

Can. Was gifted to myself. Hadn’t had it since the college days and the first one in a long time i didn’t run through a funnel or shotgun :) Kind of like carbonated tea or sweet water. I don’t hate it but after 10+ years of enjoying craft beer it has no flavor.

What can you say. Nothing t review here everyone knows what Miller lite is and what they are gettibf

Rated from old notes. Starts weak, fizzy, but lacking any noteable taste. This unfortunate start worsens as a metallic taste develops that persists to the very end. Avoid if at all possible.
I had it from the bottle. The taste is corn malt. It’s pretty crisp and inoffensive. Of all the major light beers, this might be the best. That’s not saying much though.
Actually thought that this beer is much better than its reputation. The corn malt really delivers a sweet and refreshing lager.

Pale straw appearance, very clear. Large white head. Aroma is very faint, vaguely unpleasant. Taste is corn I guess, a canned corn flavor, though not much of that. Mouthfeel is light (big surprise ) and oddly less carbonated than I expected - I guess all the CO2 went to the head. Definitely better gulped than sipped - this beer may be okay with picnic foods on a hot day, but it does not stand up to  fussing.

pours clear light gold with a small white cap offering some retention and lacing. pale grains, adjuncts, white grape juice, grass, hint of sweetness - pear juiceand sweet grass; very chalky, some booze even at this abv, clean. moderate carbonation - loose, light body - watery; semi-sweet and bland herbal finish. nothing offensive, of course. clean.

Pours a pleasant honey color with a sparse head. Slightly nutty aroma. This beer is shockingly better than I expected it to be. I rated it overall average, but I expected it to be sub sub sub sub sub below average, so I was surprised.

This is my go to cheap session beer. Yes it's a bit watery but it has a bit of grain flavor that I like. Great summer beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Most flavor out of the major, light beers. My go to beer for a regular night of drinking.
At a tasting, many thanks! Smallish head, clear deepish yellow color, very light malty aroma with some cardboard, almost no flavor, hint of bitterness, not much different to water.
Palate marginally better than Coors Light. Other than that...not much going on, except a few less calories.

12 Fl. Oz. Bottle at the Grain Exchange (Slayton, MN). Of course I have tried this one before, however never rated it. Thank God for good company... This beer poured clear, yellow small white head. Aroma of grain. Taste metallic, grain quite sweet. It serves it’s purpose but certainly nothing special.
Aus der Dose und Flasche.  Strohgelbe Farbe, wenig Schaum. Kaum Aroma. Mais, Getreide. Geschmack wässerig süss. Kaum herb, kein Abgang. Eiskalt ok.
Pours a clear straw with minimal head. Smell is soggy cardboard, stale bread. Taste is sweet but muted - mildly bitter - no prominent characteristics - a bit of grassiness, cereal.

12 oz can. BB Nov/30/15. From a store at the hotel lobby, Honolulu, HI.

Clear yellow golden color with a small white head. 
Mild dry grassy hops and earthy malty aroma. 
The flavor is dry earthy maltiness. Boring.
Only slightly better than the 64 version. Some sweet grains but that is it no hops no bitterness very lean watery grainy stuff.

Bottle to glass. How have I never ticked this?! Pours crystal clear, pale straw, one inch of white head that dies quickly. Nose is mostly neutral with a faint corn/rice note. Super clean. Taste is pretty much the same. Carbonation is a little aggressive to the point of being boring on the tongue, while the body is very thin.

I finally found it. A can of history. This is it, the original light (lite?) beer. I caught this whale in an ice bucket by the 10th tee box at the Glastonbury Hills Country club, sitting there by itself among royalty (the King of Beers) and some green canned foreign invader from Amsterdam. 

I cracked open the holy grail and was immediately hit with an aroma of skunk shit of biblical proportions. It must have eaten a bunch of saltines and corn. I took a sip and was overwhelmed with sugar, corn, and skunk flavor. The slogan Great Taste, Less Filling does not seem to be true at all. It was a bad taste, and filled me with the urge to vomit. I casually dumped the clear golden contents out onto the cart path as to not offend others, only to realize that I probably just poisoned a colony of poor ants that didn’t deserve that fate. I reserved my seat in hell, but at least I didn’t have to finish the beer.

can, flying the friendly skies from houston to munich. according to the label, a "pilsner style beer" although i would question whether any of those 3 words apply. very pale golden with a quick head; aroma of wet metal, no sign of the "saaz and pacific northwest hops claimed; fizzy, almost entirely devoid of flavour; put me to sleep
Bottle. Clear golden yellow beer with a small white head. Aroma is spicy with notes of hay, green apples, grains and metal. Flavor is spicy with notes of hay, grains, rice and grass. Well balanced.
Drank out of the bottle. Only a barely adequate taste. Very carbonated. Has a distinct aroma but not much flavor.
Lite yellow appearance with a white head. Typical American pilsner. Easy to drink on a hot summer day.
0,33l bottle @ Migration 2015 poster session. Pours very pale golden with a medium head. Aroma and flavor are weak grassy malts. Bad, but not quite undrinkable.
12 oz. can. Pours golden with small white head. Aroma is metallic. Taste is watered down, gets worse as it warms.

[Can (355ml)] I don’t remember who gave this to me, whoever you are, thanks? Pours a clear, bubbly pale straw-gold with a large diminishing fluffy white head. The head looks kind of weird as it dissolves. Mild sugary aroma along with grain, an odd vegetal note, light grassy notes and cardboard. Mild watery flavour of sweet grain, a hint of grassiness and then perhaps the shortest lightest finish I’ve experienced. Bland as hell. Nothing really foul in the flavour so there’s that at least. Light bodied. 96 calories is still too many calories for this.

I’ve got to respectfully disagree with this getting a zero. It has so little flavor and mouthfeel that it is not capable of being patently nasty. Aroma is a bit corny. It’s so clear that you can see to the bottom of the can. This under arching beer is good warm or ice cold and can be enjoyed in more simple way than other American light beers because it is somehow even closer to being water than they are.
Favorite off the big three, bud light tastes like corn, colors is fine and miller was my moms favorite so this is what I’ll drink at a Pirates game.
Bottle. Yellow with a small white head. Aroma is sweet with some corn and light malt. Flavor is light, as expected. Full bodied, yea right. But terrible? Nah. Smell of nada

25oz can from Smiths 

Pours clear straw golden with a small white head, no lacing. Aroma of corn and wet grain. Taste of wheat, sweet malts and grassy 

Not terrible, I did finish the can

473 ml can from TBS, served cold in a tulip glass. 



App.: Clear light golden with a so-so white head.
 
Aroma: Vaguely grainy, boiled cereals, maybe a little Noble hops?
 
Palate: Medium body, moderate-ish carbonation.
 
Flav.: Kinda wet cardboard, cereals, no hop flavour, clean; dry with minimal bitterness and a watery finish.



Typical American light lager.
Drank a ton of this crap in college....not good but very cheap and funds were always low...memory rating....(#559)
Not much going on here. Poor overall. Would not buy again unless I was pretty desperate.
Cannot really tell the difference between this and any other beer like this, pretty bad unless you are playing beer pong

Pours a pale golden colour with big bubble carbonation, a foamy white head which actually holds up pretty good and gives out lots of lace. Grainy nose with corn notes, so more smell than most cheap light beers. The taste is a little more watered down, but still better than other big macro lite brew. As always, Miller is the one I prefer of the big 3 breweries of the States. Always a notch better. Better than Coors light and Bud light just does not have any taste.

Can bought at an LCBO in Toronto/Canada out of curiosity. I knew it is going to be bad but I had no idea. Flavored, or better unflavored water that tastes better when you urinate it than when you drink it. Yuck!

355 ml can. Clear pale straw yellow, thin white foam. Muted grainy corny aroma and taste, litely sweet, thin and aqueous. Average carbonation, lite bodied, no hopped. Better from the can, and actually drinkable on a stinkin’ hot golf course. ⛳️👎🏼 LF (Lagerboy Friendly)
As far as a light beer goes this is not bad. It has a very light color little aroma but more taste then any Budweiser product. If you need to drink a light beer I guess this will do

21 June 2015, bottle. Yellow, clear, steady bubbles. Nose is slightly sweet, soapy. Thin body and mildly creamy and fizzy. Light, and really watery. There isn't much of anything here. Lightly sweet, a tad soapy/floral. This is almost water.

Can. Yes, it’s true, this fine example of 1970s American brewing prowess is now available in Canada. Should we be excited? Let’s find out! It looks OK in the glass - a nice bright straw-gold with a good sized white head - although there’s little head retention, and it dissolves quickly to a scummy looking film. Aroma of sweet grain, a hint of apple, and a very faint grassy note. Flavour starts with sweet grain, and then... nothing. Absolutely nothing. And the body is so light that if it weren’t for a faint cold sensation in my throat as the beer goes down, I would swear that it was just evaporating in my mouth. It’s quite fascinating, really. Still a shitty beer, mind you - but fascinating nonetheless...

Can. Thanks to my brother I had ample opportunity this weekend to discover why I like craft beer so much. The corn sweetness of this light beer was the only thing that made me know I was drinking a beer. His favorite, not mine.

Aroma of a sticky bar room floor. Taste is very one note. Grain with a bitter finish. After taste just hangs around to the point of being kind of gross. Mouth is very light. Not interesting at all. Very easy to drink, but not really that enjoyable.

Clear crystal light gold with a fizzy, fast dissipating white head. Odd aroma with something akin to that pseudo chlorine-ones from dry vermouth, and basic lagery blandness. Flavor is crisp and way too light, with that funny dry chlorine note again, and very light.
Had some great memories drinking this and watching the Red Wings playing in college. But i would take water over this now.

23rd May 2015: straight from the bottle after walking along San Clemente Pier. Sat in the sun at The Fisherman’s Restaurant and Bar shore side on the pier. Most likely golden, but couldn’t really tell through the brown bottle. Corn, grain and wet cardboard in the nose and taste: got worse as it warmed in the afternoon sun. Nice to sit and people watch, but the beer wasn’t up to much and I doubt very much I will ever see the inside of a Miller Lite bottle again.
Drunk from can. Smell of starch, some malt. Aroma of paper, starch, some grain. Very watery palate, light body. Wild carbon, mildly bitter. Just as boring as beer could ever get.

This is one of those go-to cheap beers that you kind of either love or hate. For what it is, it’s got flavor (just not much of it) and that’s something for a light beer. Drinkable and watery, not too complex taste or anything.
Aromat słodowy, dość słodki. Smaku brak, totalna pustka. W odczuciu woda gazowana.

Used to have the odd one yrs ago in 24oz cans and thought it was ok on a hot day if hardly did it, reliving it from a pint can 4% not the worst smell not the best smell. Very filling. Not anywhere as good as I used to like it but not even close to the worst beer but way too filling for a 4% light beer for me. I dont need this beer.

355ml brown bottle. Label says 4% abv. Clear yellow, completely disappearing white head. Sweet malt nose. Watery and almost tasteless, just fleeting hints of straw and minerals. Not much of a finish. Fizzy. Bland, I’ve had worse...
Sweet light cider smell. Tastes like almost nothing besides yeast. Watery but easy to drink.
Poured from can into pilsner glass, light slightly gold-like yellow in color. Corn and barley are very much there, light.

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- Corn and some hops, not bad for mass produced
Appearance- Has a nice golden yellow color with a small white head
Taste- A surprisingly flavorful American Adjunct Lager, don’t expect a craft beer flavor but it is very refreshing.
Palate- A light bodied beer with heavy carbonation
Overall- A very good AAL, if you rate it outside of that I think you aren’t being fair in your judgement.
Straw colored. Faint grain aroma. Standard macro pale ale sweet, corny, grainy, plain, watery. Watching hockey.
Pours a clear straw color, light bright white head. Aroma is fairly non-existent, straw? Flavor is beer beer and more beer. Of the light variety.
4/2/15 (Draft - Finley Dunnes Chicago) - Pale pour, no noticeable aroma. Minimal taste and feel, smooth and clean taste and feel.

Pours with a thick poofy white head like you?d expect from the highly carbonated light beer.  Straw colored and very clear.  Head retention is okay, lacing is poor, but there is some.

Aroma is pretty malty and grainy.  Newspaper, bread crust, faint hops.

Taste is malty, leaning sweet.  Some spicy hops.  Also some spicy ops.

Mouthfeel is light bodied.  A little papery.  Lively carbonation tickles the mouth, and also increases spiciness of the hops.  Very clean, sessionable.

Overall, I think this is better than Bud Light or Coors Light, and I rated it a little higher to reflect that. Not a bad beer at all, one of my go-to beers.
incredibly refreshing and lite but a little bit pee flavoured. Like off flavoured water. Not horrendous.
From a 7oz nip bottle, because it was in the fridge get off me! Stale malt and corn flavor. Ok time to head out to the backyard with my chips and top the tatter!
A hair better than bud light. Drink cold to experience the best corn to rice ratio. Knock back the whole bottle in less than 5 minutes or be introduced to metallic and chemical tastes abound.
That was my first foreign beer. Bought in a "Pewex" in 1986 maybe. It blew my mind then. A taste of America in a communist country.

Can - drank straight from the can, but I’m sure it’s a typical pale lager looking beer, definitely a typical tasting light macro lager, come on, you know what this tastes like, it’s Miller Lite for goodness sake, LOL!
Tried and true lite beer I can drink all day. Obviously nothing fancy, but a great everyday drink.

It's a clean light lager that has never given me a hangover. It is the only acceptable domestic. When $ is tight this'll do in a pinch.

это пиво очень вкусно. я бы, конечно, рекомендую его всем. пожалуйста, обратитесь его. очень хорошо!
For a lite lager this one actually has some flavor. The malt stand out along with a good heaping of green apples. Is what it is.

Straw and corn, only less so due to this being lite. Watery body. Easy to drink a dozen or so in a sitting but why would you want to? Special thanks to my wifes relatives for ensuring there was plenty of this and only this around last night.
Pours a pale straw from a bottle. Not much to say about this lager, drink it cold on a warm or hot day, preferably while cooking on a grill.

Appearance: pours a 1" white head that drops rapidly with very faint lacing. Color is clear pale straw with plenty of streaming carbonation.
Aroma: mild corn sweetness and water.
Mouthfeel: light and fairly crisp.
Flavor: some corn sweetness, a bit of lightly toasted barley, no hops discernible.
Overall: it is what it is. No off flavors and not offensive but not much different from mineral water either.

pours a straw yellow with a medium white head. actually some decent lacing.  aroma is faint hay. Taste is slightly sweet and watery. Not much hop or anything else presence. Slightly sweet finish. Adequate alcohol delivery system. 20 years ago I thought this was good.  I’ve since evolved.
Pale straw colour very transparent. Very little on the nose, hint of yeast. Taste is very very thin, perhaps a hint of corn.

Sweet corn aroma. Appearance is a clear pale yellow with a good head and retention. Flavor is crisp with some corn sweetness. Hop bitterness is low. Mouthfeel is very light and carbonation is medium. It's a good american light lager.

I haven’t had a miller lite in ages, and now I know why... Not very good, and somewhat hard to drink.
I’ve always contended that this is the best of the mass produced shitte. It still sucks, but after a very long day that also involved driving for almost 9 hours this beer hits the spot.
Its like they took and mixed 1 part beer with 4 parts water. A watery chalk like taste. The only thing this has for it is its ad campaign.

Sampled from a bottle in whilst working in Chicago.Very pale colour and little aroma. The taste is rather sweet and very bland. It has little bitterness, and doesn’t really taste of anything at all. Better than Bud, but not by much.
nice pale in colour and that’s where the goodness of this beer stops sadly its not a good beer not much in taste not for me this one

Light is the key here, as it really tastes like nothing. Can’t believe I haven’t yet had the delight of rating this gem. I had one the other day at a hockey game and the best part was that the aftertaste was so bad it made the Molson Canadian I had afterwards taste amazing. Super tall can at the Caps game, but unfortunately they didn’t beat Calgary.

Poured from a 12 oz can into a Sam Adams glass. Big 3 finger head that goes away quickly. Straw yellow just what you would expect from a BMC beer. Aroma is mostly of corn sweetness very underwhelming. Taste, this is where this beer shines. Very clean and crisp with really no off flavors. I would say this is the best of the Bud, Miller, Coors "light" beers. Doesn’t make is good in the grand scheme of things but not awful by any means.
Pours a clear light gold color with no head retention and lacing. Tastes of corn and sweet malt. Nothing special here and this is barely average. Eh...
Birra veramente pessima, che non ha alcuna qualità. Riso bollito al naso, lo stesso alla bocca e poco altro se non la frizzantezza e la secchezza finale. Birra da lasciar perdere.

Bottle at some hole in wall casino in. Duluth. What I expected, not very good with no flavor or aroma. Real cold in a hot day I could maybe drink another if free. Update: having one on a hot, humid summer evening.  Bump up the rating a bit. Still on the low end of pale lagers, gets worse as it warms. Drink cold and fast. 

Update - still not a great beer but now my IPA phase is gone and I'm drinking more lagers it's really not bad.
Another typical light beer and I think this is the most skunky of the light beers. Tastes like carboard with rice. No aroma presence at all.

One of the finer piss beers. Aroma has just the faintest hint of a nice citrus hop with some great pale lager cardboard and dish soap to detract. Pours like sparkling water and light blonde. Taste follows the aroma with a hint of lemon zest and pine and then the garbage that follows. Easily the most effort I’ve seen put into a macro pale lager. Can’t believe this is the first time I’m rating this.
Was the first beer I drank when I turned 21 in the 90’s and still like it. There is better beers out there but a good one to fall back on.
Can. Time to rate another macro to officially say I’ve had it. Pale golden color, mild malt aroma. Light body, thin texture, watery taste. Barely beer.

Bottle at Smith’s Olde Bar in Atlanta. My friends (who have no taste) ordered a large bucket of this beer at the bar while watching the Steelers game. Has the appearance and taste of brown water. Hints of corn and malts. Very light bodied. I didn’t want to drink it, but I had to help them finish the bucket. On the plus side, I didn’t have to pay for it.
this is the wateriest of watery beers. makes Michelob ultra taste like a full bodied ale. Again, why drink it...or make it for that matter?"

Best consumed in less than a minute. After that, you may start to taste something. Good beer if you just got done mowing the yard. Fizzy and yellow, smells of roasted malt and corn. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A pale blonde lager withv a thin white head. In aroma, adjunct laced malt with light devilish sulfur, light hops. In mouth, inoffensive, light watery malt with memories of hops. Free bottle at Copa lounge in PTY.
Not sure of the difference between Miller Lite and water but I know you can drink an unlimited amount. An unlimited session beer.
Listen this is simply a party brew, no need to over analyze. Just drink and don’t worry about taste
Uuugh. Tastes like a worse version of Miller genuine draft. Lighter. Fizzy and poorly flavored

16 oz draft pour in a standard pint glass at Ashburn Pub. Didn’t really get much on the aroma, pretty bland there. Tastes of light citrus, sweet malt, maybe a touch of sweet corn. Light body with a semi-dry finish. Light mouthfeel. Medium carbonation. Not offensive to me surprisingly but maybe the tequila shot helped. Doubt I’ll drink this again but I’d pick it over Bud Light if I were forced to drink one of the two.

Purchased a six pack to drink while watching NASCAR during an overnight stop on the way to Key West. The fact that I drank this while watching a sporting event with the knowledge that I would be in Key West in 24 hours put me in a good mood, hence the rating higher than 0.0.

A few sips stolen from my Dads bottle…. not kidding. It pours a nice light gold color, very clear with a white head. More color and head retention than I expected. The aroma has light grains and cardboard. Hints of DMS creamed corn, malt and acetaldehyde. Light though… not horribly offensive. Pretty dry with hints of noble hops. Honestly, one of the better BMC lights. Not terrible.
12 ounce can because Matt Wilson decided to leave a ton of these at my house. Sweet corn beer without much else going on. Still, I’ve had worse.

There is nothing better than Sunday NFL Football, wings, and Miller Lite on draft. Most people are Team Coke. Few people are Team Pepsi... In the battle of Bud vs. Miller I'm Captain Miller all day every Sunday. 

In terms of the beer specifically, Miller Lite is definitely a cut above Bud Light.

If you ever see me with a can/bottle of Miller Light know that I am in a dark place. This beer lands somewhere on the scale between self deprecation and suicide. It's the Justin Bieber of beers. Overhyped with no substance and an inflated sense of self, leaving us to later wonder why we would ever subject ourselves to such an abomination in the first place.

If I was still in high school I would have rated this much higher. But I am not so....
Pours clear with a hint of yellow and a small bubbly head. Some grain and grass aroma. Slightly sweet grass and grain flavor. Very light body and average carbonation. Stale grain finish.
Draft at the brewery. Clear gold, medium white head. Aroma of water. Taste of water with a background of water, slight watery finish. Designed to not fill your belly, so you can buy and drink more.

Want to hate it, but can’t. The slight malt sweetness and slight alkaline finish make this eminently drinkable among the American super-macros. That must be why the otherwise sensible Scandinavians have it as a featured brew in the SAS Lounge at Newark Airport :)
Honestly, this is delicious like water. Nice beautiful golden color. Clear, no head. Easy grain flavor, like corn nuts. The only bad thing is a slightly metallic flavor through the finish.
Can on golf course at CFA outing. Good ice cold but not as good as Coors Light........

My mother in law left some of these in my fridge over the weekend so in the name of science I thought I would review one. The pour is light pee yellow with a small head that disappears almost immediately. The carbonation is on the heavy side. Aroma is sweet corn and grass. The taste....it’s a crappy lager not much to say. Generally these types of beers are inoffensive and very watery. This is definitely watery but it also has a spoiled off-taste. Just gross.
Just figured out I’ve never rated this. Can pour very light yellow. Nose generic sweet and adjunct. Taste sonar to nose with a little more grainy flavor. No finish.
I have had seltzer water with more flavor. This stuff is brewed about 12 miles from my house. I was given some at a Chamber meeting where I was speaking. When I had a chance, I poured it out.
Watery corn taste. I think it’s better than Coors light, which is just water. About the only thing it’s good for is college parties and soaking wood chips for the smoker.
Watery and cheap, like most American light beer but a step above Coors light or Bud light.

Corny. I once drank Miller lite, I found a treasure map and looked for ancient gold. I didn’t find it, but the adventure I had carrying a whip and wearing a hat made memories that can’t be beat. Or was that Indiana Jones?

Look: pours a yellow straw color. White head. No lacing.
Smell: corn. Very sweet. Malt.
Taste: sweet malt. Corn. 
Feel: very thin. Light mouthful. High carbonation
Overall: good feet to drink in mass quantities. Good for a hot day.
First drank: long time ago.

Poured from keg at a party into clear plastic cup. A pale yellow with short lasting white head and some lace even with it in plastic. Aroma is faint malt and corn. Taste is corn, light malt and it had a metallic aftertaste. While not offensive it's not good either.
Pours bland yellow, I suppose, I got it in a bottle. Aroma of light rye, corn and citrus. Bland slightly malty taste. Non-existent body. But only 96 calories!

It pours a pale golden with a head that disappeared quickly with no lacing. It has a grass and a yeast aroma. It almost has no taste, which is dominated by the carbonation of the beer itself. There is too much carbonation with not enough flavor with is not clean on the palate.

Can to blue solo cup with my name written in marker, you know, to keep it classy. Pour is clear golden with a thing white head that leaves a general filminess hanging out on top. Aroma is beer, stadium seats in the summer, and corn. Taste is carbonated corn. Finish is smooth withs tons of cleansing carbonation. Overall, it's a macro. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Almost flavorless but not crisp or clean enough to be called refreshing. Some sore throat follows. Generally unpleasant.

I can honestly say after years and years debating which is the best (or the worst depending on how you wanna look at it) of the Big American Macros, (Bud, Miller, Coors) I think this one is the least offensive. If there’s free beer being offered and in the cooler there’s a Coors light, Bud light, and Miller Lite, I’m grabbing the Miller...that’s all I have to say on this matter...

The number one seller (by the bottle) when I was bartending on sixth street in Austin Texas. Here, at least 50% of my customers were college kids - this was early 1990’s. You could do a lot worse on a hot night and a college budget. The bottles help with the heat by cooling your hand down. This beer it is what it is, consistently. At that time, this outsold Bud Light by at least two to one. End of night 30 empty cases of Miller Lite and 12 empty cases of Bud Light. Says here total score I will give this is 1.5 out of 5. But if it’s 90+ degrees at midnight, and you are on a low budget, this is a 4 out of 5
Bottle to pint on cruise in the Med. Pale yellow, thin white head. Mild malt aroma and taste. Not much going on here...
Big can at Sun Life Stadium. Surprisingly refreshing. No off flavours, easy and crisp. Nothing wrong here but it is not packing a lot of punch. If this was not Miler it would be getting decent votes.

Can poured into a glass. Pours a nice pale golden hay with a fluffy white head that eventually dissipates, but leave a bit of sheeting. Aroma is grass, corn, cereal, sugar. Taste is light and grassy, a bit of green apple, light bitterness. Lots of lingering green apple and bitterness.

Bottle. Pours very light, pale yellow with minuscule white head. Aroma is very large tush, wheat, slightly sweet. Taste is really...crappy. Touch of citrus hops, but mostly just crappy sweetness with...some kinda beer flavoring....it’s nasty.

The taste was the cooked corn. There was no aftertaste and it left a super watery finish.
On the palate, well it does say "lite" so it doesn’t what Miller wants to as it that. The carbonation is not bad for the style and okay to me.

This rating is a higher than most I have read about Miller/Bud/Coors. I believe beer should first be rated against its style (in this case BJCP style 1A Lite American Lager). Miller Lite is listed as a standard for the style. 

The beer should have little to no aroma, although it can be slightly malty, slightly grainy, with no to light hop presence. Check.

It should be very pale straw to yellow color. Brilliantly clear. Check.

The flavor should be crisp and dry. Balanced between malty and hoppy. High level of carbonation. Check. Miller Lite is cleaner and more hoppy than Coors and Bud Light, which are maltier/sweeter. I prefer the balance tilted more toward hops. This beer finishes cleaner and crisper than the others.

Light mouthfeel, refreshing. Check.

I prefer 100’s of other beers for one or two pints, but if I am having more, Miller Lite deserves much credit as a session beer or the beer to drink after a few heavier craft beers.
If there were a 0 rating option, I would give it a 0. This is piss in a can. I have never tasted my own urine, but I imagine it tastes like this.

I poured a 24oz can into a large mug. It had an expiration date of 4/14/14 and cost $1.81 ($0.08 per ounce).



Appearance: White gold hue, crystal clear body with carbonation visible. Pours to a large, bright white, fluffy head which never completely dissipates and leaves minor lacing.



Smell: Corn-forward lager, though not very pungent. Nothing off-putting.



Taste: Miller Lite was the beer that invented the light beer style. This company has the most experience making this type of beer, and of the three major macro breweries they probably do it best. That’s not to say this particular brew is amazing or anything. In fact, I couldn’t honestly give it a thumbs up, but I would describe it as more than tolerable, but not quite average. 



It begins with an extremely subtle malt character. It’s pale as can be, though it does offer a hint of sweetness. Perhaps some biscuit or cracker character can be detected, though it is not starchy per se. Corn is of course quite prominent, but it is reserved compared to Coors Light. No tang or sharpness here. No hops either, though that’s par for the course.



Drinkability: I remember seeing commercials for this beer when I was a kid that said "Great taste, less filling!" While the first part of the statement is patently false, the second half is true. At only 4.2% ABV, Miller Lite is indeed chuggable and sessionable. Though the delivery is suspect - the mouthfeel is thin, watery and tepid - which is a bit of a turn-off. It’s refreshing while in the mouth and finishes clean, so I guess it does what it’s supposed to do.

Tap: I used to think this beer was "venturing out of the box", back when all I drank was Bud Light. To be honest, I was never a fan of Miller back in the day, but now, I’d say it’s slightly better than Bud Light. It lacks that insane, corn-y sweetness that Bud Light has once it gets above 35°F. It still isn’t a good beer... Slightly skunky, metallic, stale hoppage, grainy pilsner malt... but it’s chokable in a sticky situation, & it hopefully won’t make you gag too much.

Saw they brought back the vintage cans, got nostalgic and brought a 6 pack of 16 oz. cans in tribute to my late dad (his favorite back in the day). Typically I avoid light beers, although I've had this probably a million times, mainly because it's usually one 3 beers available at most events ( Bud Light (no thanks) or Coors Light (dear god!)). Anyway, pours a typical pilsner; golden body with a medium head. Aroma is corn, slight hops and grass. Taste is watery hops, with some grains. Finishes clean, and as they say "less filling". Not at all impressive, but by no means the worst I've had. Cheers Dad.

Aroma - Very absent of much any aroma. Slightly metallic and piney.

Appearance - Pale yellow, rather clear but with some slight carbonation. There is very little head, but it is white.

Taste - Lightly sweet, with little bitterness, behind a metallic alcohol flavor. While unpleasant, I’ve certainly tasted worse.

Palate - A body lacking any density, and very thin in texture. The slight carbonation is the only thing going on.

Overall - Honestly, there is very little happening in this beer. Of the pale lager family, I know I have had worse beers, which prevented me from rating Miller Lite any worse. The simple fact that there are worse beers are this one’s only saving grace. I know this falls into the type of beer that one can rationalize drinking it by saying "hey, its a cheap beer! It’s great for getting drunk at this cost!" If thats the issue there are certainly higher ABV beers with similar cost - or cost/ABV. I would avoid it.

While obviously more palatable than Natural Light or Milwaukee’s Best, when stacked up against it’s immediate peers, poorly crafted but somewhat overpriced best-sellers, Miller Lite comes in just behind Bud Light and perhaps a little better than Coors Lite, though it sports less character than the latter.

This is only a decent beer when compared with Bud Light and Coors Light (and their little brothers).  If you have the need to drink 8 or more beers at a sitting, then this is worth considerarion, otherwise, no.

I would actually give this a higher score if I could, but I’m trying to keep a tiny bit of credibility.
There is nothing wrong with Miller Lite, if that is what you’re intending to drink.  You can’t score it on aroma or palate, it’s a domestic light beer!  You can only compare it to other domestic lights out there (Bud Light, Coors Light) and in that arena it blows the competition away.  It’s refreshing and easy to drink, and offers a lot more taste than other Lights.
I usually grab a 12-pack of Miller Lites when I’m anticipating a long day of football or playoff hockey, because I can drink a dozen of them in a sitting and still operate heavy machinery, or my remote.
The fact is, this type of beer shouldn’t even be on this website.  Haters hate, but the fact that people are attempting to compare Miller Lite to something from Bell’s or Founder’s is inane.

Plenty of people have pointed out its flaws, so instead I’ll take a look at its history. 

If you’re looking for a scapegoat of the dark ages of American brewing, Miller Lite is a viable candidate. Originally released in 1967 under the name Garblinger’s Diet Beer, produced by Rheingold Brewery in New York, then sold to Chicago’s Meister Brau Brewery and called Meister Brau Lite, the recipe was eventually acquired and tweaked by Miller in Milwaukee. 

From there, "Lite Beer from Miller" propelled Miller Brewing to become the 2nd largest beer producer in America by the mid 70’s. More specifically, advertising for Miller Lite created by big name firms like McCann-Erickson and Fallon muscled Miller into household name status. By way of celebrity advertising featuring the likes of Rodney Dangerfield and Bob Uecker, and catchy slogans like "great taste, less filling," Miller Lite broke into a male demographic that had previously shunned watered down beers. The loud, repetitive, antagonistic nature of those famous Miller Lite commercials were the hypnosis that rocked the beer psyche. Thus, it was the first mainstream lite beer, and under the heavy hand of marketing (remember the sense of male helplessness after seeing the 2002 "Catfight" commercial, which may have marked the final heyday of macrobrewing; or go to the Miller brewery itself where they still show a circa 90s bro-centric Millertime promotional video at the tour kickoff) the United States entered a 25-30 year comatose of beer mediocrity. 

Still! Even if it tastes like water mixed with corn syrup, this stuff is the benchmark for many beer drinkers. Mainly, it seems most popular with people who hit the prime of their drinking years in 70s, 80s and 90s. One example is deceased Chief Justice Rehnquist, a Milwaukee native, who would have a daily lunchtime "Miller’s Lite." Miller Lite is a posterchild, along with Spud Mackenzie, of that period. Just like clothing styles, it seems that the beers of the pre-Lite + tv ad era have made a comeback (PBR, Schlitz, Hamm’s). 

Finally, here’s my actual rating: Pale yellow, bubbles, ultra light bodied. I give it high marks in the palate category because they’ve accomplished the objective of near nothingness and it is less filling than just about anything out there. Don’t drink it for taste though. The first half of their slogan is a lie.

Had this once at a party many years ago, and never again. Watered down corn and aluminum on the nose, palate, and finish. Slightly more watered down than most light beers, and that says a lot. This is for people who can’t afford Bud Light and won’t stoop to buying Natty.

Sickly pale, the only flavour is artificial sweetener. Mild lager with a little more malt and grass.
hey it is alightly better than bud light to me. Had while playing video games with some new friends. A slight clearer grassy hop  flavor int here somewhere.

Originally reviewed: 6/3/08. Very pale beer that never pours well. Rarely holds head retention and minimal lacing. Smells sour, tastes like cheapness. Have only really ever enjoyed it at baseball games when I needed something to wash down my bratwurst. The only redeeming quality is that it sponsors my Milwaukee Brewers. Yikes. Avoid.
Hmmm, surprised I haven’t rated this before.  Nothing to add, tastes better than Bud Light, it is the perfect reception beer to drink on a pool deck, no real taste to distract you from conversation.

Had in a bottle, delivered in a bucket. No Glassware needed!
Cost, $1
Neck - VORTEX!

A:Hazy Straw Yellow

S:Light Hop notes

T:Light and refreshing, slight taste of hops with a crisp clean finish

M:Wow it is nearly as refreshing as water which is what the style is going for.

O:This is the best of the Light Lagers that I have from any of the big guys. As stated, if rating to style, this is one of the top beers in this category... if I want to kick a midget then yes, I’d rate all of the big guys beers with a 1.5... but this one doesn’t deserve it.

12oz can poured into a shaker. Pours a clear pale yellow with some bright white head. Aroma of cereal, corn and metal. Taste is about the same. Light bodied with a thin texture. Fizzy carbonation and not much of a finish. Overall, it’s an American light beer. It’s crap.
Super bland. Urine yellow color with some bubbles. No malt, yeast, or hops taste. No palate.

12 oz can poured into a pilsener glass.  Really just doing this one because people like to pile on the american light lagers.  It is a style, whether you like or not, so I will judge it based on it’s representation of that style. Pours a crystal clear pale yellow.  Had a reasonable head for a brief moment before disappearing into nothing.  It was a violent pour however.  Very, very light nose.  Slight corn and I actually detect a very small non descript hop scent, grassy I suppose.  Tastes of corn and water.  A tiny amount of bitterness offsets a tiny amount of sweetness.  Finishes extremely dry and non descript.  Carbonation is extreme, even more than style dictates.  I have always found it drinkable and like most american lagers is better in the bottle and/or can.  If you’re not looking for flavor this is your beer and your style.  Rankings are in relation to the style of beer not personal preference.

Brief write up. What more can be said about this one? It’s Miller Lite, so it’s correct to assume it has next to no flavor. Very harsh carbonation (along with its unpleasant corn base) kills its drinkability, which might have been acceptable otherwise.
Taste like all of the other macro light beers except to drink you need not know how to spell
The usual beer pong beer. Not bad but certainly not special. Golden color, highly carbonated, light flavor. Triple hops brewed? Certainly dont taste that.

Drunk straight from the can.

Can’t say much about the appearance as I didn’t pour it out of the can but from having it before, it’s just your typical light straw yellow.

From what I can smell, it is quite grainy and corny and somewhat metallic.

Flavor is grainier than other light beers but also full of corn. There are really no hops to speak of and just a chalky dryness at the finish that is not too enjoyable.

Overall a pretty typical light lager. Better than Bud Light but far from the best in the style.

Just a plan big brewery beer. Best after cutting grass on a hot day or at a tailgate. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I’m a fan of this one, but mostly because it’s lower calorie and carb than most beers. It’s light and has little taste, but goes down well on a hot day when you’re thirsty.
Absolutely the only American main stream light beer I’ll drink.  Not much here, but miles ahead of coors and bud
Pale straw color with no head or lacing. Very faint smell of hops. Not sure where the triple hopping is going. Very water.

Watery yellow appearance with an average head that dissipates rather quickly.  Not much aroma, but what is there isn’t very good.  Taste is light and mostly water.  If I am out somewhere with minimal options to choose from, such as a sporting event, I will choose this.  Its my "favorite" run of the mill beer.

St. Patty’s Day crap beer at a party. The appearance was decent. Everything else was watered down crap. "Triple Hopped" is the biggest lie. 

Crap Beer Joke: How is light beer like having sex in a canoe? They’re fucking near water.
Very light yellow with not much aroma to speak of. Taste is corn and hoppy bitterness. Not bad if you drink cold and fast.
12 oz bottle pours yellow with a white head.  Well what can you say, its cheap.  Not much aroma or taste but it is a good yard work beer.
Well, it is better than Bud Light and Coors Light.  That is really not saying much.  It works if you are at a ballgame and choices are limited.

Can shared by a friend at the Hopsnobbery Collective’s first (and last) Crappy Beer Tasting on 2/29/12. Clear yellow pour with a huge white head. Aroma of light malt and farts. Light malt flavor with some sweetness and a watery finish. Bland as hell, but you really gotta bring it with the nastiness to be declared worst beer ever and this falls short.
Drinkable with more flavor than a Bud, not saying much. I’ll take a Lite on tap only if I’m not in the mood for whatever else is on tap.

decent aroma and light color. as far as taste goes it is better than the other major american lite beers such as coors lite, and bud lite. although it does go down very easy, it is very light in body and is lacking in flavor.
355ml bottle. Pours a clear amber colour with little to no head. Aroma is mostly wet straw and the flavour is not much better. An all round average beer.
Refreshing, great on a hot day relaxing by the pool or while cooking out!  Very easy drinkability!

In tap at migillicuty’s in new paltz, lighter than stare yellow no head. Minimal scent and taste. Light crackery sweetness, some flower, add metal. 

Rated via BeerBuddy

Draft at smiling chameleon. Why the chameleon is serving this shit is beyond me. Nothing on the nose. Pours very light almost urine colored with an inch of foam that disappears quickly. Tastes like water. Finish doesn’t exist. Light beer is proof that Satan hates us and wants us to die. This stuff is evil.

I know I’m in the minority on this site, but I think light beers have their place.  I know it’s boring, but if you’re drinking a few on a hot day you can do worse.  And I’d definitely drink Lite over regular Miller (or Bud Light over regular Bud) any day.

"Tripple hops brewed?"  When they say that, they must literally mean they brewed an entire batch with three hop cones.  Just like any light lager, it’s like beer flavored water.  This style has nothing to offer my personal taste, but I can see its appeal for those who want a refreshing drink on a hot day.
Tap @ Timbers, Denver. Pours light yellow, small white head. Aroma of lihght bread, corn. Taste is weak watery with malt, corn, bread. Thin watery body, lively carbonation. 220212

From notes.  First reviewed 12/30/2008.  Poured from a bottle into a pint glass.  
Miller Lite pours a light, transparent golden straw color. Plenty of carbonation, but the small head that formed originally fades to a tiny collar around the glass.
There is a very light, grainy aroma. Maybe some hops, if I close my eyes and wish really hard.
Miller Lite is also very light in the taste department. A crisp, light corn taste opens up, being joined by some other grains in the middle of the sip. A light hops presence is noticeable towards the end of the sip. The end is smooth with no aftertaste. The taste is not bad, there just is not much there, good or otherwise, to speak of.
A light and crisp mouthfeel, with a high level of carbonation.
This is light does not taste terrible, so I can drink this when I have to. The lack of other positive characteristics means I will never go out of my way to buy it, though.
faint floral aroma, watered down and boring with a metallic finish.  very weak beer

Clear deep gold with relatively full white head.  Aroma of wet grass and lemon.  Flavor is full of cereal grain.  Watery.  There has always been a massively harsh bite to this beer that makes it undrinkable -- like a mix of oxidation, DMS, cereal grain and metal.  This finished 3rd on my side-by-side with Bud light and Coors light whilst on a plane.....it killed the time.
Not the worst I’ve tasted, but when I don’t have any other options, this is slightly better than water

16 oz can. So listen, I have to rerate this popular American light beer, BECAUSE I was a little unfair last time.  IF - and I do mean "IF" I start with this lovely, and it is very cold, AND I have my favorite solid copper stein, this t’aint so bad.  That’s a lot of IF’s, I know.  Sorry.  Nice creamy foamy head (I am afraid to ask how they achieve it), with an acceptable beery aroma.  Easy on the palate, carbonation not overwhelming - if poured into something to drink - a horn, a boot, your siste’rs pointe shoe.  There is the hint of corn and less of barley malt, and the finish is nothing to write home about, or text, or whatever.  Tolerable if you want to cut calories and still drink something that tastes like beer.  It is not Bitburger, or Urquell, and it is NOT a pilsner that I would recognize as such.  Price is ok, it IS less filling because, let’s face it, this is less of a beer.  Hey, I need all this chemical engineering for my old joints!   A 16 oz has 131 calories and I need to go get another as all this dribbling has me parched.  Prosit!
Better than Bud Light, but I like Busch Light even better.  This is an okay beer and it is cheap to drink.
Miller lite.  What else can I say. Its super super easy to drink and I can drink it all night long. As I said before....to bad I can’t get yuengling in mass.

Pours a nice bubbly yellow and smells hoppy and bready - light overall. The taste is a little better than most pale lagers, but far from anything good. Pairs nicely with nachos or football games. Ehh.

The worst of the BLS Base Triplets (Coors Light, Bud LIght, Miller LIte). Always has some weird over sweet taste, too carbonated, and anyone who says this is "full-bodied" or "triple-hopped" doesn’t know crap.

By far the best and most available domestic draft and bottle... At least in my region of  VA. Still resumes a taste as beer should be, unlike many of the other domestic crap out there! By far my favorite choice when hitting up the bars/clubs if I’m still drinking beer...haha! IMO only domestic light beer you can order and still retain manhood or any palate whatsoever

Best of the standard crappy light beers.   Probably because its watered down so much.  Sitting here drinking it by itself trying to intelligently assess this beers attributes seems kind of silly....but I have to day I enjoy Miller Lite with a good thin crust Pizza.  Must be the "Vortex" bottle.
It poured a clear golden color. The aroma was very weak, with some light sweet pale malts. The taste was sweet pale malty body that was very light. Not much going on here.

Unfortunately, I was recently faced with a situation where the beer choices were (horror of horrors) bud light or this. Since it would have been rude not to have a beer, I stuck my hand in the icy water and out came a 12oz can of this stuff. It is proof that a zillion dollars worth of hypnotic marketing can make the nearly brain dead (wo)man eat or drink just about anything.

The most standard of beers but for this price you can do way better if people would just give some other breweries a chance. Granted bars run frequent specials on it so I understand why so many people order it while they’re out.

Enjoyed straight from the bottle at Mia Figlia on the outskirts of Chicago at my department holiday party.  This was drank with the sole purpose of getting slightly buzzed for the white elephant gift exchange that was coming.  It tasted like beer, not great beer, but it got the job done.
I can only attribute my need for 2 extra dollars in my pocket during my college years as to the reason I drank so much of this stuff. Does not offer much these days.
Miller Lite is Miller Lite. If you need to drink all day and not want to get drunk...this is the answer

341ml bottle from TBS. clear very pale yellow, super fizzy lasting white head. basically no aroma, slight powdered malt. clean flavour, again some light 2 rowiness. way over carbed kill the drinkablility. fine for a macro lite beer.
Of all the crappy, watered-down beers, this is the worst...I’d rather not drink beer than drink miller lite

16oz tallboy can.
