Miller Lite doesn’t really need any detailed description - lord knows how this pisswater is one of the staples in the US but it is along with Bud/Coors/etc. It *does* serves its purpose well - use it for beer pong or any other drinking game.  Beyond that, there’s really no excuse.  To be honest, it isn’t even as if it’s drastically cheaper than decent beers from Sierra Nevada/Boulevard/Avery, so even a cheap price can’t be a valid excuse.  Purely a beer for people who wanna get drunk. 4.2% alcohol.

free 35cl bottle at JFK business class lounge.
Glad I didn’t have to pay for this.  Thick white head.  Clear pale golden pour.  Not worth drinking a 2nd bottle
Bottle. This is a pretty watery beer. Nothing too special but it does have some decent alcohol for the calories.

wish i could give this all zeroes.....how this classifies as beer is incredible.  i would rather chew on dirty sweaty fungus infected socks than drink this garbage.  maybe a vortex bottle would change my mind.....doubtful

This stuff sets off the gag reflex after beer #1. Instant headache after beer #2. It grows mold within hours of being opened. I have no idea how it’s rated higher than Bud L. and Coors L. This belongs in the top 10 worst beers.
What can I say? This is the beer you take to a party to keep people away from your quality sixer.
Bottle. Yellow colour with a small white head. Smells alomst nothing. Flavour is hard to detect.

Aroma is about the only thing Millet Lite has going for itself. I enjoy the smell of beer at a ballpark. At a bar? Should be poured directly down the drain. Triple hops? Where? I had to post this so bro’s know that the beer they buy for their ladies is actually pretty bad.

Serving Type aluminium bottle.  Poured into a glass tankard with a thick reducing head and pale golden colour.  Tastes kind of watered down but still mildly refreshing.  There is a hop presence just....but you’ve got to search for it.  Good to start off on then move on to something better.

Just a horrible beer.  But then you get what you pay for. It taste like water and skunk. I gave it a 3 because let’s face it as bad as it is, it is not the worst thing you can come home with.  The company also makes Coors light and if that is opinion is available your far better ordering that.

Bottle at SAS Business lounge, Newark Airport.
Pours pale with a very shortlasting head.
Surprisingly big body, very very clean with a little malt and a hint of lemon.
Easily could down six or seven of these babies before feeling a real buzz. Light hops, and taste. AS they say it is not as filling as other beers, but is that good or bad?
I would drink this before coor’s light or bud light.  has a light amber color and mild beer taste that is refreshing on a hot day or when nothing else is available...and it is light.

Almost a ghost beer and still my brother-in-law’s favorite.  Guess I’ll never understand how someone can down half a case of this stuff when it would only take three or four real beers to do the same.  Drink real Miller beer instead.

Poured from 16 oz. can. Poured a clear gold with a full cotton head leaving slight lacing when it dispersed, carbonation bubbles also present. Tastes is very watered down and with hints of skunkyness. Not horrible but would prefer Bud heavy if I am going to drink a cheap beer.

This rating for 16oz wide mouth aluminum (gas station style) bottle.


 
Pours perfectly clear, pale golden, with a large fluffy white well retained head that leaves good lacing on the glass. 



The aroma is that classic grainy, bread yeast, and light noble hop combo that defines the classic and/or ubiquitous "beer smell" from my childhood. The aroma also has some corn chips and mild alcohol. 



The flavor is very light, recent samples from other vessels have seemed like astringent water... maybe this sample is fresher but this tastes better than I recall in recent memory. The beer has some light corny sweetness, and a slight citrus hop zing, then it’s on to the quick, clean, flavorless finish. 


ar-5 ap-3 f-5 p-2 oa-8 = 2.3



Oh, and the fire moose has had his antlers baked, please keep this in mind.
Drank directly from can on a camping trip, which is about the only reason to do it. Typical boring mass-market adjunct light lager.
The only good thing appealing was the look. It is pretty but that is all. If this is triple hopped - I am a unicorn.

Another most dreadful so called beer, poured from bottle into glass, light straw color, little foamy white head dissapates quickly.   Synthetic aroma almost of wet cardboard, first sip, watery metallic taste, overall dreary.

Poured from a can into a pint glass. Color was clear golden. Minimal head. Minimal lacing. Minimal film. 

Smelled very metallic. Also some corn in there.

Tasted metallic, watery and skunky.

Light body. Average carbonation. 

Just an awful, awful beer. Probably the worst one I’ve ever had. Bud Light and Natural Light are ever better than this.

Can.  No point in pouring this one out, we all know what’s inside.  Aromas of corn and sweet malt, stale all around.  The flavor is mildly skunky, sweet corn, with sugar and hay.  Where’d they get "pilsner" from?  Not good.  [832]
Looks like urine, smells like wet hay, taste like a slightly sweet cereal water, bubbly and watery thin mouthfeel, good for cheap party pleasure and nothing more.

Bottle in a pint glass - pours pale yellow with white head leaving no lacing. Aroma is corn or rice or grain, whatever it is it not packed with flavor. Taste is slightly sweet. Good down smooth and is not filling. Light bodied. Wish I had a funnel and a hose.
I must have gotten one of the bottles that missed out on the triple hop brewing. Watery, bland, it I had my choice between another ML and soda, I would chose soda. I do not like soda.
This beer proves that marketing is more important than taste to the most people
Aluminum bottle with a screw cap. Mostly absent aroma, some sour grains. Flavor is watery grain juice, slightly sour, slightly bitter. Hardly resembles beer.
Not to bad for a light beer and at least it has more flavor than coors light, but who cares theyre made by the same person.

The best of the macro American light lagers.  Actually has some flavor, and is quite smooth.  Again, a thirst quencher for sure,  Not too much contemplation needed here.  Golden yellow, with mild white head.
Wow to think I used to occasionally drink this years ago before I knew what real beer taste like. I agree with with most of the other reviews. Flavored water. Yuck.
Really one of the worst beers I have ever had.  Tastes really close to water.

Serving glass: Poured from can into clear plastic glass.

Appearance: Clear, light gold with wispy white head.

Aroma: Corn, sweet graininess.

Taste: Sweet grain, corn, and a slight detection of spicy hops.

Palate: High carbonation, light body, funny light beer finish.

Overall: Despite being boring, it is easy to drink, so probably deserves a decnt score overall. But when a brewer throws around BS terms such as "triple hopped brewed" and "true Pilsner", it just annoys me, so it gets docked extra.

Bottle, 2nd March 2011, San Francisco. Free bottles at a games industry event. The benighted brethren of the MGD. I could barely tell the difference; there’s so little to either of them. The beer equivalent of muzak. Watery rubbish that I wouldn’t give to a cat.

Yet another rice lager to add my collection of beers that won’t be counted as a rating on this site. Figured I’d get the big boys out of the way first. Pours pale yellowish color with little or no scent. Barely any hops present, which is sinful in the beer world to me. Just another popular beer with a hint of taste when you don’t have any other real options.
not great but it’s the only light beer with a taste. i’ve drank 100s of them, not too bad. smell isn’t anything miller should be proud of though.

I see people drinking this all the time, and I wonder why?   It has flavor, but is just not that appealing to me.   On a hot day & when it’s the only drink is the only time I will take one.   Somewhat bitter aftertaste.   A little salty for me.   Typical light.
I can’t understand why some of my friends still insist on drinking these. Yes it’s poplar, but that is all it has going for it.
This beer is really pretty decent, but still nothing much to it.  I like some more complexity.

Pale yellow Lager with a small head.  Crisp light flavor is very drinkable and refreshing when ice cold.  Light bodied with lively carbonation.  It’s my choice of light American Lager, much nicer than Bud Light.

I hate miller lite. This is what i call "Fish beer". To me it has a very odd, fishy taste to it...similar to Fosters. The smell is a malty scent similar to that of other cheap Miller beers, weak head.

Poured from a 16 oz can type thing.Pale yellow clear good head some lacing,Light pilsner sweet aroma with some yeast esters/salt. Pretty bland taste dry,lacking,smooth simple taste free easy drinker.For a light beer there is some body, apperance isnt bad and drinkability is  good, just could use some flavor and hops but that would = calories.Notice a fruity ester in taste like cheap cereal.

12oz can. Well well, this is not a good beer. Nothing special, nothing to taste really, but it is better than any swill anheuser busch puts out. If I’m going to a party where I don’t care too much if my beer gets swiped this would be it. It’s a beer you can drink alot of because it is less filling, but they’re joking with the claim of having "Great Taste". But I’m sure the masses of macro-swill lovers would vehemently disagree that their precious fizzy water is inferior in the world of beer. I’ve had drunk douchebags call me out about being at a bar drinking IPA’s or Stouts while they’re slammin down these excuses, saying what I’m drinking "tastes like shit". I just shake my head and ignore the ignorance. Open your mind...
Poured a pale yellow with an artificial head. I do not notice anything, it’s a canoe beer. Water is preferred to this.

only will drink this if there is no other option which there wasn’t which is why i had this recently at a concert and it cost 10 bucks for 24 ounces of this swill.  fail.  trying to describe this beer would be like trying to describe a turd so i won’t bother
One of the only "beers" i’ve had that’s worse than this piss is Bud Lite. If anyone had brewed this in 16th century Germany they’d have been burned at the stake!

I’m sure theirs a place where people actually admit to liking this beer but I haven’t found it yet. I imagine if you like driving in a constant circle around a oval and you have a giant number 3 sticker with wings on it you’ll love it.

from a can thrown at me on a river while tubing.  Smells of metal, water, corn.  Bland taste of carbonated corn water and starch.  Toward the end of the can, as it got warmer, it became offensive.  Ice cold it is tolerable.  Overall a waste of money for the price, if you’re going to be doing this get PBR.

Pours a clear yellow color with a fizzy white head, leaving minimal lacing. Smells grainy and corny not much else. I call BS on the triple hops claim, there’s a grainy maltiness and corn, that’s about it. I’ll grant it that it’s somewhat refreshing.
Overall: It’s really not much better than the super cheap stuff and I prefer Pabst which is cheaper, stick to Pabst for a cheap pounding brew.

Pour actually doesn’t look bad in the glass, light golden yellow with bubbles coming up from the bottom and a foam head, superior to some other light beers in that respect, at least (You should see Natural Light in a glass, doesn’t resemble beer as I know it, this at least looks like beer).  The smell is inoffensive, but barely there.  When you drink it with a bit of a head, you realize that some of that head is definitely artificial soda type carbonation and not a beer head as a craft beer drinker is used to thinking of it -- the foam almost feels lighter than usual.  The taste is predominantly water, with sweet grains, metal (This came from a glass bottle, I’m talking about a taste in the beer itself), and a little bit of hops on the back end.  Honestly, sort of a cross between a regular adjunct lager and a glass of water.   It’s not bad in the sense of being revolting in any way whatsoever, it’s easy to drink.  It just is really lacking in flavor to the point where the water is the main thing.  Of the big three light beers (Bud Light, Coors Light, Miller Light), this one has the lowest carbohydrate total, if you’re watching your carbs -- calorie count is roughly the same -- and I think is the best of the three.  I really don’t like light beers, though.  But I need to watch my weight, so I try to mix some in every so often.  If you’re in the same boat, this is better than Bud Light and Coors Light in terms of the "health stats" , and definitely has an edge in taste over the Bud Light (Close call with Coors Light).  Tossed in a few extra points in overall to give it credit for it’s carbohydrate count and that it’s better than it’s major light beer competition.
better then most of the light beers.  has a clean aroma and descent taste.  Not too heavy but pure flavor.

Bottle 355ml @ DoubleTree Hotel, Annapolis, MD

Pours clear pale yellow with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, grain and corn. Taste is light sweet. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.
Ugh.  This is way down on my list as far as the BMCs go, but is ahead of Bud Light.  Not much to discuss.  Will not purchase, but will drink when free.
a step up from keystone and coors light, but that is not much of a compliment.
An OK American-style beer. I myself will drink it at an event or at a bbq where it’s offered, but it’s not much in terms of what I call beer.
Bottle. pALE YELLOW. nO HEAD. cRISP smell and taste. Probably my favorite of american macrobrew beers that i have no choice to order at  a baseball game or whatever. not that bad

Can poured into a glass.  Pours a crystal clear pale yellow.  Foamed head starts strong but quickly fades to nothing.  Usual macro light beer aroma with a very mild flavor.  Great if you are looking for an easy drinking beer to pound before football games but that’s about it.

This beer is your classic milwaukee standard and you cannot deny it.  smells like standard beer, has a clear golden appearance, i would say if anything it is a light better taste that is very "pound-able on a hot summer day tail gating in the Milwaukee Brewers parking lot." definitely has a thin and light palate. over all i do truly enjoy this beer, maybe not on a cold winter day, I would more likely go with an IPA or Stout, but Miller Lite is where its at in the sun.

Poured pale yellow with frothy, quickly disappearing head.  Aroma almost non-existent.  Taste is watered down – a little bit of malt a little bit of hops.  It’s almost as if this were once a decent beer and something came along and stole its soul.
As far as light beer goes I think this is better than some other options, but it’s not something I would drink outside of social contexts.

12 oz. can, gift from the stewardess for changing seats on a flight from Laguardia to Charleston.  Warm.  Oh joy.  Liquid.  Somewhat beer-colored.  Hints at actual malts and hops being used at the brewing process.  The plastic cup successfully holds the contents from the can (no sipping beer from the stewardess’s cupped hands for me!)  The plane lands and  I feel dirty.  (2008)
Yellow carbonated water, in a can.  No head, no flavor.  Better than dying of thirst, but not why I drink beer.  Meh.

This stuff is absolutely disgusting, it fills you up more than any other light beer I know, has a weird aftertaste, only descent part is the Palate but that doesn’t really interest me that much, the rest of my family loves it, I guess I will never understand exactly why, dont drink this beer in excess it wont be pretty.
Gimme a break. Yuck. No body. No foam. No flavor. Belching Girl does not approve.

This is a very easy drinking beer, suits the masses and tastes better than the king of beers.  Yes resembles the same substandardness that thes macro brews have, paleish gold color, tinny corn taste, unfullinging.  but superior drinkability.  Thats this one right?

If, after too many years of drinking heartier brews, you find yourself wearing size 44 pants, this is the beer for you.  Miller Lite the best of the light beers and actually quite nice, with a clean, clear pleasant taste.    Due to its somewhat low carbonation, it’s actually quite thirst quenching on a hot day.  A pleasant late night companion till you slim down to maybe a size 40.

Aroma:Just a little malt aroma. Smells a little bit sweet and there may be some floral hop aroma in there.

Appearance:Very pale yellow in color. Good amount of white head that does not last very long. Very clear with visible bubbles.

Taste:Flavor is crisp and dry, but watery. Very little hop flavor and bitterness. There’s not a whole lot to this, but at least there’s not off flavors.

Palate:Very good carbonation, body is very light. Kind of like carbonated water with just a hint of bite.

Overall:For the style, this beer holds up very well. Very little complexity and low alcohol makes it a good alternative in countries where the water is not safe to drink.
12 oz bottle.  Pours a sttaw yellow color.  very little aroma, very litte taste, very little going for it
Light, fizzy, artificial in appearance, garbage in tastes, expensive in price, just really bad.
12 oz. bottle.  yellow color with a medium head.  not much taste.  less filling.  smooth and drinkable.
It’s bad, as expected. Tastes like chemicals, metal and piss. It’s still the better of the big three light beers though
Tastes like, well, Miller Lite.  Although watery and very unexceptional, it does have a distinct flavor and there are worse beers.

Have a couple of cans of this in the fridge that were recently left by a friend.  I thought I’d do a back-to-back with the Oskar Blues canned pils that I found today.

Pours absolutely clear yellow with a decent white head that fades almost instantly.  Aroma is almost entirely wet cardboard with something sharp and undefinable underneath.  In the mouth, this beer is much thinner and more watery.  It’s got a decent carbonation buzz even thought it doesn’t look it in the glass.  Flavor is almost nonexistant with a slightly vegetal flavor.  No aftertaste at all.  Pretty much like drinking soda water.

I’ve had this beer many times shared with friends.  It’s enjoyable enough in those situations, but drinking it back to back with a much better beer just makes it look very bad.

12 oz. bottle from inlaws’ fridge.  Second round in my night of swill.

Ar:  Meh.  Nothing offensive.
Ap: Poured at 36’F in La Fin du Monde tulip.  Effervescent urine cascades into my glass from the lovely vortex bottle; a lovely white head fills the top 1" of my tulip.  No head retention, but a bonus point for a touch of lace.
T:  Some sweet corn/generic grain flavor.  Not offensive, but certainly not good.  Lovely triple hops flavor on the finish.  I believe they’re using cascade for this, but I’m not sure.  Transcendent.
P:  Relatively thin and fizzy, but not quite as thin as I thought it would be.

O:  Better than bud light.

Pale yellow color. Mild corn taste and aroma. High carbonation. Almost no taste at all. I’d rate it lower but on it’s plus side it doesn’t offend either. I’d drink this over higher rated beers that taste awful.
Looks likes beer. But tastes like something. else. Selzer water? Tripple hopped? What does that mean. They just waved a hop over it three times.
I’ve had club soda that had more flavor. They claim to use 3 hops. I’m assuming that’s 3 hop cones for an entire batch, as there is NO hop aroma or flavor present.  Complete garbage.

I believe this beer to be 1 part mcCormick’s vodka, 2 parts corn syrup, 10 parts seltzer, and 2 parts grass clippings.  yes, for a total of 15 parts. Actually taste does improve if you add a couple salt shakes.

Oh, I’m feeling masochistic. Can. Smells like skunk, metallic creamed corn, and old jockstraps. It doesn’t actually look that bad -- it leaves lace. Taste, however, leaves a world to be desired. It tastes like the cardboard 12-pack holder it came in. It’s neutral. It’s boring. It’s mass-produced hackery. I think the meaning of ’triple-hop brewed’ is that they put three whole cones in each batch. Not even Bob Uecker can save this.

A clear, pale yellow pour with a white head.  The aroma is mostly grain mixed with wet cardboard.  The light body has watery texture with fizzy carbonation.  The taste is bland with the mildest of bitterness and a finish so clean that it makes you wonder whether you really just had a sip of beer.

Compared to the majority of beers I drink, this is positively bad.

However....

When I’m in the mood for Macroswill, this is the best of the bunch.  Much more flavor that Bud Light, Michelob Light, MGD, Budweiser, High Life, or Busch.

Great light beer, if you’re at a bar and you need to slug down a bunch of beers and you can’t get your hands on anything better you won’t be disappointed that you get a miller lite. It’s never something that you will enjoy like a good guinness or IPA but it’s good for what it does...gets ya drunk at a refreshing pace
Way better than miller high life. But still a horrible beer. It’s like a bunch of hicks spit into a jar
Possibly the worst of the leading beers as far as sales. YUCK. Cum in a can.
12ox bottle. Pours a clean light yellow color with a small white head. Fizzy. Awful.
A typical american light beer. Nothing special, mostly a cheap sports-on-tv type all day drinkin beer. Eh, I prefer others, but not terrible
This beer is exactly what it is: watery adjuncts with three hops added at some point.  About as uninteresting as beer can be.
Light yellow, very watery and bland. Definitely don’t taste the triple hops.
Typical light beer, slight bitterness, easy drinking, there are other light beers I would drink over this

Tasted on 1/2/11 from a 12oz bottle sent to me to fill out a shipping box in a trade, I can’t believe there isn’t a separate listing for the vortex bottle, as I am sure it will improve the taste of this one.  Pours pale golden with an average white head that quickly recedes to almost nothing.  The nose has some sugar sweetness with corn, and not much else.  There is just slightly more flavor than water with just the lightest of hops, a metallic flavor, and a weird corn finish.  The body is as light as water with lively carbonation and a very short corn finish.
As bad a beer as I’ve had. Grainy aroma. A lot of corn and grain in the flavour. Too fizzy. Dreadful.
Tap. Crystal clear golden yellow appearance. Weak aroma but some light sweet pale malts. Sweet pale malty body that very light. Not much going on here.

This beer has a bland lager smell. Smell likes a sweaty sock but also sweet like a jolly rancher. Color is a very pale yellow. For having a good head it had very poor lacing. Taste like a cheap beer. It was very watery and it taste like it was made from bad crop of hops. Beer was light-bodied with low carbonation almost tasting flat. There was really no aftertaste which i did not like. Overall it was a low quality beer and a cheap filler. Only would buy if on sale.
On tap at Oyster Bar. Looks like urine. Aroma of straw. Flavor is sweaty socks. Not good.
Bottle pours that oh so wonderful pale lager color.  Let’s just say it’s not the worst one out there.

Great when I want to drink a beer that doesn’t make my belly fat.  Also good in the summer when its very hot.  Other than that I’m not so sure that we can really consider this beer regardless of the vortex bottle or the triple hops

Pours from the 12 oz can a crystal clear, pale yellow (almost lemonade) color with a foamy 1 1/2 finger head that settles into a medium collar.  VERY active carbonation.  Aroma is of wet grass, cheap malts, straw.  1st sip is like seltzer water it a small amount of beer flavor.  all cheap grassy malts...and where are the "triple hops" that this was allegedly brewed with?  Mouthfeel is light and watery, with tons of fizz to ensure that there will be copious amounts of belching & farting to add to the experience.  I’ll admit, it would be refreshing on a hot summer day, but so would a bottle of water, which if you’re worried about calories & carbs would be a better choice anyway.  The fact this is one of the best selling beers in America is a true, shining example of what slick advertising can do for a product.  And to think, there was a time when I actually thought the swill was good...
I don’t fully understand the attraction to light beers. As far as this one goes I rate it higher as it doesn’t feel nearly as gross to drink as the others.
bread, resin, dough, barnyard, licorice, pale, clear, minimal head, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, light body, thin feel, average carbonation, long finish, bitter, astringent,
Pours a clear yellow with a soapy head. It has a very thin watery aroma. The taste is of very watery grains with very little flavour. It tastes more like club soda than beer.

Can. Mostly all vegetal aromas and flavors. Large fizzy white head with excellent lacing and is mostly lasting. Palate is light, watery and fizzy with a slightly dry finish. Quenches a thirst and gives you a buzz after a 18 pack, that’s where the good qualities end.
Seriously if Miller wants to compete with Bud Light they really need to fix this beer. I would rather have Busch Light over this, not to mention they spell lite wrong : )
Easy to drink, or play games with.  My first beer love, still love it, but In my heart I know its not a good beer.

A: Very pale yellow/straw color with almost no head and absolutely zero head retention/lacing.

S: Not much there. Some grains and certainly none of the "triple hop addition."

T: Again, not too much. There are some grainy/grassy tastes from the adjuncts, and the tiniest bit of pale malt flavor, but a zero on the hops, and no complexity. 

M: Quite watery. Very, very light. Carbonation is okay, but that really doesn’t save it.

D: Less drinkable than Bud Light, unfortunately. I guess it goes down fairly easy, it just hardly resembles beer.
this is my goto beer ever weekend or if i ran out of yuengling lager! cheap beer!
I try not to drink this straight up, but use it cooking, especially boiling brats.
Clear yellow, small white head.  Apple(?!) aroma.  Taste and feel is like soda water with a little corn and a metallic finish.

Remove Miller Lite bottle from fridge. Grab tasting glass from pantry. Pop the cap. Pour just a wee little bit and dump the rest. And so I resume once more the joyous folly of my tasting ways, Miller Lite style.




Clear and straw-like, whatever feeble attempt at a head he made withers away before I even have time to really take note. Swirls with no lace and a wee bit more head which fades just as quickly. Grains, wonderbread, and lemon zest stink of unoriginality while a hint of greenness attempts to garner some hoppish favors. Another sniff and then there was none. Double meh. His palate is a sprightly one, mischievous in his conniving ways of parlaying favor without ever putting anything out there to favor. Lemon ice meets the shaver for a wet sparkly lemony watery shower atop my tastebuds and on down my throat. No finish. None. Zip. Zilch. Zero. (running out of languages here). A slice or two of wonderbread wonderpower and he finishes in a soggy yet sprightly manner. Speaking of sprite, I think I’ll have some instead.




I wasn’t expecting much, though I’ve expected little before and been pleasantly surprised to get a lot. But in the case of Miller Lite I got a whole lot of nothing except the same old bland boring usual.

12oz can.  Clear, bright yellow body with a fizzy head that fades quickly.  Aroma is non-descript bland, adjunt-base malt and some sort of funk.  Sweet taste, thin, water like body.  No depth or character.  96 calories of blah!!

Vortex bottle at One Bistro Norwood Mass, aroma of rice and hay, no hops to speak of really, not a terrible flavor just not much of anything, ok for pounding without getting too filled up, my current domestic light macro go to
12 Oz Bottle, Pale color with a thin head. Tastes very watered down. Just not my cup of tea.

On draught at Tokyo Grill Victoria TX.  Pale straw color.  Aroma of grass and corn.  Thin, carbonated body.  Taste is like water (mineral one, due to carbonation).  It was the best available beer in the Japanese restaurant.

On draught at Tokyo Grill Victoria TX in 22oz mug for 2 bucks. Pours a pale yellow with minimal white head. Light aroma of corn, grass. Taste same as aroma. Palate is light body, moderate carbonation. Finish is light grass, and corn. Overall not much aroma or flavor to speak of, very bland and boring could not finish it. It was the one of the better choices available on the menu.

I don’t drink light beers regularly enough to know which one is the best.  I don’t think taste or quality is in the forefront of the mind of a light beer brewer.  The beer pours with a thin head, small carbonation.  The beer tastes like a less flavorful version of a regular American Lager.  It is boring and artless.

Poured from 12oz bottle to glass. Pours yellow, clear.  White head.  Smells of water and corn - maybe some grain (?).  Not a large flavor profile - a bit of hops, corn, water, grain.  Light body.  High carbonation.  Meh.

Smells like overcooked corn, maybe a hint of floral. If your trying hard.
The flavours goes towards a watery corn flavour, with a medium carbonation. 
This is one of the reasons american beer have the bad reputation it got. BUT; its dirt cheap!

Now with the new VORTEX bottle!! The new bottle makes the non-existant aroma come out to almost have an aroma.  It is a pale light gold color. I drink it in bottle form most of the time, but when poured this forms no head.   The taste is a bit bitter and very watery. This really is not something you drink to enjoy it is an alcohol delivery system.

This is my favorite go to beer.  The aroma is faint, but never skunked.  Taste is okay for a macro.  There is no aftertaste or crispness on the palate.  Overall,  If i’m looking to get drunk or play drinking games, this is teh beer of choice.  Very light and easy to drink a 6 pack..

Pours a clear pale yellow color. Aroma of corn. Flavor is pretty non-existent. I’d say grain and grape. Very watery. Overall, not a good beer. However, this beer is acceptable at a Dodgers game or perhaps at a Chiefs game, where I am now.  Mostly because of availability.
Terrible. Tastes like hay, shit aftertaste. Don’t waste your time unless you’re playing drinking games.

Boring bland light pilsner/lager - avoid if anything else is available - even plain water or cola tastes better than this sorry stuff.  It is incredible to me that so many people drink this stuff... but I remind myself that billions of people also eat at McDonald’s.

24 oz bottle poured into Pint

Of the Category 1a. Beers made by Miller Coors and AB, I thought this does the best at delivering light flavor, yet distinguishable flavor, and still finishing very clean.

This beer will always have a special place, first beer I ever had.  That being said I have had it since, and the only way to make it drinkable is with lime and salt on the rim.  Corn adjuncts with light bitter finish.  Not much going on.
Better than bud light is what this beer has going for it.  Serving: Bottle and tap

120z Can left by mattyb83’s friends.  Didn’t pour this one in a glass because it doesn’t seem necessary.  That and I don’t want to dirty one up.  Smells like corn.  Clearly they don’t joke around with being triple hopped!  Notes of corn and sweeter malt on the palate with a medium level of carbonation.  Good way to cleanse your palate after drinking coffee before the serious drinking begins.

Sucks, duh.  I have about 8 of these the other night because it was all they had, and got no buzz.  Taste like stale seltzer, slightly stale or bitter.  Biggest issue is wayyyyyyy too much carbonation....If they toned that down it would be more palatable.

Has a very clear yellow color with lots of carbonation and quick thinning head. Not much of a smell, slightly biscuity and a little sweet. Nothing much stands out beside being watery and a slight corn taste. Very light feel with too much carbonation. Very east to drink, almost like water. Like most light beers, it’s something you could probably drink all day if you don’t care about taste.

Draft: Poured a pale yellow color lager with a small foamy head with minimal retention and no lacing. Aroma of corn and other adjunct is dominating. Taste is a mix between some light corn with a sweet finish. Body is very light with OK carbonation. Just like most other North American macro beer out there.
Light, fairly dry hint of sweetness, triple hops brewed. Tastes pretty bad.
ITs funny when ever anybody asks me what kind of light beer that I prefer. I usually just scoff at them and say "Light beer? Why?" Remember, beer isn’t beer if its not beer. :)

this one really hit the spot at the end of the night when i thought i was going to play beer pong, but ended up not doing so. i was chewing gum while i drank it, and i think that is one of the benefits of drinking this style of beer. it’s so tasteless that you can actually taste your gum.

It gets a 1 based on nostaglia alone.  Drank this beer many times over during college.  Now that I know beer, I realize that flavor in ML was just adjunct... corn.  Light beer only serves one purpose... affordable brews at concerts and sporting events

Worst beer I have ever had the displeasure of drinking in my life. Had to use this beer for a drinking game one time and I thought I was going to throw up from the taste of the beer. I would not drink this even if it was the last beer on earth, it’s that bad. 0/10
Poured from new vortex bottle, bad, oddly enough the Vortex Bottle didn’t help at all as I expected it to!

Can- Clear pale straw color with white head that fades quickly. Faint grain aroma. has a slight sweetness and mild bitter finish. Light body (watery), fairly high carbonation. Only decent if served ice cold. Of the beers for the masses or mass consumption this beer has the edge over Bud Light & Coors light.

10oz can, best by Aug 9, 2010.  Pours VERY light yellow with a 1 1/2 finger white head that quickly reduces to a light cap.  Lacing?  Maybe for a half-second or so.  Aroma is the best part of the beer, and it ain’t saying much.  Corn, sweet grain, and that’s about it.  But the aroma is of moderate strength...you can actually smell it which is a plus for the style.  Flavor is incredibly weak, a touch of corn and grain.  Very faint.  Mouthfeel is thin, medium carbonation.  Thank god this can had a Taste Protector Lid, otherwise it may have tasted even worse.  For a light adjunct lager it is OK...I guess, but if I want a light beer I’ll go for a Guinness every time over swill like this.
Nothing here to stop about... although, given choice of this, BL, or CL, I choose ML.... there is more taste (in a very relative sense!)

The beer of my college years.

The beer pours a clear yellow color with a white head. The aroma is corn with some other grains. Very simple. The flavor is corn, grassy hops and grain. Not much going on, but nothing too terribly offensive. Light bodied and medium mouthfeel. A decent drinker.

40 oz that I bought at a gas station on my way home.  Yellow pour with a small white head.  Aroma is cereal and a bit of grassy and floral hops.  Similar flavor without the cereal or the hops being too noticeable or off putting for the style.  Clean, light finish with plenty of carbonation.

Draught at the Delta Club, Detriot airport. Nose is closer to cheap sake than anything like beer. Obnoxious, really. Pale yellow color. Light and watery flavor. doesn’t really tate like beer, or anything really. Gross. Even the few free sips were too much.
Can, thanks to Dean, clear yellow with white foam, dry fizzy aroma and flavor with little else
A light beer with a somewhat more bitter flavor than the other big three.  I guess this could be hops, if you want to call it that.
Bottle.  Terrible beer.  Redeeming quality about this one is that there is a little more toast flavor than other American, light, pale lagers.

This is probably my least favorite beer ever.  It pours like yellow water, has skunky flavors and they may triple hop it but I can’t taste any hop flavors.  I will actually turn this down if it is free...

12 oz bottle someone left in the fridge.  Pours clear straw gold with a white head.  Aroma is sweet malt that dies back quickly as the head fades.  Flavor is very light grains with just a bit of slightly off flavor, but of course just not much flavor.  And... is it getting lighter?  Seems like it.  It does have a nice nostalgic value, like I should be sitting at a table downing several cans based on the whims of a deck of cards.  Let’s add an extra point for that.

I suppose this would have been a higher score had it come from the Vortex bottle.  Again, nothing against Miller, but the next time I hear someone in my bar arguing whether Miller is better than Bud I might just hang up my bottle opener for good.
A classic fall-back.  A beer I can be happy with in any condition or setting.
It is Miller Lite.....a few steps above water basically.  Its only redeeming quality is it has the highest ABV and lowest calories of its BMC companions.
Pours a very pale yellow with virtually no head.  Slight malt aroma.  Subdued malt and hop flavors with loads of carbonation.  Not much here.
well what can you say about this.......good?......or bad?......not anything that hasn’t been said already.

Your at a bar, your broke... but if you nurse this beer and peel the label off, no one will know what is in that bottle your holding.... later, tell her someone picked your pocket and you’ll pay her back for dinner

Miller Lite is a mass consumption American beer.  It’s light, simple and easy to drink.  This is a beer that goes well with pizza, BBQ, and smoky dive bars.  It’s not made for a pint, it’s made for a a solo cup.  And having said all that, Miller Lite is great at what it does.
From a vortex bottle.  Smells like a gimmick.  I wish i could taste this, but due to the tornado effect caused by threading in the bottle this goes straight to my stomach.  Thanks miller lite!

While it may be the most popular ’lite’ beer, it lacks character as a beer should.  Tried mine on-tap @ the Miller Brewery tour in Milwaukee.  While the appearance and head was decent the aroma was minimal and taste of very light malt, corn and hops.  If you need a quick refreshment under parched conditions I suppose this would suffice.
que dice essay? This beer stanks! I would pretty much turn this down at any opportunity. This beer is offensive to common decency.
a light sweet choice that sits well with a BBQ meal with friends and family if the intent is to not fill up on beer

ok so this is the beer we get 30 of at xmas because everyone comes over..so what?,appearance taste and mouthfeel is of salt water near the sewer..aroma is just disgusting..the "top of the heap’ for its type???..every time i have drank this it gives me indigestion and a headache waste of money and time to drink this

So, really it does taste a little better than let’s say the generic canned beer that is aptly labelled as "beer".  No hop aroma, no malt flavor, just bubbly and clear.  The plastic bottles and screw caps can be reused to make soda!

I have always considered Miller Lite to be a cut above the other domestics. Maybe it’s that they have the better commercials, maybe it was that one debaucherous night in Milwaukee. I’m not sure. But I have always had a soft spot in my heart for all the Miller products. So I am now going to critique it from a non-sentimental perspective. I’m sorry, Miller, if I am harsh. 

The clear straw-yellow color is bubbly and light (or should I say "lite"). The amount of foam on the top leaves a surprising amount of lace, but not sure how long it will last. [Note: the lacing of the foam is very slight, but at least it’s something.] 

The smell is malty. Has that American Macro rice aroma. Not very impressive really. 

I am pretty sure the beer is fresh, but it has a skunked, musty flavor to it. Like it’s been sitting in room temp for a while. There is virtually no aftertaste. 

Is very light, but doesn’t go down as easy as I would like. It is light and should be smooth, but the carbonation dances a little too much on the palate. A little too fizzy for my liking. It’s watery, yet seltzery. If it were a night of cheap pitchers, I could probably knock quite a few of these back. As for enjoying at home, better to pick up something else.

Wow, this is hard to rate. I generally dislike "light" beer, and most American Mass Production Lagers in general. However within these categories, this beer is at the top of the pile. Pale straw in color, fizzy, watery, crisp, quenching. It’s best to drink this beer VERY cold, in a frosted mug if possible. Even when poured from a bottle to a pint glass, this beer manages to have an "aluminum can" flavor. Better that Bud Light. Worse than Amstel Light or Sam Adams Light.

oddly enough, i had one of these and found it to be better than bud light despite the horrible ratings here. at least it has a stronger bad-beer flavor.  i’ll give it some credit though since I didn’t notice any really bad off flavors or anything.  super fizzy like you’d expect. this is pretty much just so i can get another rating. i’m excited about starcraft 2 coming out in July, but I doubt i’ll get it until a little while after that. my girlfriend isn’t going to like being neglected like that but somebody’s gotta put a stop to the Zerg.

Poured from can into a purple plastic cup. The head was way too big as it was actually larger than that of the actual body of the beer. After a ping pong ball was thrown into said cup from about 6-8 feet away, I was forced to drink this beer or be condemned to just watching the game. As I raised my purple cup to my lips I noticed almost no scent and the taste was nearly the same. As with most light American beers, their sole purpose in life is to inebriate poor college students and it definitely shows through this beer. It is better than natty light, but I definitely would not say it is good. I would only purchase this beer for ponging purposes.
The miller light girls are sexy, thats for sure.  This beer however, isnt.  Typical Light beer.

Clear, Pale and Watery. Foamy head.  Smells weak. Kinda corny.Tastes real weak. Why bother? What little taste there is, taste like corn, not beer.  Watery. No character at all. Kinda fizzy.

Everyone else says that drinkability is the only strong suit in a Domestic Macro. I don’t even find this stuff very drinkable. I always end up feeling crummy, especially the next day (do they put laxative in this stuff?).

Overall, seriously, why bother? I’m not just being mean. If your just trying to get hammered, drink a few shots or something. Maybe drink one of those flavored malt beverages, at least it has some flavor.

This beer had no aroma what-so-ever. Tasted like bread. Pretty clean and refreshing palate. Just another pale lager though. Nothing particularly bad or good about it (with respect to it’s category of course)

Very watery beer with more aftertaste than taste.  Almost no aroma at all.  light vanilla taste.  The aftertaste is citrussy and almost metallic.  not very hoppy.    This is a college frap boy beer made to chug not to enjoy.   The only positive is that you can get a pint for a $1 in a lot of places.
Drank one at a baseball game.  I had a difficult time finishing it.  Bland, watered down, nothing appealing about it.

Miller Lite--True Pilsner Beer--2007 12 oz. Bottle.  4.20% ABV--10 IBU’s.?  (2.0 / 5.0)  Pilsner--Light.  Fizzy mild lace head.  Clear very thin straw color.  Bland hop hint front.  Thin watery mild tangy quenching mild adjunct caramel light Pils body.  Hop hint refreshing easy bland end.  OK Light.  No off flavors.  Sampled 4/19/2007.

great taste less filling?
ok.
pours a really pale watery urine yellow.
smells like a value macro.
ok. it does have more taste than most light lagers-but thats not necessarily a good thing. run of the mill semi-watered down boring macro flavor. I’d rather just have beer water with maybe a hint of excitement.
sure. its drinkable. good throwback beer. not my throwback of choice but its what the people like.

Serving type: can

Reviewed on: 04-13-2007 14:33:22
Smells of a cheese. Taste is mild and light. Looks quite well when first poured - a pale golden yellow color with a bright white head. Head disappears quickly.

Can.

A - Light straw gold with a good sized white, foamy head. Decent retention but little lacing left.

S - Light and clean. Grain and corn with a little hop smell.

T - Sweet corn and grain taste along with faint hop bitterness. A little mineral taste at the end.

M - Light and good carbonation. Crisp.

D - Easy to drink and refreshing. Similar to most beers of the style. Easy to drink and refreshing but not a great tasting beer.

Notes: Similar to most Macros. Not bad for a light lager and it has its place, but not really anything to drink.
Nothing to this beer, if you can even call it that. Watery, tasteless, and just something people drink to get drunk. not to enjoy a beer.
12 ounce bottle A pale gold poor white head probably the best lite pilsner out there smooth crisp and clean
Pours a yellow/urine color with a white head. Taste and aroma are... like urine.
Malty, slightly carbonated with a dry crisp finish.  A little better then bud light, but that’s not saying much.

Poured from a 24 oz can into a massive stein with the explicit purpose of getting drunk. The pour is clear yellow with ample carbonation in the body and demonstrates a two finger head that dissipates into a half finger froth after about a minute. The aroma is primarily corn, cereal grains, adjunct, metal, and a slight caramel toast. The flavor is also riddled with various incarnations of adjunct- corn and rice are most pervasive while notes of cereal and water are also quite noticeable. The palate can be likened to carbonated spring water, which is convenient considering what I’m about to do to it- throw it back and cringe. As much as I hate on this shit, I think its the best out of the BMC trio. Thats all.

Coors Light used to be my favorite BMC light beer (when I was much younger) but Miller LIte has assumed the position. You’ll also likely assume the position - on the toilet bowl that is! Damn, this is some God-awful crap.

This is my favorite American macro beer, which is not really saying much. It is a pale light gold color. I drink it in bottle form most of the time, but when poured this forms no head. Not much smell either. The taste is a bit bitter and very watery. If I have to choose this or Bud Lite, I will pick this every time. This really is not something you drink to enjoy.
How the hell do people drink this?  Try not to smell this stuff, and tenaciously avoid consumption.  I would just steer clear of Miller all together if I were you.......
I remember the old commercials " great taste - less filling" arguement.  Might be less filling but great taste my ass.  Simply a disaster.  I’d rather die of thirst than drink this again.
The cheap taste is definitely there, but hides it a little more than natty light.

Like this more than High Life for sure and comparing with budweiser I say this is slightly in the lead. That being said I can’t say this is a good beer, but no macro is intended to be, it’s just a cheap alternative to real beer.

A: I poured it into a glass just because I hadn’t examined the looks of Miller Lite in quite some time. I was astonished at how absolutely close to being clear this beer is. Just the slightest touch of yellow, and no head.

S: So much for that "triple hops" brewing technique, as all there is to the aroma is some grain and corn. Alright, maybe an ever so slight hint of hops.

T: The taste is a bit more "robust" than other BMC products (especially of the "lite" variety), but that’s not saying much. There is some actual grain taste and sweetness. Again, that "triple hops" brewing system must have been out of commission the day this batch was brewed...

M: Thin, light, and watery in terms of the body, and quite fizzy on the tongue.

D: This is drinkable in the way that water is drinkable (because that’s mostly what it tastes like). I gave it the rating I did for drinkability because while you can certainly consume a lot of them due to their rather neutral flavor, I just wouldn’t want to. At this point in my beer drinking life, anyway.
Miller has two things wrong. This is not how you spell "light" and this is not how you make beer. Miller Lite has more flavor, color and aroma after it has gone through my body.
I try to rate at least one beer a day... call this my vacation day. ;-)

Does the description really say "full-bodied" beer? Wow. Camel piss with would likely have more character than this crap. I did give it +2 for affordability: I have seen many a poor college student ruin his GPA with Miller Lite.
This looks like beer but resembles soda water which may have briefly been in the vicinity of beer at some point during it’s existence.

I’m say with fond memories that this was my training beer - it’s what I drank 25 years ago and I didn’t like the "taste" then.  These days, while it looks good in the glass and has great head, the aroma, taste, and even finish is very lacking.  If you think you like this beer, please wean yourself from it as soon as possible - there’s more flavorful beer out there, and beers where you will actually enjoy the aftertaste.

did a side by side with MGD.  confused by results.  this has less flavor which is a good thing since it tastes bad but do u reward watering down a product with a higher score?  if i had to drink a case or 2 of beer in an evening i might pick miller lite.  microbrewers unite! the people need to be drinking good beer not this crap!

After years of blitz advertising costing millions, this beer is near the bottom of the line. Miller should have taken the money and made good beer. Then the beer would have sold itself.
Anyway, it pours a pale yellow. Thin fast leaving head. Faint aroma of corn and chemical. Flat metallic taste. I don’t recommend it.

Pours a clear light yellow, small bright white head with lots of carbonation. Aroma is very light with very mild floral hops aroma, corny sweetness with a mild pils malt end note. Flavor is sweet but a very light grassy hops note takes a little of the sweetness off and a mild grainy ending comes in behind it all. Very light but high carbonation causes a strong bite to occur. Not the best beer but one that could be drank in mass quantities when needed.
Can.  Clear yellow, highly carbonated beer with a millimeter of head that diminishes to nothingness.  Smells of  the floor of a bar located in an apple orchard.
pale, clear,white foam, fizzy, As my roomate used to say "it’s just yellow fizzy pop"
Easily one of the worst beers ever brewed. The only excuse for drinking this is If you are drunk off of a superior beer, or if you are on a diet.
Light yellow.  Not much happening, pretty weak and watery, but with a hint of hops.  Wins compared to Bud Light or Coors Light, but doesn’t really stack up against much else.  I’d prefer water.
On tap.  Pours a light yellow.  Taste is hay, corn, and hint of hops.  Bland and boring, but readily available at many locations.
Bottle.  Light golden pour with quickly disappearing head.  Not a lot of aroma with some corn-ish sweetness.  Very light body with limited finish.
Bottle. Sorry but Miller Lite is probably the worst beer I have tasted. Almost no aroma or taste, incredibly thin and insipid. Never again!
on tap, pours light yellow with no head.  Aroma is skunky with some grass and adjuncts.  Flavor is sweet malt, hay, and little to no bitterness balancing.  Boring.

Golden pour with an offwhite head.  Aroma is corny sweet malt and adjunct.  Probably the sweetest flavor and aroma of the macros, very corny.  Finish is sweet as well.  Another 2 dollar draft, one of my least favorite of the macro regulars.
This beer has a very noncomplex flavor of simple barely. It has the characteristics of a light, very light flavored pilsner. I dont enjoy miller lite so I dont know why I purchased it.
(12 ounce bottle) Aroma is hoppy but overall bland nose.  Taste is watery and to a lesser extent hoppy and corn tasting.  Overall a cheap beer but not a good beer.

pours out clear yellow. noy much aroma.  i smell week hops, little citrus, and gas.  the taste is thin and watery.  a little bitterness under the water and the week hops.  not much care or thought put inot this beer,  i would definatley give this to a girl at a baseball game in the summer.

Can at Paul’s tasting.  No idea where this came from, or how it got opened, but figured it was worth the humorous tick.  Pours a still clear pale yellow.  Definitely looks like a specimen.  Smells light cardboard, paper, grain.  I’m not sure where the triple hops are, but the can we had (a delightful 24 ounce gem) seemed to have been made without all three hops infusions.  Flavor sadly follows the nose, a gross concoction of paper and rancid grains.  Couldn’t finish this.

This is a terrible beer, of course, even compared to other macros and pale lagers.  Smells and tastes mainly of corn adjuncts, almost like corn pops.  No clean bitter finish at the end.  Thin/medium mouthful.  It is what it is.
A true Wisconsin beer.  As a Wisconsinite I grew up on this beer.  Very light, goes down like water, and reminds you of a puke-filled college house.
Probably the worst beer I have ever had. Light golden color. Tastes like carbonated water to me. Poor excuse for a beer.
worst beer i have ever had in my entire life.  only beer that has made me gag a little in a long while.
Well.... It has more taste then Coors Light.. haha that’s not saying much....

Can. Pours a clear light golden with a medium frothy white head that leaves sticky lacing along the glass. The aroma is a bready corn malt. Thin mouthfeel with a corn malt taste. Dont understand the triple hopped because I taste no hops what so ever. Love to shotgun these before ever Texans game.

Miller Lite has almost no flavor.  For a mass-produced, corn-based domestic beer, that is a point in its favor.  Coors, Busch and the ilk all taste like shit.  At least this isn’t offensive, and it works just fine for a boilermaker.  Not good, but a clear step above most of the swill it competes with.

Light in taste and somewhat of a corn essence to it.  Not offensive, above average for a domestic light beer.  Don’t breathe in too much and you’ll be fine.  My choice of macro swill when I’m out and don’t want to pay the restaurant markup.
Not good.  Even for a domestic light beer.  Just not good.  They say they have more taste and that it is tri-hopped.  In this case that isn’t a good thing

Aluminum pint can.  Aroma of sweet malt and corn.  What can I say?  Drinking this extremely cold and honestly tastes like seltzer water.  Truth be told, I’ve drank thousands Miller Lites in my day.  Don’t know if it’s any better than Bud or Coors, all tastes the same to me.  That being said, there is a purpose to macro’s...fine party beer, golfing beer and good on a hot day.
Miller could of done better, but they insist on continuing to brew this spunk.  Take it off the shelves now.......

At least it’s not Stroh’s.  Seriously, this is one step above warm piss, and one step below cold piss.  Being advertised as having a "taste lock can" requires an actual taste, of which there is none, other than the stomach acid produced while consuming.  Pure crap at best, the only benefit is that it has alcohol, but not nearly enough for me to choke it down.  Admitting to drinking this on the regular should be accompanied by a swift kick in the junk.

water, malted barley, and hops. 3 ingredients required to classify a beer. Congratulations Miller Brewing Co.  Appearance of a dehydrated man’s urine and smells a bit skunky.  Taste is not terrible for an American Light,. but that’s nothing to brag about.  Beer brewed for the effects of alcohol and not for much else.

The smell is like you just finished washing some dirty clothes, the color you cannot see, for it is hidden behind the blue label, which is pretty... this rating is verbatim from my lovely wife’s comments, and so... here is her rating, sorry guys. This is the only beer my wife drinks and she made me post this. Cheers?

So, I went to a party and I put a few Murphy’s Stouts in the fridge with the confidence that it would be only good beer for the party. And it was. When I had finished my beer, I was forced to scavenge. There was nothing left but Miller Lite...and I thought I’d take the plunge.

Of course the results are predictable. This is a light beer. Nothing else really needs to be said. The color is light...the aroma is light...the taste &#40what there is of it&#41 is light, or rather "lite." In fact, this is a beer that nearly doesn’t exist.

The color is a very pale gold, kind of like a glass of mountain dew that has been diluted by melted ice. The head is slight and white.

The aroma, again, is very light but I can detect some hops &#40waaaaaay off in the distance&#41. Maybe a few were lying in the corner and they decided to sprinkle them in the vat. The taste is extremely distant, very crisp with little to no aftertaste. The one good thing I can say about this beer is that it is a good one for drinking a lot of if you like it, which I don’t.

Never again...never again.
Apparently this beer is triple hopped.  Apparently this is uncommon, because it’s a big deal for Miller Lite to do this.

Clear pale gold, headless. Actually aromaless, too. First impression of the flavor is a thin but decent pale lager, lightly sweet malt profile. The tongue becomes acclimated to this and it becomes not terribly distinguishable from seltzer water. Nothing objectionable, just insipid. Decidedly thin body, spritzy mouthfeel.
12 oz. Bottle. Pale color, minimal flavor and smell. Very watered down. Drink it only if you are on a budget or trying to watch your weight. :-&#41
can- FIRST DRINK- Dry and tasteless, carbonation disappears almost immediately. LAST DRINK- Nothing else to say other than watered down crap.

A light beer that you can drink a lot of. It really isn’t very good and is very comparable to Bud Light. The only reason this beer is still around is because of mass advertising and low prices, just like Bud Light.
Bottle. Awful all around. Poor body, aroma of urine, tastes similiar. Great for getting drunk quickly and cheaply.

The best beer on the market because it is triple-hop brewed and has special gold tops to seal in real pilsner taste.

GOT YA!

On tap at the brewery. Pours a clear pale yellow with a white head and lacings. Very light sweetness Hints of malts and hops. Very light bodied. Medium carbonation. Medium carbonation. Short, lightly dry finish. Fresh.

12 oz can.  Another bland macro lager.  This has more flavor than the Miller High Life I already rated on here, though.  Better than Bud LIght because it doesn’t give me a headache.  Better than Coors Light because it doesn’t go flat 3/4 through the beer.  Good for a macro, but by no means a good beer.
This is my brother’s favorite and my least favorite. Like every other light beer, but with even less reward.
I honestly think that this is one of the worst beers I’ve ever had.  Slightly better than Keystone Light...but not by much.
Tastes great? If you are a marketer on crack maybe. It’s watery, bad, and you pay through the nose to drink this crap at some football games.

Thanks to 17thfloor for sharing! Pours a very light golden color with a decent lingering frothy white head. Aroma is sharp and grainy, some corn and sweet maltiness over just a little bit of a grassy hop. Flavor is pretty bland, lots of grains mixed in with the unoffensive lack of complexity. Finishes with some mild corn and grains with the bitterness. Light body and sharp carbonation. Meh, another one mixed in there with the other macro pale’s
Beer flavored water! Only reason to drink this is low ABV and calories.

Far from a great beer, but enjoyable when you have intentions on drinking alot.  I pours a pale yellow color with an evaporating thing white head.  Though not important I do prefer over a Bud Light when at a party.

12oz can poured in a glass.  I’ve probably had well over a 1000 of these, but now I finally have one at home to rate.  Pours a thin clear light yellow with a medium thin foamy white pillowy froth.  Aroma is super light, some corn sweetness and maybe just maybe a touch of bitter.  Flavor is mostly water, faint touch of sweetness, never knew it was 4.2% but that makes perfect sense, touch of grain, super light, the faintest hint of hop spiciness.  Easily one of the most flavorless beers I’ve ever had, but it is one of the more clean examples of beer water.  Seltzer water feeling, light and watery with crisp carbonation.   It is also one of the more non-offensive of the macro waters, but that probably has more to do with the total lack of flavor.
Terrible. Tastes like hay, shit aftertaste. Don’t waste your time unless you’re playing drinking games.
Pretty awful beer.  Typical light beer though for a domestic brewer.  No flavor, no aroma
Somehow worse than the other comparable crappy American macros (Bud and Coors). Triple hops? Ha. Never an acceptable drink.

Typical large brewery lite beer made for the masses of beer guzzlers.  Don’t get me wrong, if I’m out with the boys to tie one on, then this is usually what I order.  Kind of like drinking water with alcohol in it.

Poured into a pint glass from 12oz can.

The color is pale yellow. Is a bit fizzy with a dark white head.

The smell is of light malt and hops but not very strong.

The taste is a bit watered down but is crisp. Has a malty flavor but very subtle.

This beer is good beer for going to a race since only cans are allowed. Also good for camping. This brew is available everywhere and is usually at a low price. Good for a low budget.

I think this is the first time I’ve rated one of the macros I grew up on but hardly ever touch anymore.  Yeah, not so good: pale malts, sweet corn and grain with a hint of metal.  But I can always drink one - like riding a bike or something.  Gets a bump in score purely for nostalgia sake.

What the hell was I thinking (in 1975)?  Regular Miller was okay (just); Billy Martin and Micky Spillane duped me - this was a bottle of sh*te.  Only took me 3 years to admit it.  Too bad, though - they had great TV ads.
not the best light beer, especially for its price. they need to make it cheap. too bad commercial beers as disappointing as this are millionaires who squeeze cash out of you for weak shit
Very light flavor, just a touch of crisp hops... I’m talking incredibly small. The only reason I notice the hops is because there is nothing else going on.
the beer of choice... that is of course if your underage...tastes like piss water
Had it in aluminum can.  Tasted like water mixed in with the smell of alcohol and a hint of hay.
More Taste League, says John C. McGinley??  I think not.  You may have been great in Scrubs, but c’mon, you can do better than those commercials.
Smells like puke, tastes similar.  I can’t put my finger on it, but I probably drink this light beer more frequently then others.  Must be the Miller commercials.
I’m disappointed. You can’t give negative points for shitty water pretending to be beer.
Ugh! Yes I drank back in high school in the 80s for a stint. Why??? Because I was dumb with few choices, whats your excuse kid????Watery, headless, taste of tin from the can
Tis water!  I swear.  Visited some US friends and was served this.  It was hot, I was thirsty, it went down.  Only excuse for drinking this.

bottle/can. Poured pale yellow with a lingering small white head . Generic sweet grain aroma. Light body, fizzy, crisp mouthfeel. Watery, corn grain flavour, sweet, with a trace of bitterness at the end.
Really like this beer if I plan on getting hammered.  Not much for taste but goes with about every occasion comes in handy when friends come over and ask for a beer.
Just what you would expect. A traditional light {lite} beer in USA. Little taste for tripple hopped. Still a big seller evan with low rating on ratebeer. A classic pounder.

Obviously not much to say, but I’ve drank way too much of this in my day. A college party beer with no flavor, and no aroma. I must say, however, that I prefer this over Coors Light and Bud Lite, not that that is saying much at all. Basically seltzer with alcohol in it.
Another pacer beer, but this time it is one that has a bitter taste. Ok if it is the ONLY beer around.  Other than that, I pass.
My least favorite adjunct lager.  Looks like the rest of them--straw colored with some head.  Smells and tastes skunked even when it’s fresh.  Hate it.

They’ve been pounding away lately in marketing those hops, and I suppose they are there in some faint way, but don’t insult us in implying there is some special process behind this thing.  It has a place, and that is on a beer pong table or in a beer bong.
pale yellow hue; minimal head and carbonation.  As light beer goes, this is probably one of the better ones as there is some definite hop flavour.  Still, it IS light beer.
On tap at Paddy McGuire’s (NYC): Rancid cat piss. The adverts annoy me way too much. Unfortunately, that’s the only memorable thing about this pils.  #064 on 12072009, DG.
Bottle . . Of all the light beers, this one isn’t bad.  Some hops flavors, although over-shadowed by sugar and corn . . refreshing?
Definite drain pour. I was given this and after 2 sips I tossed it. I’m now too spoiled on belgian and german brews.
A typical pale yellow beer with white head. However it has not taste and not sure how it ever won any awards.

Overall Impression: 
There isn’t a whole lot to say here, it is my least favorite of the Big 3 crappy micros.  It’s basically piss water, plus I hate the fact that they try to make it sound like it has taste in the commercials.
I hate this beer.  Its watery, tastes like piss and you can tell the triple hops process to kiss my ass.  This is such a horrible beer.
Now I know why people in America who don’t drink beer think it tastes like piss.
Draught.  Meh.  Pale yellow in appearance with small white head.  Very mild aroma of yeast and hop.  Taste is similar, very watery.  Sadly makes other light beers seem good.
Pale golden with a white head.  No taste to speak of.  You’re better off drinking water, in my opinion.

How is it possible that I haven’t rated this stuff?  24 oz can consumed on my commute home from work.  Pale yellow, white head (I can’t actually see this, but I’m pretty certain that’s what it would look like).  Smells like wet paper.  There is a bit of light malt aroma, but what is most amazing, is just how little flavour they have managed to not put in here.  Truly and impressively bland.  There’s just nothing here.
One of my personal most difficult beers to drink. Pours super light in color, and hints at the low low flavor profile.  Metallically tasting, and poor choice whatever the ocassion.
I can’t even begin to talk about how much I hate the "triple hopped brewed" "We’re a pilsener" commercials. This beer gets no points for those alone.
Having done three lite beers blind just to determine how much I actually disliked Coors Light. I thought I preferred the Miller. It ended up last out of three.
You should only drink this beer if your last name is Miller....or Lite......
Good party beer. Goes down smooth. Watery beer. Not a very good aroma. Not very carbonated.
This beer has no flavor or taste.  Not much of a color or app.  Not a fan of miller beer.

A very poor beer, like almost all light beers.  This is the beer that put me off of all beer for 10 years (1986-1996).  I tried this at age 18 and thought that if this is what beer is like, what’s the big deal about beer?  Luckily, in 1996 I gave beer a second chance.

Miller Light is awful.

RJT
Terrible beer.  Ugly to look at and even worse to smell.  Typical Miller beer.

12fl oz bottle poured into a dimpled mug.  Looks like piss.  Smells faintly of corn.  Tastes like corn with a hint of hops.  Very watery.  Slight carbonation.  Thirst quenching but not very flavorful.  Lightly carbonated.  Suitable for cooling off after yard work or for playing drinking games.
I truely dislike this beer.  Why do I want to taste my beer if it tastes like dirt.  And dont tell me not to put fruit in my beer when you brew with adjuncts.
Plastic bottle at a Coyotes game. Pretty much what I expected. Watery and tasteless. Typical macro brew. Quite a far cry from MGD which is not too bad. Awful.
Blah, Blah, clear yellow with little to no flavor.  Yellow water!! It was the only beer left after I drank all the good beer I brought.
Can bottle and keg.  This beer is bland light yellow color I really think this beer is made with all corn.  But it’s not fattening if that matters.

Can. Acidic, sharp carbonation. Light straw colour. A watery concoction of corn and brewing cereal, there may or may not be hops. It didn’t make me want to vomit, and I did finish the can, points added.

12 oz can @ my in-laws, since it’s all they have. Smells like water that was once running in a river somewhere vaguely near a malt factory. Tastes like metallic corn cereal dunked in sparkling water. At one point, I thought I may have tasted a hop (remember - ’’triple hopped"), so i gave it an extra point for that. One of the poorer light beers, which is saying something.
Not a big fan of the style, but if you want ot make a brew that is low calorie and low ABV, this one is about as good as you can get. Some flavor, not much, slighlty reminiscent of beer...
Absolute garbage.  Tastes like you are you drinking bad water.  About as clear as water too.  May be suitable for drinking games only.

How do you rate a "lite" pale lager (by the way, was this word created ’specially for Miller?) like this?  There’s nothing to it, but perhaps that’s the pinch?  Like watching a bad magician, or some crappy bar band in the middle of nowhere.  You kinda expect it to be bad right?  Well, if you consider this a "lite" beer, then Miller has hit a home run.



Drank while watching the Lakers vs. Magic game and suprised to see I haven’t rated it yet.  The beer poured out a light yellow color, clear, medium carbonation present and a 2" foamy white head.  The head seemed alsmost like cotton candy, just not much there.  Aroma was...nothing.  Zip.  Nada.  Smelled like air.  Flavor was light corn/cereal and not much else.  Not much else to it really.
The ultimate in light beer.  Goes with anything, anywhere, anytime!  Very commericail, watery, non filling, light in taste and color.  Can you say beer pong?

Pours a light golden color with a white head. Aroma is malt, water and not much else. Flavor is slightly sweet, lots of carbonation, water and not much else. I guess this is refreshing on a hot day, but it’s so bland and forgettable that I really don’t get the point. Still not a bad or offensive beer, just not that great.

Can. Absolutely nothing to this beer. This is the same score I feel I  would give to a glass of tap water. Nothing at all to it, but not offensive in any way either. Re-rated higher, because there are very definitely worse beers out there. Just nothing.
This is one of the worst American macro lagers, and that’s saying a lot, because that means it is one of the worst of the worst.

Keg at a party.  People were very excited that they had a keg at the party.  I, on the other hand, knew better.  With a feeling of great foreboding in my stomach, I sought out this so-called ’beer’ dispenser and filled a cup.  Aroma is nonexistant as far as I can tell, and it looks like the urine of somebody who is only about 1/3 of the way to dehydration with flagrant soap scum-like head floating brazenly on the top.  Despite my vast amounts of (at the time) sober better judgment, I took a quick swig of the offending liquid.  It seems somebody at Miller has a sense of humor.  As far as I can tell, they have taken a bunch of dirty dish water from their kitchen, mushed up a goodly amount of corn chex into it and then put that into a blender.  Perhaps they added a little dish soap to get the head.  Whatever they did to this liquid, I think it’s a misuse of water.

In the end, I sought out an actual beer in the fridge, which I had stocked there in the eventuality of just such an occurrence.  As I sipped at my own delicious beverage, I watched people coming and going, filling various unfortunate vessels with this abominable fluid dreck.  Those poor bastards, they didn’t even realize what they’re missing.  I weep for my fellow man, that he may never enjoy the deliciousness of excellent beer, and may be forced for all eternity to swill this bilge-water detritus.
Cheap beer.  Buy it for parties where no one really cares about the quality.  It’s brewed in my hometown and I can’t say much more positives about this "beer".

Sampled from a 12 oz can this beer poured a yellow color with a huge white head. The aroma was sour, corny, vegetal and off. The flavor was tangy, sour, dry and disgustingly off. The finish was short, tangy and foul. Awful!
Very pale in color as to be expected. Pours to a medium white head. has little taste and leaves no impression going down. I drank this to be polite as a guest, but would never buy it on my own.

2 of 6 in the Pale lager vertical, trying to clean out the fridge of crap. Light gold pour with a frothy white head. Musty corn malt aroma and a touch of those triple hops. Taste is corn sweetness, musty and some hints of hops. I’ve never liked this.
Wait a second- this looks like water, tastes like water, feels like water, but smells like dirty water. You’re saying this is beer? I’m saying this is bullshit.
The best beer i have ever had. Hands down. Ok, this beer sucks!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Did you know that Miller hops there beer three times throughout the brewing process? I did and can say it did not matter. Not a good beer but has its purpose when its time to play some beer pong. Make some cups and drink this stuff

Triple hopped, now what good is that suppose to do? I’ve heard the commercials "we add our hops three times..." if noone else does this, why does Miller. Now, I must admit, being from Illinois, I do favor Anheuser-Busch products, but regardless... Weak aroma, with pale yellow appearance. Flavor is slightly sweeter than Bud Light. Overall, I would say Bud Light minus one.
Terrible... Not worth the time of night. I’d probably actually take a few more steps to the left, and pick up a rack of Natty Light. Oh and it’s spelled "l-i-g-h-t" not "l-i-t-e".
Bottle.  Some sweet mustiness in the aroma.  Usual pale yellow body, white head.  Flavor is virtually flavorless.  Finish is absent.  Shouldn’t there be a law?

in honour of tom(magic dave) i had this at detroit airport, well it wasnt as terrible as i expected, but my antlers wernt baked, and i wasnt a fire moose in any shape or forum,very pale yellow,light wattery hop,light lemon, but very bland, but so innofesive i cant score as lo as the average
2009 Bottle - Pours lt yellow with a medium white head...aroma is sweet corn malt, metal...flavour is similar, grainy, i didn’t get much bitterness, finish is dry...yep...

Had this the other day at work, maybe it tasted better because it was the end of a crappy day. Noticed that it actually had hops in it. (said triple hopped on the can, but wtf does that mean??)  Looked like urine, smelled like corn with a touch of cheap hops. Definetly better than bud or Coors, but that’s like saying it’s the smartest retard.
I’ll sum it up in one word SUCKS!!!! I hate it. I think skunk piss would taste better!
Bottled. or Canned. But beer bongable. You can drink a lot of these. Taste, appearance, and aroma are not worth talking about
Got at baseball game for free and this tasted better than the other option which was bud
Not a horrible beer if you are looking to just slam a few or if you are in college and strapped for cash. Not a pleasant aroma. Not a great taste.
Can. Yellow pour. Box it came in advertises "triple hopped". Riiiiiight. Unsurprisingly, smell of dust, corn, cereal with a similar taste. Not pleasant, but not exceedingly foul either.
Of the crappy light beers, this is my preference.  I never realized it was only 4.2% though, maybe that’s why I can drink 18 of them...
Of the crappy light beers, this one is my preferred poison, aroma is that of city water and it pours urine color, use it for beer pong
Pretty much the beer in all bars on tap at all partys and at all stores that is tasteless and very bland

Metallic in flavor... is there really anything else to say about this?  It is what it is and has its time and place in certain situations.  I’m not sure what those situations could be but if you’re drinking this you pretty much have run out of beer options.
The beer of choice of the macro light beers. average flavor, well balanced with no major hoppy/malty differentiation. golden crystal clear color. smooth on the palate. Tailgate beer.
12 oz bottle.... well i guess my favorite domestic light beer, and i’d say better than amstel light, which doesn’t say much. good if im in the mood to drink 20 beers and pee 40 times.

~Pours a pale golden color with quickly diminishing head.
~That same familiar sour wheat scent found in all other macro pale lagers,
~Flavor is fairly decent. Very light with minimal sourness.
~Light clean feel. No aftertaste.
~It is what it is I guess. All these macro brews taste the same. Why are they so popular...

This beer really isn?t bad, compared to the rest of the macro-brewed pale lagers.  When I want to drink more than a couple beers, this is the one I go for.  Granted, the taste is barely present, it is more ?refreshing? than the micro-brews I have had.  This does not leave a dry feeling after consumption, which I see as a plus.  The rest of the macros taste like a beer-flavored water, whereas this does have a hint of hops.

One of America’s light beer staples, Miller Lite offers little in flavor or character. The taste is stale, watery and features some lemon essence. A load of carbonation makes for a real fizzy experience akin to seltzer water. Miller Lite won’t impress, but it’s not outright gross either. I’d pick this over Coors Light for instance.
Not much flavor at all.  I suppose that’s why it’s less filling- it’s practically water.  Pours golden yellow like most pilsners.  I’d just as soon drink out of a toilet
Poured piss yellow with white head. Aroma of water. Watery. Great for shotgunning.
12oz can from one of my student’s husbands.  Not that she has multiple husbands.  Pours gold with a bright white head.  Nose is yuck taste is yuck.

Of all the american pale adjunct mass produced overly advertised over priced consumer driven lagers this is one of the least offensive... Nearly water like in aroma and flavor in addition to a thin body and mouthfeel with next to no lingering adjunct in the finish make this a winner among the losers...
