12 oz. can.  Straw in color with a small white head.  Nose is of cardboard, corn, and funk.  Medium high carbonation.  Slight metallic flavor with notes of corn and a skunky off taste.  Who cares about the mouthfeel, this stuff is dreadful!

It’s a clean crisp beer that finishes easy. However, it lacks flavour and aroma. There is simply no body to this beer, much less personality. It’s under-carbonated as well. Refreshing nonetheless and, esay to pair with anything.

Probably my least favorite of the domestic standards.  I don’t much care for the taste. 2.0

RE-RATE 8/29/10 just for the hell of it.  Bottle in my apartment, carefully vortexed into a Coors Light glass.  Suck on that!  Clear straw yellow color with a white fizzy head that immediately dissipates.  Corny smell, with some pilsener malts.  Grainy and bready.  Flavor is very light.  Some metallic notes edge out the few malts this may have.  I’m pulling very little hops out of this, if any at all.  Slightly bitter aftertaste that disappears pretty quickly.  Not too fond of it but at least I gave it an actual rating this time.
Iam not much of a miller fan. If i was going to drink a cheap beer it would be Budwieser select.
The light beer market has many bad beers, this is one of them.  This is acceptable only when needed for drinking games, and even then I wouldn’t recommend it.
i’ll take more calories if that means this beer will stop tasting like the floor of the men’s bathroom at wrigley field. nasty. watered-down piss.
Clear golden color with an almost non existent white head. Light wheat aroma and flavor with a hint of corn. Not that great but I’ll take it over bud light any day.
Worst light beer ever.  I would drink natty light over this.  Dont even know why its on here and i am wasting my time typing this.

I just had the pleasure of rating a Rochefort 10 as my 100th beer, so I feel like it’s fitting that my preferred "college beer" is my 101st rating.  


In my opinion it’s the best of the macro American lights, it doesn’t have a lot going for it, but at the same time it’s easy on the palate, very drinkable, especially after the first 10.

What to say about miller lite. Well you aren’t always going to be able to drink great craft beers, so if you got to drink a american domestic mass marketed beer, you might as well drink this one. There’s not much flavor, there not much aroma, heck there’s not much of anything, but at least it doesn’t taste like gas either, so the next time your at the family barbacue, and there’s not much selection, this will do its job in a pinch. The appearance is a clear golden and visibly highly carbonated, and the head is a small white head, and both peter out in seconds. There is hardly any aroma, and there is hardly any taste, it does goes down like water however, so if your in the middle of the seventh inning of  wiffle ball derby at the family picnic and are thirsty, its drinkable. overall this is probably the best of the american domestic mass market light beers. 
But thats not saying much.

There’s really not to be said about this beer. It has as pale a yellow colour as possible. The aroma is barely there and is mostly corn and I dare say a hint of hops. The flavour is watery, with some corn, malt, and hops. A little overcarbonated and quite thin body. It does have a clean and short finish. The one thing I can say is that this beer is about as drinkable as it gets for light lagers. It’s one of those beers you can down quite a few of very easily. I definitely prefer this over Bud Light or Coors Light. Great for when you just want a cheap beer that stays out of the way.
12 oz pours yellow with alot of carbonation and even more head.  Alot of corn in the aroma.  Dryness in the initial taste.  Nothing else going on.  Cold and wet and that is it.
Given a choice between this and water, I choose water. In my opinion this is one of the worst beers out there.

This is actually the best of the Big 3 light beers, which is sort of like saying that Scottish terrier crap is the best tasting variety of dog crap.

Pale yellow color, white head.  Corn on the aroma and lots of corn in what little flavor there is.  Less taste, less filling.
Pale yellow, soft white foam.  No real aroma, steel, water, etc.  Taste is harsh adjunct and little else.

Not a light beer kind of guy, but if you are going to have a light beer, you should make sure that it still has some beer qualities. This is much like opening your mouth while pissing into the wind, or one would assume. I don’t recommend trying either...
Less filliing and less head, lacing, little malt, I think there may be a hop.  Let’s not forget the a handful of calories that are shedding off this unimpressive brew.
Can.  Color is light golden.  Taste is better than most light beers but that’s not really saying much.  Decent looking head but it disappears quickly.

A Mes rate. Bottle at Chris O’s pre NYE tasting. Clean pale gold with a reasonable white head. Card and corn, minerally, overly spritely blahb blah. Shite, but tolerable, only due to the lack of any character what so ever.
Mass produced, meant for the optimization of profits, and you’re not likely to get a quality product.  Thin head, some little lacing.  Flavor is not very strong.  Not much to it.
12 ounce bottle. Pours a very pale golden color. Thin head. Poor head retention and lacing. Aroma is grain, caramel and green apple. Taste is corn and grassy hops. Medium bodied.

Appearance: Clear, yellow body with a thin, fizzy, white head.

Smell: Very minor notes of pale malts and yellow corn.

Taste: Faint pale maltiness, a touch of corn, and a light sweetness. Exceptionally mild bitterness. Abrupt, thin finish.

Mouthfeel: Light-bodied. Medium-high carbonation.

Drinkability: It’s fine for what it is, I guess. And so poundable! You can down a pint before you say "I’ll meet you at the bottom!" I’ll take Remarkably Bland over Questionably Foul-Tasting any damn day of the week.

Rating based on the category it is in, plus being a mass-produced beer and a "light" beer.  Has been my favorite session beer for several years.  IMO the best of the "light" beers, especially in U.S.  Pours a pale, clear yellow with moderate carbonation and decent white head.  Very smooth, easy to drink.  Great if you add a lime while in the hot tub.  I only drink this beer out of a shaker glass.  One great thing for me is it has never, ever given me a headache with normal consumption (up to 6-8 beers).  Highly recommended "light" session beer.  Since this is all about our subjective analysis, I say...Cheers!
Can. Fizzy, yellow. Stale malt taste. Very watery mouth. Nothing substantial enouth to comment on.
Pours golden with a white head.  Standard sweet corn aroma and flavor, with a chemical, metallic twist.
12oz bottle.  Pours a white head with a clear, pale yellow body.  Smells of malt and faint hops.  Decently balanced flavor between malt body and hops.  Short finish.
An okay lite beer. Grassy, corny and watery, like most pale lagers. Another American beer well worth avoiding.
I had to have a sip of this from a US soldier on base. PUT IT BACK IN THE HORSE
TAP, BOTTLE, CAN: not good, but probably the best of the light beer garbage options most bars have - better flavor than Coors Light or Bud Light

Bottle drank at a local bar, yeah, I’m not proud of it. Pours a clear copper with a medium white head. The aroma is nasty, sweet, corn-like, something chemical induced. The flavor is really watery, smooth, some corn and adjuncts, an odd sweetness like plastic. Not my thing at all. After this, I wanted to do a shot, needless to say I did a few.
Flowering ass petunias. Smells of rancid corn. Clear yellow with a tall head. Taste is just bad. How did I ever think in my  teen years this was good. .
Probably one of my least favorite domestic "Premiums", fizzy/grain/water flavor. a little head, sour aroma.
An okay lite beer. Grassy, corny and watery, like most pale lagers. Another American beer well worth avoiding.
Bottle. Pours a pale yellow body with a white head.  A note of grass, corn, and metallic lingering.  Thin body and no alcohol.  Miller light blows.

Aroma, none.  Appearance, straw colored.  Flavor was almost unnoticable, but smooth when compared with some really really bad cheap beers.  Would drink if at last resort if nothing else decent was available.
the more taste league my ass this beer really sucks.  it is the worst in a bad category to begin with in my view.

Not a good beer.  It is very watered down.  When I was in high school, I may have thought this was a good beer, but now my eyes are open.  After having to drink this last night with people who argue that is a good beer, I have come to a conclusion, it has one purpose, to get people drunk.  No enjoyment in the flavor.

It is truly tragic that so many ammericans think to this as a good beer.  Obviously they have know concept of what beer is all about.  Clear, yellow water with beer flavoring.  I think I would rather have  a glass of water.

Biggish white head. Yellow body with light carbonation. Light sugary corn aroma with mealy artificial notes. Dryish-sweetish watery chalky corn taste with mealy notes. Watery harshish mouthfeel. Lacks resistance and structure, kind of flat. Dry papery cardboard aftertaste lasts a long time. Awful. Definite drainpour. (0.355l bottle, Systembolaget, Charlottenberg.)
Bottle.  Poured a pee yellow.  Yes...pee.  Smells like corn, tastes like water.  Can’t think of anything better.

For what it is, it gets the job done. Just don’t expect any taste or flavor. What you’re getting is mostly corn, water and some alcohol. I will say it’s a little better than Bud Light though. Your typical beer-pong fare.

Can. So I have to get this rating over with. Actually, this beer is not too bad. Pours like a macro pale lager. Aroma is sweet with some grass, straw, water. High in carbonation (obviously artificial). Taste is very sweet and unbalanced. Sort of like sweet corn water. Easy on the palate because it’s mostly water. Good for shotgunning, spraying around the room, giving to visitors you want to leave, and exploding on neighbor’s houses. A party favorite. Definitely a small step up from Natural Light and Busch Light.
A subdued version of Miller Highlife. As such it is fine as a calorie conscious brew. Light taste and truly less filling. Makes some impressive belches though.
I used to love this beer......then I got older and realized what beer is supposed to taste like. More taste? Ha, yeah right

Garbage. Chemical poison. This stuff isnt only bad to the taste its an unhealthy chemical cocktail, i refuse to call it a beer, its a ""beer styled alcoholic beverage"" period. I wish i could rate it lower than a .5, but i guess ratebeer decides its a .5 just because it has existence, and nothing positive beyond that.
Completely standard thin yellowish lager with no big taste.  Some lagers I can enjoy but not ones this dull, thin and fizzy.  Slightly artificial taste, lack of any finish.
Draft: Well when the choices at a hockey game is this or Bud, I’ll choose this. No flavor, no aroma, and extremely boring.

Bottle.   Light yellow color.  White head that quickly disappears. Little lacing.  No aroma.  No one wants to admit it, but we’ve all drank quite a few of these.  Its actually the favorite beer of all my neighbors.  And honestly it really is easy drinking, but so it water.  Its not bad really.  Its just not a real beer.  Its for drinking after mowing the lawn or while cooking on the grill, kind of like water.  Unlike a micro this one is best drank at the coldest temperature possible.  I only rate it this high because I like my neighbors and this reminds me of times spend with friends.  And Yes I do have a case of this in my basement (and a few in the frig), I’d hate to disappoint hte neighbors you know.

It’s good to know that when this bottle of Miller Lite is empty, I can walk over to the sink and refill the bottle...and will not notice a difference. My watch tells me it’s not Miller time...it is, however, time to abolish this horrendous ""beer"".
This is clear/yellow with some fizz which diminshes immediately.  This is best drank cold to hide the non-taste and watery corn flavor.
I drank this a lot in college. Pours fizzy yellowish. No real taste but does have some artificial sweetness in there.

can. High fluffy but lasting white head. Clear yellow body. Weak sweet5, almost nonexistant barley aroma. Weak sweet5 watery barley malt flavor. Cat it get more boring? Low carbonation. Short aftertaste.
used to be my favorite macro, but not anymore really.  Pretty crorny and sweet with a hint of hops.  Fine by itself, but foul when had after a nice and flavorful brew.

12 fl oz bottle. Pours clear yellow with a quickly gone head. Mild grassy and vaguely metallic grainy aroma. Flavour is medium dry and grassy with a light bitterness and vague grainy note. Bitter and vaguely hoppy finish.
Might be one of my very least favorites. No flavor, no appearance, no enjoyment. I might choose this over water. Maybe.

Pale on pale with a strange nutty (but not in a good way) flavor. Probably something with the malt balance used. Definitely more flavor than some other pale lagers. No hops bitterness just a clean finish except for that odd grainy flavor.

Canned on Northwestern Airlines. What can you do when you are stuck on a plane for 8 hours?
Thin, watery, easy drinking. It is not nasty, just tasteless.
bottle. this was my favorite beer until i found out what beer is suppose to taste like.when im at a bar and dont want to spend six bucks a pop its my go to.
This beer is what it is. It’s not going to change the world. It’s not even really good. . . at all. But it’s better (at least less foul) than the other macro lights, so in a jam I’ll drink it.
I hate this beer. I’ve had cans in my fridge for over a year because I will not drink it, and most people I know won’t either.

Presentation: It was poured from a 12oz can into a pint glass.

Appearance: It has a very light straw yellow color with an extremely clear body. There is lively Champaign like carbonation that quickly makes its way up to the head. The head is bright white in color and fades out quickly.

Smell: The aroma is faint. Only a very slight grainy malt.

Taste/Mouth feel: Its flavor is very light and clean. This is probably the cleanest beer that I have tasted. There is only a light, slightly sweet grainy malt with very mild grassy hops. The palate is light bodied, easy drinking with active carbonation and a very clean finish.

Notes: Very basic.
I despise this beer. No flavor, watery, very weak color, unless you’re playing a lot of beer pong and you don’t care about anything but getting drunk, don’t go near this one!

Yellow appearance. Watery, corny, and little flavor. Claims to be the best of the "light" beers but I beg to differ. Definitely a horrid choice if looking for something other than the stereotypical beer pong beer.

Edit: I’ve gone hot and cold with this beer. Recently have found a better appreciation for it due to my disgust with other light beers.

It’s difficult to imagine a more distasteful product.  This "beverage", deceitfully marketed as beer, will not only induce your gag reflex, but would likely give cause to denounce one’s belief in God.  This carbonated crap has been poisoning the beer biz since its’ unholy conception. The consumption of Miller Lite scientifically proves beyond a reasonable doubt that the pallet of its’ consumer is uncivilized, immature, and desperately ignorant.  In the urbane and terrene art of brewing, Miller Lite is nothing short of a national embarrassment.

[1639-20080830] 355mL can. Corny and grainy aroma. Clear, light yellow body with a quick white foam. Corn grains flavour has a little alcohol-spilled-on-the-floor grains. Light body. Not great.

(@ Diamond Princess cruise ship; near AK)

2008-08-30. Pale yellow body, headless. Muted barely there aroma, and similarly muted dilute flavour. Light bitterness is mildly astringent, grainy. Average to thin palate. Seriously? Sigh. Tick.  Can, Wakeview Lounge, Diamond Princess 
Apparently this was my 1000th rating for the United States.  w00t!
Can. Not much flavor, nor any color.  see-thru beer. . . typical waterer down american brew. for the masses.. . . .good all day golf beer though. . . .
Typical American lager, light and flavorless, watered down, nasty really.  Crisp maybe?
I hate this beer.  I’ve had cans in my fridge for over a year because I will not drink it, and most people I know won’t either.  I need to find some homeless...

Draught at Yankee Stadium.  Pours a clear pale yellow with small disappearing white head.  Aroma is very sweet and somewhat corny.  Taste of sweet corn.  Ultra light body, fizzy carbonation and no finish to speak of.  Even the great environs couldn’t redeem this dud.
bad, but not that bad. it actually had some flavour, not horrible, close, but slightly drinkable.

Yellow appearance, fizzy, clear, slimy head.

Faintest possible aroma, smells like rice, corn, and poverty.

Flavor is like corn syrup flavored seltzer water.

Tons of carbonation, thin body, clean finish.
As drinkable as water. I feel dirty drinking this.

Great Damn American Style Light Lager.
Always a great taste and great price.

If your trying to save some money but not kill taste grab a miller!
piss look without head... smells like rice and puke... i guess there has to be some wheat/hops taste in there but its not very strong and mostly piss...

Well after all that propaganda even Fredrick Miller himself telling me what time it was, I had to check my watch.  Yep, its Miller time.  Miller time can really be any time.  With your friends watching a game, with your dad fishing, or just sitting alone in front of a flickering screen on Saturday night still wearing the clothes you slept in the night before.  Its Miller time!  And this time it was a clear golden without the skunk that is usually a part of Miller time.  Just clean crisp watery flavors.  Like a clock flashing 12:00 on your VCR,  you know what time it is, the time it always is, Miller time!

Like a Leatherman®, you never really need one but it’s nice to know one is in the garage for backup. A familiar aroma that takes you back to high school and frat parties. If poured with more than a quarter inch head, most likely you didn’t tilt your class far enough. Best drank when cold or completing a 180 degree backwards keg stand. A watery yellowish color with mere resemblance of piss in the toilet. Always, my safety beer that deserves a rating.

Not too much to comment on here, slightly better than Bud Light. Again, this is probably best enjoyed if you are on a tight budget, as it is probably one of the better cheap mass-produced American beers.

Toast, hay and some grass on the nose.  Small head, light lemony gold color.  Very slight malt biscuits, hint of hops.  Highly carbonated, has a soda water characteristic and mouth feel.  The finish actually has a little to it (surprisingly), might be corn, but it seems a little malty?  All around a pretty decent mass-produced light beer.  A solid choice for what it is.

You can’t run from the past! I would never touch it again, but im sure everyone in america who has had a beer in their life has at least tried a Miller Lite. Pours a clear golden colour with a medium head. Grainy and grassy on the palate.
As far as domestic mass produced beer goes this is one of my favorites, or maybe it’s just always on sale.  I’m not sure, but I prefer it to the Bud Light my friends buy.

this is pretty much everything i could hope for in a domestic lager. sunshiney transparent yellow gel-cap lens floods the lamp light through to the table beneath. jet streams of carbonation flood and swirl in a summertime ascension through the glass. a huge rice flavor here. big lager refreshment. i hope to have sweated closets full of t-shirts by the time i get to this beer. the majority of my best backgammon has been played over this beer. long nights in the scott family backyard near campfires and pitchers upon pitchers of this stuff after great horror movies. the almost absent aftertaste of miller lite pulls the glass to my mouth to taste again, and again, and again that big cold lager jacuzzi that swirls up the face of every beer loving friend i know. i drink this beer every chance i get. hands down: my favorite "domestic" american lager.

Draught.  Thin adjunct odour.  Pale yellow with thin fast dissipating white head.  Water flavour with a tiny bit of malt. No finish.  This is another malt beverage for people who want to sit at the bar but don’t like beer.

Very pale yellow with a thick white head and a fair amount of lace. Almost non-existant aroma - Bitter and Slightly hoppy. Basically water however a little maltiness is detectable on the tongue. Very light and smooth. Not horrible for light macro
boil green candy ships. Snorting hot barnicles. A meat-spinning lemon party.
pale straw yellow pour with a white had that wasn’t around long at all.   very easy on the palate with an interesting fruity malt flavor that finished with hops.
Bottle poured to glass.  pours a clear yellow with white head that disipates quickly.  Almost no malt or hops aroma or flavor to speak of.  Crisp refreshing water with a mild beer flavor.
Not that bad but nothing I’ll buy again, I rather take MGD next time instead........

Miller lite, what can you say, it’s at every party, every bar, every place, and you always see people drinking it.

I think Beer gets peoples Mind Closed when they taste better beer. They go, "Oh no, this doesn’t taste like water. . .  blah blah."

I label this beer the "Dishwater" Beer, because it’s too watered down. . . 

Great for Impressing your friends when you do a 6 pack beer bong because this stuff is so light. . .  Really bad on Taste. . .

Pours a nice non-existent head, which soon dissipates.Ha-Ha. No malt flavor or hop characteristics. Only a slight corn taste with water mixed in. A lot more water than corn, I might add. This is one of the worst beers I have ever had
Miller says that this beer is award winning . . . they must be lying.  I have nothing nice to say about this one.  There’s cheaper beer (Boh) better than this, so why bother?

slightly hayish with a little fresh cut green leaf...  light golden appearance with a bit of piss...Looks refreshing. artificial sweetness but definitely no sweet n low..more like a knock off nutrisweet..little to no affect on the palate.. over all Hell Of A Beer!!
There’s really no reason to rate this, I’m just trying to pad my stats and get to 100 so I can quit rating and get the sweet  little crown next to my name. How’s that for being frank.

12 oz can.  I actually purchased a 24 can case of this stuff at near giveaway prices at the Navy Exchange.  I got a case of Lite and a case of MGD for $25.98 and then got a $15 rebate from miller.  Net cost $5.49 per case with no tax.  For that price I can drink it.  Its watery, fizzy, and flavorless, just a cheap macro beer that’s only good if you are mowing the lawn on an ugly hot and humid Florida summer day.  Works just fine for that.  The MGD was the better of the two but that’s not saying much.
The best, lowest carb beer out there.  3.1g of carbs, can’t beat that!

12oz can provided by my teammate Eric - thanks, Eric! The can looks dandy, I’ll say that. This beer is actually fairly interesting in that it doesn’t so much taste bad as it seems to lack taste entirely, almost like entering a negative zone of sorts. Weird, unnatural.
In my opinion, the most drinkable of all the American macro brews. Light yellow in color with a small white head. Smells like corn.
12oz. typical american macro. Good if you’re thristy. Drinkable , but there isn’t much there. Low aroma and taste with little for the palate, but it looked good on a 90 degree humid ass afternoon.

(Sampled 7-8-08 at Little River Casino in Manistee, MI) 20 oz. from draught- transparent light yellow color, thin white head that disappeared as soon as I sat down at a poker table for the tourney, aroma of skunk and funk.  Hits the mouth with a watery thin body, can’t really taste much of anything in this brew, finish is kind of lack luster.  The fellow to my left said it looked pretty good, had several glasses, which helped me go FULL POWER against him.  Hey, at least it’s good for something!
beer pong anyone?  Don’t let this beer go bad.  It looses flavor really quick. Best if chugged cool right out of a can.

am I really rating this?  Absolutely no flavor, but the beer does improve after you finish your sixth miller lite.  I used it as a water substitute on the back nine, having acquired a "bucket o’ beer" at the turn.

This 4 time gold medal winner is my 1100th USA beer rating.  Definately a beer for race fans.  Golden clear.  White head.  Aroma of chilled corn niblets, some scent of fizz.  Flavor is of crisp malt.  Some bread.  Finishes with a pleasant thirst quenching presence, like a cold glass of water.  Overall, this beer "tastes great, and is less filling".
Bottle. Pours a pale yellow, small white head. Aroma is cereal and corn. Flavor is the same, with more emphasis on cereal malt. Watery. It is what it is. Was at a party and this was the only option.
Slightly more flavor than say Bud Light, same appeal, easy drink to follow up yard work or the like.
Not a terrible light pale lager. Not good mind you, but I can at least drink it as opposed to bud light.
Bottle. Thanks god I had tequila at the same time too kill the taste. Hard to take bigger sip.

Bottle 0.355 l. Pale, fizzy carb. Nose is slightly hoppy and sweet. Flavor is .. well, pretty nonexistent, but there may be some corn, minerals and reeeally subtle aftertaste of hops. Dry, clean, almost like mineral water. Propably the mildest tasting beer I’ve had.
Generic American macro.  Nothing to say, fits in with the rest of them.  Looks, smells, tastes just like you would expect from this type of beer.
Its my get drunk beer.   After a night of around 12-13, I can still drink one the next day!
Wow, avoid this beer at all costs.  Pretty thick head for a light, almost too foamy.  The pour is a watery golden.  Beer tastes straight up like water too. No joke!
Same as the other typical American light lagers.  Not much character to it, but if I was going to have an American light lager it would be this one.

first of all, this is the best of the american light beers by the big 3 by far. it has a taste but best of all you can drink these all day, not get full and not feel like crap the next day. for these reasons i give it a respectable score of 2.0.

Draft.  Pours a very pale straw color with an average frothy white head that diminishes quickly yet leaves fair lacing. Virtually no malt aroma but has some corn-like sweetness. The flavor is crisp and clean. Highly carbonated. Slight acidic bite in the finish. Very light bodied almost watery. Refreshing. Great session beer.

Draft: This was my staple beer until finally branching out to craft beers.  Now it is just sad and depressing.  A reminder of what once was :&#41  But yes, it is the better choice between the other light beer giants.  Still has that signature rice cake and corn meal flavor like the other macros.

If all the big 3 light beers are on the table, I’ll choose this one, abit more bite and not as watery as the others, but nonetheless, it still lacks alot. Its fine on a hot day, out of an ice chest though, just have to watch the quanity I drink.

i very good brew for a light beer i think miller lights the best almost tastes just like regular beer a little high though but well worth the price if you have to drink light beer now like me over all a good beer
this beer is gross. period. If your going to have a macrobrew, PLEASE get labatt’s or heineken. This beer has NO FLAVOR whatsoever, and in my opinion, the worst of the macrobrews.

Draft.  Pours slightly darker straw than most piss macros with good white head.  Aroma of corn and a little grainy.  Flavor was not THAT bad.  I actually think if I prefer this light beer over the other big boys.
Bottle. Simple beer devoid of any character what so ever. Drinkable but not much more

12oz bottle from Publix Supermarkets (Tampa). Pours clear golden with a thin white head. Aroma is sour bitterness with notes of wet, dirty towel. Flavor is watery, slightly bitter, empty and nearly devoid of detectable flavor with a quick, watery finish. This beer is best as a thirst quencher on a hot summer day, but worth little else in our opinion.

Had this in a can, that’s right, cans!

Anyhow, its been awhile since I had this beer so I had to approach it objectively.

It has an aroma of beer, but not a very pleasing aroma.  Smelled skunky to me, but the beer was not bad.  

There was a weak carbonation, and the beer is watery leaving almost no appealing palate.

Flavor is of a watered down pilsner, little bitterness or hop character to be found.  Some adjunct flavor persists, possibly rice used as an adjunct?

I’m not a connosoir of the style, so I’m not sure why this beer won at the world beer cup several times.  Surely there must be better examples of this style.

I could see this as being a session beer, but not for me as I just could not drink more than one at a sitting.  It just did not appeal to me at all.
The best of the American light beers.  Draft is the prefered method of drinking this one.
Had on tap and in bottles.  Probably the best "light American beer" but still horrible!  Cannot see why anyone that enjoys beer would want to drink any "light" beer from America!
I really don’t mind this beer, would never be my choice if i were buying, but would happily accept...better than the other big brewery’s light beers...if i buy a keg, this is typically what i get
if I am at a sports bar and nothing else is available this is the beer I drink.  At least its not a bud product.
Not much to this beer.  pours dull yellow with a white head that doesnt last.  not much to the taste.  if you are looking for a beer to drink one right after another go out and get you some.

I liked the comment that refered to it  as "watered down dish soap.  My review has nothing to do with being a beer snob, Miller lite is just not good.  I had it out of a keg at my buddies wedding but only because it was the only beer there.  Watery, Pale, only a yeasty off-flavor is present.  No Hops, no malt profile, nothing.
It’s a better alternative to the Bud Light my buddies buy.  You can’t beat it after working in the yard all day.
Waterish. the most popular usa beer, what marketing does :) simply, there’s nothing special in this one, it misses nice firm head, it misses hop taste.
Has a flavor that reminds me of watered down dish soap. I can’t bring myself to drink it under any circumstances.

I would never buy this beer, but, as a Notre Dame student, I would drink this beer: 1) at my friend’s tailgate because he had coolers stocked with this 2) at Corby’s on Tuesday nights because it was $4 for a pitcher.  I might be in the minority hear but I like Bud Light better as a cheap volume beer (hell I’d even drink Busch or Natty before this sadly).  I just remember having to drink the end of those pitchers and fight through it.  Probably will never drink this beer again unless it was all that was available.

I actually like Miller Lite.  Apologies to Schaefer, but Miller Lite is often the beer I drink when I’m drinking more than one.  Sometimes you just want something that’s drinkable & cheap.  It even has a smidgen of flavor. Certainly better than High Life Light.  Spend the extra buck on that 18 pack.
ML gets extra credit for being available in such an array of sizes from 7oz to 40oz.
For a lite beer, this is my beer of choice when going out to a bar. The lite quality of the beer makes it easily drinkable. The beer is clear and a brilliant pale yellow/ golden color.

Brilliant pale yellow/golden. Mostly diminishing white head.  Smell is not very delightful; gasolin-soaked grains  whith a whiff of sweet cardboard. Sweet corny taste. Some sournesss i the end.  Not for me.

From a 24 oz. can with an expiration date of Jan. 7, 2019.  I am trying to re-rate some of the beers I rated in my early days on RB. My new ratings are based more on style than name. It pours yellow in color with a long-lasting white foamy head and lacing. Good clarity.  I'm upping my appearance rate because it looks like it is supposed to. An intriguing toasted white bread crust aroma with a decent sweetness but a low, grassy hop profile. Actually it smells bolder than I would expect a light beer to smell.  While the body is light and watery, the taste brings out a bready sweetness that puts it above those in its class.  Crisp, clean and refreshing finish. Better than I remember.




(2008 rating - 1.9)From a 12 fl. oz. bottle marked 08048 B51013.  Pale yellow carbonated pour with a white fizzy head that diminishes quickly.  Not much in the aroma department,  Corn? Grass?  Maybe even a tad bit of malts?  The taste is watery but hellloooo, if I swirl it in my mouth long enough there is a tiny hint of malts.  Typical for its style but a bit better than some of the others.
For a light beer, it is fairly drinkable.  I find it more flavorful than some of the high-brow lights, like Amstel or Becks.

i drink all the time because my dad buys 3 30s at a time so when i go to their house with my daughter hell yeah its free. but he only buys cuz hes boycotting a-b. taste isnt good at all. my main gripe about it is the price. hell high life is cheaper and better. so is the beast light. bartended for 12 years. girls drink lite guys drink bud. nuff said.
uh.....sometimes, before walking into comerica park to watch the tigers, i go to gaslight bar and....kind of enjoy a few.
There’s nothing "wrong" with miller lite per-se, but that doesn’t mean it is good.  I’m not sure I would give any beer a zero...well any beer allowed to be sold.
Come on!  Don’t be a beer snob.  There is nothing wrong with Miller Lite.  A good beer to drink while working in the yard, watching a game, etc.  It isn’t gourmet, but it does the job.
12oz.  There really is no aroma to speak of, some sweet corn and the faint hint of pear in the body.  Doesn’t even have the high carbonation most of these domestics depend on.  Good riddance.

This is a very pour brew indeed. Has the usual watered down taste as with most light beers, with little flavor. With the flavor it does have tastes skunky, leaving a bad aftertaste. Not the worst light beer I’v had.
I drink this because Burt Reynolds was in one of their commercials, and he was a member of my fraternity (Phi Delta Theta) and that’s awesome!
I’d only drink it on a hot day/at the stadium, etc.  That being said, it is better than the other American Light Lagers.

Pours a sparkling pale golden color with thin, quickly discipitating white head.  Subdued aroma with slightly discernible corn/rice malt scent.   Very thin, watery mouthfeel and a lot of carbonation.  Weak flavor with subtle hints of rice/corn flakes.  Crisp, short finish with clean, very gentle hop bitterness.  Try with backyard grilled chicken or meat, or a cheeseburger with french fries.
Never liked miller, and now I can let everyone know.  Bitter, bad aftertase, you name it, its got it!
Better than Bud Light, although the commercials aren’t as good.  But at least Mencia isn’t around.
Draft.  Pours light gold.  Smell of skunk and corn.  Taste almost oily.  Not offensive if on a diet.  Better than Bud Light, but then again what isn’t?

Ugh, do I really have to say anything in my rating of this one?  It’s not good, it’s watery, it’s bodiless, it’s good for getting drunk.  Or better still, good for staying drunk, once you’ve had enough you can’t taste it anymore, right?
The standard in the industry for a light pale lager leaves me scratching my head. How can so many people think this is good. And to top it off I once paid $7 at a ballgame for this crap.
Of all the light american beers, this one is my favorite. If I need a great session beer, better go with one that "tastes great, and is less filling!"

Hmm... I have to admit that I’m being a bit  liberal in my rating and I don’t feel this particular beer is worth anything less than a 1. All things considered, when it comes to a domestic pale lager, this isn’t a terrible beer, it’s just a terrible beer style that many of us here on RB.com despise. It’s an extremely popular beer outside of the website and a decent version of a pale lager. That all being said, this is not a type of beer I enjoy on the special days. It has no appetizing aroma or color, and the head is about the fakest looking one I’ve seen on a beer. I wish I could comment on the malt or hop characteristics of this one but I just can’t decipher them when the everpresent taste of acetone covers my mouth. In addition to that, I have a constant feeling that this beer is actually detrimental to my health. It’s a shame that SABMiller produces such concoctions, when you think of the other products in it’s portfolio (Magnum, High Life, 1855, etc). This beer may have worked for the 19th century, but come on, it’s time people move on to much better beers to enjoy.

Pale yellow, little to no head. Smelled absolutely awful. Reminds me of the Homer Simpson’s line, "and not just monkey feces!" I couldn’t believe what I smelled, so I opened another, and it was still there. No flavor, which means no bad flavor. Watery, no carbonation, just awful. But not as bad as Bud Light.

Sad to make this the first rating, but it’s all that’s in the house. Really inadequate drink. The smell just reminds you of frat parties or beer pong. If all you’re doing are those things, this is an alright cheep beer, but you’ll not shake it all night. The color is very golden, almost pretends to look nice. It’s not the worst beer in the world, in for nothing else but for the price if you need to get beer for a bad party.
This is a Good beer on sale . if you dont care about taste . Drink this in excess , then you wont care .

Bottle:  Ugh.  The only thing available before the cooler was restocked.  Just about the only reason I even opened was the bottle was to get this rating out of the way.  Way too watery, very little flavor, dry with a strange sweetness.  Not enjoyable.  The fact that it takes me much less time to drink a 10 - 12%+ alcohol beer really says something.  The only reason this doesn’t get a .5 is that I’m sure there is something worse out there.
i love this beer great flavor great after taste and you can drink it all night long and not get sick of it.  Excellend beer I love lite beer its my favorite beer.
Bottle:  Poured a golden yellow.  This was the best part, the color.  There was not much aroma or any notice of hops in the flavor.  There was nothing special about this beer.

Color: Pale yellow gold. Off white fizzy head. 

Nose: Simple. Spring water and caramely malt. 

Palate: Thin. Nice malty character. No complexity whatsoever. Noticable absence of hops.

I can’t dog this beer as much as I would like to. It serves a purpose. When you get done mowing the yard and want to swill something other than water it is great. It is light. You get malt and water. I can’t complain. Not my favorite, but it doesn’t taste bad.

Bottle at Joe Farellis, Gtb.
Yellow. Aroma light malty (caramel) and some hoppy notes. Flavor light sweet, light light bitter/acidic. Watery.
I love this beer.  This beer a taste that everyone can enjoy.  It is one of the US best pilsner beers that is around.
Pilsner?  Who knew?  Flavor for days!  It’s pretty much one of the worst fluids on the planet.  Toxic runoff included.  Avoid.
Typical American Pale Lager.  Very wattery taste, somewhat skunky smell.  Probably the best, extremely cheap, light beer.  Better than bud light but thats about it.

I’ve been offered a Miller Lite a couple of times over the past weeks in situations where I would look like a jackass to turn them down (ie someone already bought one at the bar for me), so here it goes:   Extremely pale yellow pour with a small white head.  Aroma is of corn and little else.  The first drink or two taste awful.  After that, it’s like drinking water.  Just some slight corn aftertaste.  If I’m going to drink swill, I’d much rather drink Budweiser products.
Pretty awful, but it was the keg beer of choice for college parties as it was a step above keystone lite.

btl thanks to jcwattsrugger a gag gift (no pun intended). Did a blind tasting of 4 light beers. Miller lite, Bud light, Straub light, and a Fla lite beer that was mislabled at the factory. It work out kinda like this:
Miller lite 3.2
Bud light 3.0
Straub light 2.9
Fla lite beer that was mislabled at the factory 2.5
Hands down the ML was the better beer not a lot of flavor, not a lot of body, but carbonation was decent. It looked good it smelled like I guess it should. I’m just not crazy about the style. For those of you who wonder why some people don’t rate to style? I still don’t know I try so there is a 1.5 factor in my rating multiply these rates by 1.5 and it will give you the number you want. thanks John:) cheerstevo

I have been drinking good beer for several years and started rating several months ago.  I decided to return to my roots for rating number 100; those years in college of drinking the cheap stuff.  So I went to happy at a local bar, explained the situation and received a blank stare from the server, "You’re 100th rating is going to be a pint of Miller Lite at Applebee’s in College Park, Maryland?"  I carefully evaluated my pint, scribbled some notes on a napkin, and quickly chugged down the rest so I could move onto to better beers.
I find Coors Light and Bud Light better.  Not good.  If you must, go for it but it’s a bad beer.
This beer has a poor taste compared to others in its class. Miller cannot contend with Budweiser.

Very pale yellow with quickly dissipating white head.  Weak corn aroma to go with ultra watery palate.  This is some awful crap!  This gets mass marketed to the public and they drink it up… why?  The lame ads probably?  Tastes great?  I think not… it’s the worst beer I have ever tasted in my life.  It was tough choking down a few sips before I tossed the end of it.  Luckily it was free.

Miller holds a place with most American light lagers in being very tasteless. Compared to most other American Light Lagers, Miller does however have a bit more of a hop flavor. The color is pale yellow and there is no real aroma.
Pours a clear yellow color with thin, fizzy head. tastes very watered down. Bad, even for a light beer.

Pours a yellow color with a white head.  Has almost no aroma or taste.  Mildly malty, maybe corn?  Otherwise, similar to water.  Light bodied.  Hopefully, watching a baseball game will make it more enjoyable.
Can. Pours light yellow with a white head. Aroma is lightly sweet with a note of cereal grain. Light body, crisp. Flavor is almost nothing, with a very faint hint of malt.

For a light, or lite beer this stuff isn’t THAT bad.  Certainly not my first choice but will get the job done.  Pours a urine yellow and there is hardly flavor.  I must recommend that you ONLY drink this when it is fresh... you let this bad boy sit in your fridge for a couple of weeks and it degrades very fast.

This is *THE* beer that inspired that corny Australian joke:  "How is American beer like making love in a canoe?  It’s f***ing close to water!"  And that "water" tastes like chlorine and chemical filled municipal water at that.  This is one of the most horrific beers on earth.  I will not drink it, no matter how desperate I am for a beer!
Awful.  This is worse than Coors and Bud.  It has like a fake beer taste.  Almost like they used imitation light beer flavoring in it.  Sorry for actually drinking it, please forgive me.
Swill... pale, thick white head, sweet corn smell, no flavor except for corn and carbonation. I really have nothing good to say about this beer. Again I say SWILL!
I’m embarrassed to say I actually consumed a large amount of this on my way around the States. I was younger and unfortunately didn’t know any better.

24 ounce can.  Pours a light yellow with a good sized white head that lasts.  Taste and Aroma is fairly clean, but corn and malt can be picked up.  Goes down easy, but it Is on the watery side.  I am kind of disappointed with this beer.  It looked so good after I poured it, but the taste didn’t meet what I was expecting.  Overall, it isn’t bad, but there are better beers in the same price range.  Plus Miller High Life and MGD are much better.
...drank so much of this shit it’s ridiculous.   Pretty much, out of all shit, american light beers, this is the best.  Slight, and I mean slight hop and malt flavors, but that is it.
bottled. pours very light yellow. white head. no aroma to speak of. No flavor to speak of. Not good.

This is the beer I am drinking when I am drinking a big 3 national beer.  At least it has some flavor, it’s low in calories/carbs, and satisfies when really cold.  Not great, but give me this over a Bud any day.
great for an everyday, low calorie, low cost, beer. EVERYDAY is the word i repeat. nothing special but great for the blue colar beer drinker.

C’mon - you get what you pay for - extremely drinkable (I can pound 8 with no appreciable buzz), no hangover qualities and, face it, it tastes as good as Corona, Modela Especial, any cheap ass malt-liquor, and any other major ’light’ - e.g. Coors or Bud.  Granted, it’s adjuncts in a can, but what were you thinking of when you bought this??  It’s not like you’re getting something you didn’t bargain for...
bottle, poured a pale yellow color. taste of barley wheat and hops. not really filling. not really a great beer.
Not too long ago, this was the cheap beer of choice for me.  Just your average barley pop that you find at the old ballpark- it has its place.

There’s just nothing there, good or bad.  It has no aroma and very little flavor--just enough to know that you’re drinking a beer.  It’s not bad (I wouldn’t pour it out), but you can do better even staying in the same price range.

less filling tastes great you cannot rate this beer acting like you were expecting chimay cmon people you buy a crapload of this for a party or when your watching your money open and enjoy nothing more nothing less God Bless America!
Light in color. Decent taste but  a bit of an after taste. Not a bad light beer but there are better ones out there. A decent coice for bar drinking.
A good beer to quench your thirst, if beer could be thirst-quenching that is. Cheap American lager. If you buy this, you know what you’re getting into.

I don’t get it.  I can get through a fair number of Busch Lites fairly easy.  This stuff makes me sick.  It is not a pilsner, I don’t care what the bottle, can, bar mirror says.  I am not a snob, but this is the worst macro lite in my eyes.
Typical beer flavored water. Really nothing special.  Its good for parties.  Thats about it though.
aside from pbr, this is the best of the massproduced see-through beers.  hey, its better than water, but not much...

Had this at again last night at a local bar and I really don’t mind it. I have two sides. The craft beer snob and the light beer drinking sissy. I like light American pale lagers because they are refreshing, easy to drink and very crisp. This is typical light beer. Not much aroma other than "beer". Pour is a nice gold with tiny bubbles and a 3 finger white head (had it on tap). Taste was heavily carbonated ice cold water with a hint of metal. Great when I feel like "mingling" with the lower class BMC drinkers!
works for parties where everyone is aiming to get drunk. other than that there is little reason to drink this beer. its weak and unsatisfying.
This stuff is crap, you can almost taste the corn.  If it was between this and boxed wine, I’d tear the bladder out of the Franzia box and go to town on the wine.
better than coors lite better than but light overall not bad for a macro lager. meh ive had worse
The best 12 pack beer in the land. I’m biased, I;ve been Miller’s #1 customer since 1975.
Can.  Color is light golden.  Taste is better than most light beers but that’s not really saying much.  Decent looking head but it disappears quickly.
Compared to Bud lite, this is amazing. Compared to real beer, this sucks. But, it has a good price and helps me stay svelte. It gets extra points for the last two points.

As many others have said, probably the best American light beer (besides Sam Adams Light), better than Bud Light (for what it’s worth).  When it’s really cold, it’s pretty refreshing.  I’m not ashamed to pound a few of these when I just want some cheap thirst-quenching and to catch a little buzz.

Well, everyone knows this beer.  As far as Pilsners go it’s okay, I like it because its cheap, and where I come from that aint bad.  I would cross a desert for it but I wouldn’t turn it down if offered.

Pours a slightly yellow clear. White, foamy head. Aroma is light and yeasty. Basic generic beer scent. Flavor is barely there. What is there is dry and yeasty. Slight corn undertone. Goes down smooth enough, but whats the point? Theres no taste. Just one more to add to my rated list.
This is beer I grew up on. golden yellow in color lite crisp taste. Prob the best of domestic commercial lite beers. this is the cheap beer I wind down with at a bar, no one hate on me

This is another good example of water going to waste. I do drink this, but only at bars when it’s on special and if someone offers me one, but altogether, no! If you’re reading this, then you must have an apperication for taste so my suggestion is well....yeah.....

Can. Average fizzy white head that mostly diminished. Fair display of lacework. Clear sparkling body with a pale yellow color. Aroma of light grass, cardboard, hint of caramel. Light bodied with a light thin texture and an average carbonation. Light sweet bitter flavor with a hint of sweetness. Light bitter and watery finish.

12oz bottle.   Pale yellow, dying head.   At the recommended serving temperature, there is absolutely no aroma, but when it warms, a little metal comes out, nothing too bad though.   The flavor is curiously absent.  I thought I was drinking colored carbonated water.   There is really nothing there, bad or good... maybe a little acidity from the carbonation.   Ditto on the body.   Well, there are no flavors that I really find offensive, but that is the least of my worries.   A good beer if the last thing you want is to taste beer, or otherwise.
Filth!  Aroma - 0.  Appearance - 0. Flavor - 0. Feel - 0.  This beer is like all other lights, nothing at all brilliant.  Nothing at all in the beer.

While it is the best of the cheap American light beers, that’s not saying much.  Appearance: piss, Aroma: about the same, Flavor: fortunately almost none, Palate: selzer water. Just figured it would be entertaining to rate this one.

A - none
A - almost transparent
F - none
P - fizzie 
O - If it wasen’t for the yellow hint one would not be able to tell it from soda water.

Miller Lite is defiantly the best of the big 3 domestic beers, but then again that’s not that big of a compliment. This beer has a light aroma and a normal golden color with a minimal head. It tastes average at best and is similar to your typical light lager but not as watered down like bud light. Overall this is the king of light American beers, but sadly Miller Lite still doesn’t surpass your standard everyday beer.

Not as bad as I was expecting. There is actually a slight itty bitty malty flavor to the beer, and there are no particularly bad flavors in the drink. The only complaint here is a near-complete lack of good flavors.
very bland typical american lite beer, great to drink if going out all night partying not big on flavor or aroma, hopefully drinking this will help my diet
Its the best "Pale Lager" macro there is. Better than Bud Light! Whatever
it almost tastes better the High Life! i could drink a million of these, but it wouldn’t be satisfying.
drank from the bottle on Bourbon Street. Even the atmosphere didn’t help. Someone got a two for one and gave it to me. I did drink lots of this in early college.

this is a very very good beer for the cost. Really thats what important. Its not what i choose when i’m putting out alot of money for a solid beer after work but when im going out to get drunk then this is my 2nd choice right after beast ice.
Certainly my favorite beer available in a 30 pack, decent for getting crunk on and for when you’re already crunk and quality isn’t much of an issue

What do you say about a US macro pilsner/lager? In judging this I was actually surprised that the flavor didn’t really turn me off but it was drinkable if nothing else. It is in the palate that the ’yuck’ factor comes into play. Water yellowfied - that’s about it. Drink it to get drunk I guess.
This is my favorite beer....very flavorful for a mass produced lite american beer.  There is a reason I buy it in 30 packs.
This is my favorite light beer. I really only like to drink it if I am going out to get fucked up.
Really not much to this beer, but who honestly expects there to be? For what it tries to be, ML is fairly decent at a nice price. Best of the "big 3" lights, in my opinion.
One of the worst beers on earth.  I’d rather drink Mickeys or Old English.  Water goes down better.  The only thing saving this is it has alcohol in it.
Well, how the fuck is this even beer? How does this have a massive following? I’m completely lost. 1 dollar a pint is very convincing though. I joined this party for a night.
Nothing special to say about this beer except if you are on a diet and want to drink beer, this is your beer at only 96 calories.  Expect to go to the bathroom often!

Can. Maybe it would be better on tap. I kid, I kid. Aroma didn’t make me want to vomit, so it gets a 2, although it was a bit odd. All beer is somewhat pretty, so gets a 2 there also. I can drink it, so it gets a 2 overall. Way too carbonated. Yay.

12oz bottle: given to me from a friend, he is no longer a friend. pours golden yellow with white head. aroma has a trace of malt. flavor is like carbonated water but with a hint of malt. overall this could be one of the more drinkable pale lagers with nothing that stands out that i dont like but then again nothing stands out at all.
One of the worst beer’s i’ve ever had. I hate to even use the term beer for this watered-down piss drink. The only thing I got from this was a headache.
a 0.5 is way to high for this very terrible tasteing water this dawg doesn’t drink lite

First off, you guys/gals need to remember you are judging the beer, to see if it is true to the style, not personal preferance. And, this is a light American macro lager. 

Not what I drink, haven’t had a "light" beer for years, but, decided to give it a go.

On tap, served in a frosted mug. 

Typical appearence, maybe a shade "darker" than Bud light. White fizzy head.

Aroma: Not much, some corn, some malt

Taste: Again, not much. Nothing offensive. If you look deep, you can taste a bit of light toasted malt, and a trace, slight trace of pine/citrus.

Again, these beers are built to be flavorless, and colorless. Remember this when you review.
Nothing Great. Pours light gold with a very thick head. Has a grassy dull aroma to. Minimal hoppiness with a watery flavor. Blunt finish. Not a great product here. Find more taste in bud light.

This actually wasn’t so bad. I have very limited experience with macro lagers (I’m rare, I know) and this was available at a company function, so I figured, heck, it’s free, why not try it? Sure, it doesn’t have much taste. But it actually tasted like beer, even though the flavor was very "tame" (to but it nicely). This was actually better than the Budweiser I had a few months back. Some beerlike flavor, a little beer color, even a small head. The mouthfeel was smooth (but then again, water is like that). Don’t get me wrong, I’d never have it again and would rather drink water, but at least it wasn’t offensive.
While much better than many of the other macro-brews (Bud light and Coors light) drinking Mller Lite in close proximity to a good beer shows how disappointing American lagers can be.
I prefer this out of the super macros but still crap. But will take this before a super shitty micro

This beer is overrated. Miller should put more time into their beer then they do their commercials. This beer is over carbonated. I find myself burping constantly. Way to gassy. Probably the worst miller product.

This is an example of standard American beer.  Clear and lacking body and flavor, it is easy to drink and a favorite of the masses, but not for the more educated beer fans.  I blame this beer for stunting the beer education of more people than any other.
Tastes like skunk urine. One of the worst if not the worst beer in my opinion.

12 oz can.  Appearance is thin and oily, a putrid, dull yellow.  What little aroma this "beer" has is more of a pungent odor.  Flavor is similarly non-existent at first, but latently offensive.  Tastes like licking an attic floor the morning after a kegger.  Hailing from the Milwaukee area myself, I’m ashamed that our claim to fame is this poor simulacrum of beer.
Not as bad as I was expecting. Aroma is grassy hops with a skunk undertone. No head or, god forbid, lacing. Flavor was drinkable, with more of it than Coors light. Dry mouthfeel and overcarbonated.
Garbage. Rather drink water. How can a company make money off this? Bad Bad Bad

A tiny step up from Natural Lite in the flavor and palate departments.  Still pretty much has the feel of fizzy water.  Has all the (lack of) complexity one would expect from an American Lite.  But there is a hint of flavor, so it beats Natural Lite.

If your looking for alcohol at about 90some calories a shot, this is your beer.
this beer has almost no taste, and what taste it has is not very good.  It’s not the worst beer ever but crappy.
Miller Lite is 10 times better than Coors Light but for the money buy Natty Light. It is better quality for a much cheaper price
A sad excuse for a beer. I pity anyone who buys this urine out of choice. The only excuse to drink this is beer pong.
Not a fan but will drink it if it’s the only option or drinking in mass quantities.

this beer may have somewhat more flavor than say bud light. which is good? i dont know, when the flavor sucks this much. i really cant stand this beer simply because of the people who drink it and think they know a thing or two because they watched a commercial.
Of the mass marketed light beers, this one actually does have a presence of some hop flavor... but lets be honest, if im drinking light beer its not because im trying to enjoy the taste.

bottle. this was a bad choice the other night but it was the best I could do for the price. this stuff smells like rotten water. in fact it doesn’t even look like beer. I would say that you could drink this stuff to get drunk fast but really you should just do a shot or two of some whiskey if that’s your goal. really not sure why the American public likes this stuff.

Swill. Absolute swill. Did I mention it was swill. I am amazed that people claim to enjoy this, and hell I am from Milwaukee. But hey, It’ll get you drunk and you can drink 10+ of them before you get full.
Better than bud light, only good for large quantity drinking and if you’re not looking for flavor and refreshment.  The fact that it has only 96 calories is nice, though.

My least favorite beer of all-time. Nothing redeeming about it. Skunky smell and an unforgiving aftertaste. For some reason everyone is loving miller lite (around college atmospheres) but i’d rather not drink than drink Miller lite
well worth the dollar a pitcher that it costs at my local. the choice of every college student I know when key-light isnt available and well worth the reputation...

On tap this beer is mildly tolerable. I *believe* you can get this on tap for $1 any day at Hemingway’s in Oakland, Pittsburgh. It is just like most macro pale lagers/premium lagers: malty, tasting of corn and sugar and not very palatable, but cheap! I can only drink this beer in jolly bar settings. Something about the context helps me ignore the aroma and taste.
12 oz. can.  Pours golden with fizzy, quickly diminishing head.  Slightly grainy, yeasty nose.  Metallic taste.  Thin, watery.  Good only for pounding in the presence of females.
Not a beer for a taste test. A beer that will be obviously bought in quantity not quality. No aroma, no attractive appearance or taste. But, your typical light stadium/concert beer.
miller lite = skunky bud light. I don’t know why this gets higher ratings. The flavor that is there, is absolutely terrible.
This beer was given as a beer back when I was a hard alcohol drinker.  It is like water with a mild beer effect.  Total garbage, but I’d drink it.
Tough it was better than i expected, nothing remarkable on this one, but that doesnt mean bad.Average American macro quality
Bottled.  Fizzy and yellow appearance, very sharp, metallic flavor.  Like drinking water, with a slight beer flavor.

Can.  Pours yellow with a generous white head.  Smells of caramel, touches of pepper, some dry malt, hints of corn.  Tastes malty with some peppery splashes and some sweetness on the finish.  Not as bad as people make it out to be.  If I’m stuck with nothing to choose from but this or Budweiser, I’d take this one as at least it doesn’t have the weird chemical aftertaste Budweiser has.

eh, really bland, taste like water. No taste. I’ll give it 4/20 due to the fact 4.2% and 96 calories.


Only good if you’re worried about being fat, and wanna get drunk.

No taste. 4/20. Drinking it now, not HORRID, but definitley not good.
this is a very bland, watered down beer.  of all the schwag beers this is one of the better ones.

Positive:

Goes down easy, perfect for a hot summer day after mowing the lawn.  A decent choice if you’re hitting the casinos in Vegas with your friends.

Negative:

VERY pale....if you did a quick glance, you might think it was water.  No aroma to speak of.

The most pale color I’ve ever seen, almost seems to have no color, white head for a moment, leaves no lacing. Smells slightly flowery with strong astringency, I just can’t find anything good about it. Astringent taste, hops present, but what kind, these seem like they have been altered. I would expect Saaz hops, these just seem terrible. Lower carbonation, extremely light body. I couldn’t finish one of these, glad I got the can from a friend, but seriously give me a Pabst anyday.  Only macro I can’t handle.

12 oz bottle. Not much to miller lite, almost clear yellow color, scent is hard to detect and the flavor is hardly noticeable.  Funny thing is that those are the things you look for in a cheap light beers, alcohol without a skunky taste and fewer calories.

What can I say - we all have our faults.  When I need a cheap, cold, draft beer this is what I drink.  It at least is light (no lies here), and low carb.  One I like to finish before it warms up to keep my tatse buds frozen.
Drink this beer or you will make the commish really mad........and you really wouldn’t want to see him mad.

Bottle, can, and draft....
Pours a yellow color with white head. Not any real aroma but has more flavor then it’s main light beer competitors. Flavor of very faint pilsner malt. Mouthfeel is very light with very high carbonation.....Great party beer and video game beer....easy to drink, especially for a hot summer pool party when you just do not care about a good tasting beer, but do not want anything offensive. This is mostly like water, but I’m glade it’s around.

(Bottle) Pours yellow. The aroma is of vegetables, mostly corn and some sugar water sweetness.  Undertones of funky rubber, paper, cheese, compost and maybe a tiny touch of hops.  Flavour is just thin and watery with some vegetables in the background. Light sweet and light dry. Full bodied according to miller, extremely light bodied according to Marsiblursi.

Bottle and Draft.  Pours to a light golden yellow with a fluffy white head.  Mild taste with little to no after taste and really no aroma.  

Let’s get serious- this beer has its place:   marathon drinking (BBQ, tailgating) or when you have a party as it appeals to the masses.
Great taste? less filling? they invented light beer but that doesn’t make it any good
I am embarassed just writing this review. Pours pale yellow golden with a white head. Corny aroma. Watery with no depth or real flavor. However, not the worst beer Ive ever had.
Can.  I was at a party tonight with a bunch of crappy beer.  I drank several so I could rate them, but this was no exception.  Not offensive, but almost indistinguishable from the rest.
I Pride myself on staying in good shape, when i feel like I’m getting too fat I’ll switch to this.  No i’m lying, I’ll never drink this again.
Nasty, nasty beer. Very little flavor to it. Not reccomended at all. Pours pale amber with little head and tastes sort of like carbonated melted ice.
fratboy party beer.  tastes dry and bubbly with corny malt and sugar.  i guess it’s okay.  no, no it’s not okay.  it’s gross.

On tap at Chilli’s. This is a yellow gold draft with a small white head. The restraunt served this way too cold so there was not much aroma, what I did detect was a bit of stale corn. The flavor was was bland with a bit of biscuit and some corn. The mouthfeel was weak and watery, the carbonation was acceptable. Overall: Not a bad beer just a very weak and bland one. Not recommended.
Can. Its just water. Easy to drink if youre a woman or a freshman. Heck, why not. Its cheap. Bud is better.
bottle.  a light beer that is mainly water.... but I do think that is the best "light" beer of the big macros.  not much flavor or aroma.

24 oz. can.  It’s hard to be serious when rating this beer.  Poured very light gold--tea-like.  The head was decent and fluffy bright white though.  Smell is horrible--corn bordering on urine.  One of the worst smelling beers available.  Taste is horrible at first--weak and uriny malt flavor--like cat pee on hay.  If I plug my nose, the palate is similar to water.  You can drink huge quantities of this, no doubt, but who would want to.  Finish is the best aspect--malt starts to turn from urine to weak, weak grains.  Bud light is much better.
Pours a yellow with a huge white head. Not much body to this, very watery. Only a little somewhat yeaty flavor to this one. Almost my lowest ranking beer.

12 oz can (calibration rating): Pours an extremely clear yellow golden with a large-bubbled, fizzy white head.  Has a dry, bland, slightly earthy, adjunct-laden  aroma.  Body starts pretty thin and fizzy with some grainy flavors and that’s about it.  Finishes with the slightest hint of bitterness.  Nothing offensive in this beer, it’s just very weak flavor-wise. Unless this becomes cheaper than water, I won’t be drinking much of it.
I drink this beer occasionally when there’s a special at the bar, but I always regret it.  There’s almost no flavor to speak of, it’s difficult to tell you’re actually drinking beer.

Poured on Black Wednesday at Sam’s Restaurant (Chicago Heights, IL) while catching up with highschool friends. I assume where I got it isn’t important though. There isn’t alot to say about this beer. Pours a pale yellowish urine color. Head is minimal and quickly dissipates. Smells of corn and alcohol. Taste is of the same, but also watery. Still, my favorite of the Big Three’s beer for hanging out with the friends from highschool, tailgating, and such.

Pours a clear, pale yellow color with no signifigant head.  Aroma of staleness, corn, and cereal.  Alert the flatfoots, they stole our precious hops and malts, and replaced them with fizzy corn water!  Not that you would have had to come to Ratebeer.com for this advice, but...  avoid.

Not worth it... so many college age people claim this as a good beer.  Boring... but has merit if you’re already drunk.

12 oz. bottle.

I really don’t understand how this got to be so popular.  I guess it is cheap, but so many people will only drink it.  Even if you are trying to not look pretentious, there are plenty of better options.
Pretty disgusting.  Even in the world of pale lagers, nothing is worse than Miller Lite.  It tastes like corn water. Vile vile vile.
I only buy this when I am in a hurry and just want a beer.  Pretty much taste like water.
Not a bad beer, but probably not a beer by traditional standards. Tastes like a beer-flavored water.

Cheap and easy to drink, with a few funny commercials. If it’s being served, drink it, but there is no good reason for me to support this beer otherwise. The creative spelling of "Lite" annoys me more every time I see it.
Probably my favorite domestic lite beer.  Decent flavor and carbonatiion.  Very refreshing an a hot summer day.  Nothing special, but relatively inexpensive.

It’s not sophisticated, doesn’t have any aroma and tastes like water.  That being said, its refreshing when cold and perfect for a baseball game.  Also, it helps wash down my spicy buffalo wings.  It’s cheap and available everywhere.  Not a masterpiece, but an old friend.
this is good beer when trapped in a room with a girlfriend who buys it for u
Bottled. Pale golden color. Dull cardboardy and lemony aroma. Very mineral water like flavor with hint of malt, hops and lemon. Fizzy and rounded.
It’s Miller Lite. Everyone knows it. Easy to drink and a step up from some of the other "cheap college beers". Worth getting drunk with.
Shared a pitcher of this w/ some of my friends, courtesy of a rather attractive Miller girl.  That was the only positive.  Tasted like yeast and metal
I went to a concert tonight and sadly this is about the best they had on tap.  The only thing I could think of is...hey at least I can rate it when I get home.  Water with alcohol...yum.
why? Pure crap beer. Did you ever drink Miller Lite in 1990 before they changed the name to Milwaukee’s Best Light?
WIth the Lite beer must come the light watered down fizzy taste. I have went on the brewery tour a couple of times and for as much as they talk it up it still tastes like water??
Watery pale yellow swill.  Low cal, low carb, low taste.  That said, it’s a tiny bit better than Bud Light!
Pours clear pale yellow.  Very faint aroma of corn.  Clean dry mouthfeel with some corny sweetness.  Finish is dry and fizzy.
TAil gate, cheap drunk, cheap in a bar, easy to drink at first, but the bottom I leave for the garbage. It’s okay.
1.2 may be a little heavy in the rating.  But by far  my favorite "lets get loaded" beer.  Not bad for tailgaiting or some type of family get together (especially in-laws)
a slight better than bud light but that is not saying much...a cheap domestic that is drinkable
12 ounce bottle. Classic  macro brew for less tha $1.00 not worth a comment.
Alright beer, i love the cans. the taste is pretty good too. really "lite".

10/21/07: On draft 
 Yellow bodied with some white lace.  Stale aroma watery taste.  Not really much to write home to Mom about.
pale, golden, clear, white foam, light body, thin feel, fizzy, ow carb low cal beer
ugh. burns the nostrils. someone left one of these in my fridge after a party. so i tasted it. yep, still awful.
Low carb low cal beer that most bars carry.    its a happy hour special beer for a reason.

Pale straw colored, no significant aroma or body. Watery, fizzy alcohol. But it is a lite beer and that is what they are about. Not bad if you MUST drink a light. A good product for it’s category. Less filling tastes weak.
just good beer, have loved it since i was stationed at fort hood texas. It taste like hevan i would bathe in this if i could.
Not a bad light beer if you are on a diet or will be drinking on a hot day and need to replenish fluid.  While it is not strong in flavor or aroma, it is very drinnkable.

had this on 12/17/1999.  One of my old favorites it should be intrusting how I feel about it now.  Aroma is a malty sweet scent.  Color is a very light clear gold.  Carbonation is good with a light head.  Taste is light, and crisp with a touch of sweetness.  Starting with a light body it goes down crisp and clean with almost a water feel.  Finish is very clean with only the slightest hint of a malt sweetness.  Overall it’s very drinkable and refreshing.  I feel it is what they wanted it to be and is one of the better cheap brews.

Drank this from a keg at a wedding.  Unfortunately the only beer available.  Pale yellow, with a non-existent head which strangely hung around the edges of my plastic cup but left no lacing.  Very faint aroma that was completely uninviting.  Tasted very much like slightly beer-flavored water that goes down easy with no aftertaste.  This didn’t actually taste bad, it just had very little flavor and this is why it didn’t get a minimum rating.  I can imagine that there is probably much worse stuff out there, this just isn’t what I’m looking for in a beer.  Cheap and good for parties, though, I suppose.
My favorite beer to drink in quantity.  Flavor is decent and it isnt very filling.  A good drinking beer.
Best American lite beer I have had to date.  Not great, but good and readily available.
i like this beer because it tastes great and it is less filling.  sometimes i just need to be at 96 calories...
better than the other beers come out of american mass producers.  i mean it could be nady or beast.  i prefer long necks to draft.  fine for a party where its a quantity over quality issue.
the commercials are better than the beer. but that doesnt mean the beer is all that bad either.
Bottle. Underrated beer. Yellowish colour, white head. Aroma is sweet, some malts and hops. Smooth and easy beer.
Bottled (thanks omhper!). Yellowish golden colour, mediumsized white head. Aroma is sweet hops, some malts and maize. Flavour is quite much the same. Clean and very flavourless.

One of the first beers I have tried, and it is still one that I can pick up anytime and not complain about its cheapness.  This beer is really watered down, so it goes down smooth and easy.

very thin mouth feel,

Looked to  give this one at least a "2" in some category, but really can’t bring myself to do it.  In fact I’d throw in some "0’s" if it was an option.

Out of all the american macro shit (bud/miller/coors), this is probably the best, BUT, it still tastes like shit. I’m fucked up right now on spaten optimator. I didn’t want to waste any more, because it’s pointless at this time, so, I dipped into my party leftovers to keep the buzz going (and sample for this rating). This really sucks. First off, I’m offended by the statement on the can that this is a "true pilsner." Smells like corn. Tastes like they don’t know what the fuck a hop is. The fizz is burning my palate. Fuck, this the first time I’ve sat down and thought about this and it’s making me sick. I’m not even going to bother rating any bud product. Commercials are really funny, though. This beer drove me to wine coolers. "Carefuly crafted"? "Finest ingredients"? Beer doesn’t get much worse than this.
Bottle at home - shared with Mette & Jacob. Clear yellow - white head. Cardboard, citrus, bitter, milkey - and very little of everything !!! - Hold kæft hvor er den ulækker !!!!

Golden color, white head. Favor has straw, cereal, light malt. Nice carbonation.
No apologies--this beer is the best of the American macros.
It seems someone hated the former rating...ahem..so here goes...you fill in what I should write...its your opinion that counts...isn’t that correct beachbum25?

The fact that they claim to be ’carefully crafted,’ using ’the finest ingredients and brewing techniques’ makes an anemic, forgettable, but cheap beer all the more offensive. And now they claim to win awards. At what festival?

It’s almost funny to me to go back and re-read some of my beer ratings from a few years ago. My beer snobery was at an all time high. I’ve grown up and out of that and now just try to enjoy beer instead of trying to be all elite about it. Anyway, this is now my trusty standby. Nice, smooth and easy to drink all while fitting right on in with the budget. Love it.
