OLD REVIEW

I had some water the other day that had more flavor than this did. It is in line w/ the other crap mass produced american beer like bud and coors lite. just not quite as bad as bud lite.

Where’s the hops?  Where’s the flavor?  On the other hand, hands down much superior to Bud Light, and quite a bit better than Coors Light, when compared to the most common of the macro light brews.  If I absolutely have no choice other than to drink a mass-produced light beer, this is the least-offensive of the bunch.  Half-way decent if it’s very , very cold and I’m very very hot and thirsty.  Clean finish is about the only positive I’ll say about it.

On tap, and served in a 23oz lager glass.  This beer poured a crystal clear golden color with a one-finger thick foamy white head that quickly disappeared.  No lace.  The aroma was made up of faint notes of grain and sweet malt.  The flavor was a bit light and watery.  Not very interesting.  The mouthfeel was light-bodied with artificial carbonation.  Miller’s ad campaign got it half right.  It was less filling, but I must have missed the great taste they talk about.
I can’t tell the difference between pale lagers, they are all the same, you can check my ratings for the other pale lagers if you want more comments on this one.

Everybody knows what to expect from the big no-taste American light beers. however, When I’m in the mood to pound some beers, I’ll always choose Miller Light. It has more flavor than Bud light and coors light. It has a very clean finish.
12 oz can. standard pale lager, with aroma, body, and taste somewhere below coors/bud but above keystone/busch.   Awful for beerpong.

12-Aug-07 (12 oz bottle: BevMo in La Jolla, CA) As low-calorie pale lagers go, Miller Lite isn’t awful, but like most others, it’s just very thin on flavor and completely lacking in the hops department.  There’s a slight honey sweetness in the attack, but that fades off the palate in the evolution for a dry and papery finish.  Body is thin and watery too, of course, but the lively carbonation helps to distract the palate somewhat.  The nose is moderately sweet with a suggestion of honeyed bread, but the obvious aroma is of straw and paper, basically, that cheap, adjuncty beer aroma.  Pale straw in color with perfect clarity and a few dozen streams of large carbonation bubbles, but the white head pours fairly small and then quickly fizzles to a wide ring.  Overall, this would be palatable, except for the unpleasant finish, but an ice-cold Miller Lite might still hit the spot on a really hot day.  But there are much better Light beers out there from craft brewers, so there’s really no reason to purchase this one in particular unless you’re dirt poor.

Big Thanks to: Little Don.  It is good to have relatives that word for the distributor.  For a Light Beer this is my favorite mass produced beer.  Out of the big three, I’m good.  I can taste this beer, and feel this beer.  It does pop me a headache in the morning, if I have 3 or 33.  But I am never bloated.
The only reason i’ve ever drank this beer is because it was given to me for free.

Pours out yellow and pale with a white head. Watched some football with this stuff simply because I didn’t feel like having a good beer. This stuff isn’t good but everynow and then I can stomach some macro brew with no problem. There is no real need to describe this beer that a thousand before me havent’ layed out already.
Full-bodied compared to water.  Great for watching baseball in very hot weather or after mowing the yard.  Otherwise, generic swill.

This is the best of beer of BMC. This is NOT the beer to drink if you are looking for something very flavorful. However, If you want something to drink on a Sunday while you watch the football games and eating some hot wings this is your brew. It won’t fill you up and it’s easy on your gut.

I’m at a beach house and a group of 9 had a funeral to attend so they left a lot of awful beers. This almost has the grassy aroma of Miller High Life but its more on the weed side with a flavor of some straw and nothing else. If I was 14, I’d love this as there is nothing to offend. I should not have drunk this after the last beer I had from Unibroue as its destroying what love that I had. Drain pour time!

always had a soft spot in my heart for miller lite. tastes like a lite beer. sound pretty obvious, well it is. you won’t get anything special, but for the price, and to throw a few (dozen) down, i could see myself slumming on this again. Some sweetness, good carbonation
Pale yellow. No friendly scents. Not something I want to have again. Lucky it was free.
This beer is made for teenagers and people who grew up drinking it as teenagers.  The only thing this beer is good for is getting drunk, which you will want to do to forget how crappy it is.

overall, much better than the alternatives it is generally surrounded with (bud light, coors light), but in general, not very good still.

golden color, slightly malty flavor, very watered down. hardly tastes like a beer.

do yourself a favor and spend an extra $1 for the 12 pack and get yourself something good.

On tap at The Alexandra, Norwich.  Really sh**ty lager.  No flavour and absolutely awful.
12 oz can. standard pale lager, with aroma, body, and taste somewhere above coors and below bud.
Can. Small head with medium duration. Color is pale yellow. Aroma and taste are mainly malt.
It really does seem like a pale lager, but my can reads: "All Natural Pilsner"! It tastes like month-old bread to me, but it was free, so I’ll continue drinking.

not really a good beer  im from wisconsin where its made ,9 out of 10 drink it here but i cant understand why its refreshing but it lacks taste big time , almost like drinking a glass of water really ,awefull corn taste if im gonna drink a miller product it will probably be 1 of there malt liquors which actually has a hint of flavor

#1000 (24 oz. can)  - Pours a crystal clear light golden color with a half finger thick white head.  Lively, tiny bubble carbonation.  Very light spotty lacing.  Aroma is grain and grassy hops.  Flavor is light grain and faint hops.  Light body.  Thin, watery palate.  Compared to most craft beer, this is garbage.  Compared to most Pale Lagers, it’s not too bad.   Miller Lite is my sentimental favorite and go to beer.  This was the beer I usually drank before I started homebrewing and then started drinking craft beer.  I’ve probably drank more ML than all the other beers I’ve drank put together.  I’m not proud of it, but that’s the way it is.  I’ve had alot of good times, and a couple bad times while drinking ML.  I still drink it on a regular basis when I go up to the local watering hole (poor tap selection).  Anyways, I like Miller Lite!

My least favorite of the light beers, much prefer a bud light or an ultra.  Light beers aren’t my style to begin with.  Very pale color . . . watery, little to no head, brisk aroma of grain.  Little to no hops, or maltiness . . . goes down very easily however in large quantities.  Beer pong is this beers selling point, but there are better beers for the price.

12 oz. bottle in a mug...thin, spongy lace evenly dissolves on a goldish-yellow, champagne bubbly body--plenty of action!...used to feeling this in the bottle or seeing it over a Silo cup...metallic malt odor--pure nostalgic rush a plus, weak character a minus...thin, spritzy attack on the sides of the tongue, the unmistakeable corn backlash at the throat....mass production rears itself here--breathing out as flavorful as swallowing in...the taste of plasticine carbonation and obtrusive malt...score a point for the taste of beer pong, regatta, three man, asshole, beer funnel, etc., that this beer has come to guiltily associate itself with... a backyard brew for away games ONLY....on reflection, too much to say about a beer that I’m overly familiar with and couldn’t be much less interested in... but this is my wife’s favorite, so I must score with a loving heart...
Bland, watery, tasteless, just awful.  I feel bad for those who exclusively drink this, I really do.
Clear/yellow.  Tasteless.  No head.  Cold.  Watery.  Good if free.  Swill.  Some people actually like this stuff.
Drinkable, thats really the only good thing to say.  So thats all I’ll say.
12oz, watery, intial skunk bite to it with a very watery. pretty gross, no hop presence and clearly a beer made mostly by adjuncts.

Keep in mind that I only rate swill when it’s free. My father in law offered this to me while visiting. Since it was the only thing cold, and the day was hot, I obliged. This used to be my every day beer before I discovered craft beer. Bottle. Pour pale straw golden with a white head. Not much aroma, but what I could pick up was sweet ceral grains. Light bodied with a thin but refreshing texture. Flavor of adjuncts (cream corn, cereal) with virtually no hop presence. Actually better than I thought it would be after this long hiatus. Good for  a cheap thirst quencher. I think this is one of the better macro adjunct pale lagers, better than bud light, coors light, etc.
This is my least favourite of the major American beers (Coors, Bud, etc.).  Very watery flavour with not much worthwhile  going on.  No body and too carbonated.  Pale colour.
This is a staple for many drinkers. Its not bad, but theres definitely not much flavor to it. Its a good beer for beginners, games, and beer drinkers on a diet. 96 Cal. per 12 oz.
the first beer i ever had was a miller lite in a can and it was hot. i didnt drink beer for like a year after that haha. totally sucks
Drinking this while playing softball yesterday. Straight from the can. No aroma and a water down taste.
Very refreshing if you want something with no taste, no color and no calories..  I can’t think of much else to say.
Bottle... the best thing about this beer is that it’s only 96 calories. That’s great. Of course, when considering the fact that water has 0 calories...

Poured from tap into pint glass, producing a clear, pale yellow body with a quickly diminishing white head.  I tried to get an aroma but could not throughout the entire sitting.  As expected, this was a very watery, fizzy, malty beer of low character.

Better aroma than taste.  Nicer in a can than the bottle.  For a light beer it does its job without tasting awful.  That is something hard to do.....foul tastes will come through more easily for light beers.

Why do people waste their time giving legitimate reviews of such a garbage beer?  This is good for drinking frequently and as quickly as possible.  Afterwards go find a girl and tell her you were drinking Grey Goose all night at the club and she’ll be all yours slugger.

Pale golden color with no head.  Very watery looking.  Smell is almost non-existant.  Taste is bland except for the mildest bitterness and a standard pale lager malt-ish flavor in the aftertastes.  Also some sort of weird chemically taste that is not good at all.  Probably my least favorite of the light beers.
A good drinkable lawnmower beer, which by the way has won the world beer cup gold 4 times, and paid for the stadium that my Brewers play in.
Yellow water, dry mouthfeel, very light traces of cereals in the flavor. A punishment on Christmas day, but what else to look for in Corpus Christi / TX?
Aroma of maize. Very pale yellow body with a creamy with head that disapeared quickly. Flavor is of maize, Metalic aftertaste. Palate is fizzy
xxx yea.. umm... garbage, this is pretty bad, its decent for a party where u dont want to spend $, but still!
Mass...Better than any bud, but weiser.  All other details are negated beside it’s better taste and aroma from bud lite.

When I fisrt got handed a bottle of it and poured it, I thought it was just reallly dirty water and someone was playing a trick on me.  Then they told me it was miller lite and I tasted it, and thought it was water, it wasn’t.  Get something else other then this.

This pours like you would expect a pale lager to with a transparent yellow color and a non-existent head. Tastes, smells and feels only vaguely different from water. If you are going to pick this up at a supermarket drop the extra few cents on something like a Yuengling which are about the same price.
not terrible, not great.  a decent cheap beer for a low cash night really.  you can do better for a low cash beer though.  i think i’d prefer busch lite over miller lite.
i can make this beer at home. step 1, drink several decent beers. step 2, bottle anything urinated out shortly thereafter!
Honestly one of the worst beers.  I cannot stand this beer, sooooo dull and blah and even worse that everyone likes the smoothness....its water!  Thats basically it
an old favorite of mine. good smell but has a hint of metal for some reason. a little sweet and watery. with a little bite. just like mgd but lite!
The best watery cheap "lite" american beer out. This is my beer of a choice when I have absolutely no money. You can usually get a 12 pack for around 10 dollars.
Typical American pale lager.  In the hierarchy of American pales, beats out Bud Light and is on par with Coors Light.  Not quite at the "level" of PBR, but hey, let’s face it, it’s all watery crap.

The appearance is very pale, hardly any color.The smell matches the appearance: very faint. Is there a hop in there?  The taste is somewhat better than the appearance and smell, it’s not great but it’s not bad either. No discernable aftertaste. Mouthfeel is similar in rating to the taste. It does feel like a beer.  Drinkability is average, probably since it seems a bit watery...
Thirteen beers later, I had a very serious case of butt pee.
Decent beer.  It quinches your thirst just like water... which is kind of funny because that is what it taste like.  I would say this is the best cheap domestic beer out in the market.
Very solid beer. I would much rather drink this then most of the "beers" being rated on this site.
This Beer tastes rank, but easy to pour down your gullet. The only time I drink this is when I cannot afford beer worth drinking.
might as well drink water with yellow food colouring in it and a splash of cat pee.
Can.  Had this on a pub crawl that the local Miller rep sponsored the cooler for the bus. I suppose this is my favorite of the American light beers.  I guess that isn’t worth much.

I have always sensed an artificial flavor in ML. Not a fan and never will be. However it pours a very nice pale yellow and tastes like water "gone bad". it does however go down nice after the artificial flavor quickly dissolves from your palate. To call this a "True Pilsner" is just a damn shame.

Aroma is slightly grainy but seems so be missing some thing found in other mass produced beers. Extremely pale golden color with a bright white head. Taste would probably be awful if there was any. Discovered taste is awful as it warmed up. Why do we need a light version of a light lager. Basicly coloered water.

As family and friends acknowledge that someone is into beer the chances of recieving a really crappy gift improves, right?  So behold the glory of a Miller Lite t-shirt and suitcase of aluminum gems!  At least is pours a beautiful pale yellow, tastes like spoiled water, and goes down smooth.  What a super Memorial Day weekend!  If it had been raining I would have held my mouth open towards the sky rather than finishing this beer.

Pours yellow and fizzy.  Aroma is of bland malt.  Taste is of water with a hint of malt and hops.  Is there a finish?  Maybe OK on a really hot day but 99.9% of the time I would prefer something else.  Congrats on the Gold Medal’s Miller Lite, you may be the best in the category but the category stinks to begin with.

On tap, pours a light golden yellow brew with a fast dissolving white head. No lacing that I can see. Aroma of corn flakes, light citrus and grassy hops. Taste is highly carbondated, light crisp and goes down like water. No aftertaste that I can detect. Just another average light beer.

[Rerate, 24oz. can, 47F]
Miller Lite is a very sparkling, clear, straw colored lager with a small off-white head that leaves some lacing on the glass.  The aroma is slightly sweet with very light malt and corn.  There is a slight medicinal note.  It is light bodied and refreshingly smooth with a crisp, dry finish.  It’s a little sudsy.  There is hardly any flavor here: just light, anonymous grain and no hops to speak of.  At least the chemical aftertaste is quick.

[First rating: 1.4] (bottle) Miller Lite is a light golden lager with a foamy white.  It is shockingly sparkling.  The aroma is very slight and of corn, citrus, perhaps some hops and butane.  It is more faint than the High Life aroma.  The palate is that of sparkling water and a dash of creaminess from the head.  Not much flavor here.  It’s a little acidic and kind of tastes like cardboard.  It is simpler than High Life.  I think maybe it’s watered-down High Life... which makes it ever-so-slightly better.

For a cheap American beer, not bad at all.  Smooth and goes down easy, which in my opinion makes up for the lack of a full flavor and its wateriness.  One beer that I hate from the can but find quite tolerable from the bottle.

Can. I drank when I was in LA. Nice refreshing beer, aroma weak and thin white head. Good to hot days. Too watery,..

Cerveja clara, levíssima, praticamente água. Sem aroma e sabor. Boa para encher a cara! :)

I feel like i need to rate this because it is my beer when im at a bar with nothing else. ya have to admit that u can drink it all night and still be fine. This is my beer when im out with my buddies that dont drink better beer
How can Miller call this "A True Pilsner?" Not even close....I will not drink this beer unless I am at a backyard BBQ, and it’s the only keg they have.
tastes like skunked monkey urine...brewed by South Africans...Mmmm...keep supporting terrorism.
Not a bad beer on a Friday night when you want to drink 12-15 beers.  It is watery and quite flavorless but definitely doesn’t taste bad.

Just finished a 12 pack of this and I was actually a bit surprised.  Compared to Bud Light and Coors Light, Miller Lite shines in every category.  Goes down smooth, very light beer, and does the job for a cheap price.  If it wasn’t for their new commercials, I would have never tried it.

Bottle. Pours a clear pale yellow color with a fast disappearing small white head. Sweet malty slightly bready corn aroma. Sweet malty corn flavor with a fizzy mouthfeel. Sweetish finish with no bitterness in the aftertaste.

Rated 2/27/06:  I have had this in every form for many years. The only reason I’m reviewing it now is because I was at a private function at a bar last weekend and my choices included this or bud-light both draught. "The lesser of two evils" I told the bar keep and keep em coming. Poured a straw yellow with a slight hint at carbonation and even less head I didn’t see any lacing clinging to my fancy plastic Cleveland Browns cup. Aroma gave off hints of cheap flat american p*ss, followed by a mouthfoul of day old fraternity keg freshness. This beer felt like stale pond water on my palate and finished not fast enough. It was $10 all you could drink from 1:00 to 6:00, I think I got half of my money’s worth. All joking aside I am not rating this beer solely on that last experience. Miller Lite is a very typical American Lite beer, and like all Lite Beers I avoid them like my in-laws. One or two can be a little refreshing on a summer day if they are extremely cold, however I prefer beer with more flavor and body.

What can I say about THE most popular beer in this area. I guess if you don’t like the taste of beer, this is the one for you. It’s lack of flavor is surpassed only by Pearl Light. At least with this one you can burp back a slight taste and you get that feeling in your mouth that you drank a beer without having to taste it. It has a slight soured smell and a slight golden color. Notice the use of the word slight?

My kids brought this swill home from college. They should have left it behind. Just awful. No flavor, aroma, nothing. I gave it a 2 for appearance because it kind of looked like beer. The most enjoyable part of this was pouring it down the drain.
had it outta a can at my compadres’ it smelled like sweet corn water. tasted pretty crappy

Can. Pale yellow. Fizzy corn taste. A weak and watery brew......The low character content page came up so I have to add more words to describe this beer.....Maybe this will do it ,as I don’t have time to muse over the sublties of this weak ass brew.

Better than PBR. I actually didn’t mind this beer. I had it on tap at the HIghlander bar in Atlanta. Very yellow color, malty, hoppy, but not in a good way. Thin palate, not creamy at all. It is as if I am drinking club soda. What the heck? The ABV is crap too.
Well, now I remember why I don’t drink this shit anymore. This beer won a World Beer Cup Medal? In what catagory...Industrial Waste?
A typical mass produced beer that has no love for the people who drink it.  Watery taste and light head.  Good for only one occasion: Partying and wishing that you had a good beer in your hand.
This is an OK light beer. I like many other light beers better though. Miller Lite has a wierd after taste. I would drink this for sure.

Mineral water with hints of pale lager and boiled corn. Seriously though, there are only reasons to drink this. The first is if you don’t like beer and wanna get drunk you might want something that doesn’t taste anything. The other is if you wanna get drunk, period. Yippie-kay-ay!

Light beer is what it is.  If I’m at a ball game, and this is one of two choices, I suppose I’ll go with the other.

Pours almost clear, slight head, golden yellow.  Slight pilsner aftertaste.  Carbonated mouthfeel.  Not too filling.
Bottle.  2006 American Light Lager of the Year! Other than that, it’s just another light beer.  pale, wet, light and refreshing.  Not much taste or ooompf.
Draft.  I guess I really don’t need to rate this; not good flavor or aroma.
Draft.  This beer has only a faint aroma of grain.  The flavor is also unimpressive and almost nonexistent.
Aromaless, and light in color. It tastes slightly grainy with no complexity. Way too carbonated with a fizzy mouthfeel.

Miller Lite is likely the best of the macro brew light lagers. There’s  not much you  can do about  making it taste better. I don’t even like drinking this with food. If I drink beer, I want to enjoy it, not watch my calorie/carbohydrate intake.

Draft - aroma had a touch of malt and some corn.  No discernable hops.  Appearance was similar to Zima.  Flavor was mostly corn with a touch of malt.  Again, next to no hops.  I just don’t see what the attraction is on this or any other BMC product.  Oh, congrats on your World Beer Cup medal.

Aroma of maize.
Very pale yellow body with a creamy with head that disapeared quickly. Flavor is of maize, Metalic aftertaste.
Palate is fizzy.
Can.I haven’t had this for a really long time.It is bad.I was never going to drink this again, but the opportunity arose and I thought I could rate the thing.I should have had something else.
This bad boy starts off tasting like carbonated water. As it’s going down you begin to taste some faint alcohol. That’s all really... maybe if you concentrate, you could taste a little beer in there.
It looks like beer, smells a little like beer and tastes like what I think pee would taste like (I’m only guessing).  This is my first beer and thankfully not my last.
Seriously...for those watching calories...drink water.  Another awful pale lager offered by an American macrobrewery.   Step away from the beer......
I gotta have my Lite beer without GHT.  If I have to go quantity for a party or get together, this is the way to go.  It’s the only Macro light beer that I’ll voluntarily drink.

Bottled. 
Very pale golden colour. Pretty steady head. Not as clean in aroma as expected, I found notes of maize and other vegetables. Flavour is pretty empty with rather soft mouthfeel and no flaws. Light bodied without bitterness.

I personally like Miller Lite as long as i drink it quickly and don’t drink the last sip.  Like almost all American Lite beers this is almost water with a metallic taste and some alcohol.  When your spoiled with good beer sometimes when you don’t have it you can really put down a beer.  But for its style being lite and the low carbs, what better can you expect?

Bottle: Clear yellow colour, with a flat head.
Aroma of grain,hay,some malt,and dry hopy ending.
Flavor is werry thin/watery, metalic mouth feeling. thin body short finish.
This was,  I will called a  "bad beer".
Worst of the mass produced american pale lagers. pours a thin white head, like soda.  severly over carbonated

Bottled.  Very pale yellow, airy head. Vague vegetable aroma. Sweetish and bland with sharp metallic mouthfeel. Despite the assaulting compost heap flavour it feels empty. Unpleasant saccharine finish. I’m so glad they decided to market this superior product in Sweden, so that I got the chance to taste it finally.
If you are going to drink tasteless overcarbonated pisswater this is the tasteless overcarbonated pisswater to drink

Nothing to offer unless you are looking for a flavorless beverage, but in that case water is cheaper.  With the exception of damage from poor handling and storage, this beer is consistent from bottle to bottle.

Another crappy "beer" driven by ads of cute hos pimping this swill. 90% of the cost is due to adverts. Faced with a choice between this and nothing, I’ll choose nothing, And the amount of land chewn up to support the measly amount of hops and malt tht goes into this "beer" is a freakin’ crime itself.

This is NOT water!!!!!!! I compared it and there is actually a slight difference in color if you look closely... :-)       Very pale golden/yellow, almost no head. Papery cardboard aroma. No flavor found.

Bottled.
Pale golden. Small and short wite head.
Cardboard nose.
Extremely thin and watery. No flavour, no bitterness.
Bottle, 355 ml. Pale yellow, medium white head. Very thin flavour, some grainy malt. Neither sweet nor bitter, just very thin, a bit metallic. Much better than expected however.

(355 ml bottle from Systembolaget) Pale yellow color, small white head. Weak malty and a bit fruity scent, also grainy and a bit cheesy oxidized. Sweet malty taste. Spritzy high co2 mouthfeel, medium bitterness. Sweet aftertaste.
Not only is this just another lager, but it also falls below foreign lagers in every category.  USA, why do you like this stuff?
They’re all the same. When you get out of college, venture out...open your palate.
Bottle: small white head, foamy.  Slightly bitter aroma, but bland.  Taste?  what taste?  very boring...like water.

bottle, can, draft all taste the same, pale fizzy yellow beer that tastes like nothing until you get grainy taste on the end. nothing surprising from the macro guys here.

however as a lawnmower beer, or an out with friends beer, she’ll do just fine.

pale yello fizzy with a head the left as quick as it appeared.  Very little hop flavor.  The corn makes itself known.  Must be chilled to near freezing to be tolerated.  Great if you are thirsty, can’t have a lot of carbs and/or calories.  Better than Bud light, select, and coors light.  Less flavor than busch or natty light, but there are better light beers out there.  Yes, unfortunately, light beer will never taste like a regular beer.
This is not a good beer. I think it got popular because of the low carb and low calorie trend. It tastes like water with some beer poured in it. Only drink this if there are no other beers available.
Post rock show binge drinking. Fizzy yellow beer with almost no head. Slightly metallic taste but otherwise it’s so watery that you hardly notice that you’re drinking it. bleh
Good only in mass consumption.  Preferably with 3 or so good beers to start off with to dull your taste buds.
If you must drink a light beer, this one is less heinous than others.  Unfortunately, there is no such thing as a satisfying light beer.
What can be said that hasn’t been said - this beer is an utter waste of water.  I guess if you’re in college or something...

Became hooked on Miller Lite while working construction 20 years ago.  Recovered. It all started when a Contractor brougt it on the job site one 99 degree day. Good thirst quenching beer . Not a bad backup beer if I’m real thirsty.
ugh....just ugh.   yellow-ish....flavorless.....just nasty.  This could be drunk only on a hot day when mowing the lawn and you don’t care about taste.
Hon smakker av ongum, soleidis er tad. Avbera ringt bryggjad bjór. òfataligt at hon hevur verdid bryggjad sídani 1975.
Bottle given to me while bowling.  Not much aroma, flavor, palate to speak of.  Better than the bud light also given to me a few days earlier.  I can’t imagine paying $6 a bottle at a sporting event.
This is my all-time least favorite beer. Describing it any further would be an utter waste of everyone’s time. 100 %crap.

Did the Miller Lite taste challenge at the Honda Center in Anaheim during a Ducks game. No aroma at all. Appearance was more golden than the other pale lager it was paired up against. I guess it looked more like beer. Flavor was a little more crisp then the other. Actually could discern a little but of hops, but there was still the usual corny adjunct flavor. I guess when paired with a shittier beer, it’s okay, but probably would not drink unless it was the only beer available.

From the Miller range I figure I’d place it in the top range.  Its really easy to drink.  Got it at a Philadelphia Wings game, finished it well before mid first quarter in the big plastic cup.  Strangely I prefer the taste out of a plastic cup instead of bottle or mug.... i have no idea why.

For the Miller family of beers this is probably one of my favorite. A lot easier of a drink than MGD or High Life. Goes down smooth but still has horrible flavor. Only recommended in 24 packs or a cold keg.
omg the people give this beer to much credit brink a busch light then you will know what a light beer should taste like all i can taste is wheat yuck anheiser bush buts this beer to shame.
This is better than bud light. St. Louis sucks. haha. But I’m still sad that Milwaukee brews some crappy beer.

Bottled, alc. 4.0% (11/2005)

Pale yellow color, white head. Aroma of corn and caramel. Very watery, touch of corn, grass and caramel. Useless "light beer". Sampled in Bangkok.

I feel obligated to review this beer for what it is. Your everday high volume party beer. Not much to look at, not much to taste, but very easy on the palate. When I an looking to put them back, this is my beer. When Im sitting by the pool, this is my beer. When  Im done working on the lawn, this is my beer. These things are just like potato chips, you can never have just one.
i dont think it matters if there is a gh in it or not.  light beer does not taste good.
If your looking for quantity, not quality.  This is your beer.  Probably the best tasting of the domestic light beers.  It did win the Gold at the 2006 World Beer Cup.
only a mild hint of what is supposed to be beer. taste of skunk, adjuncts ,and water. only for the non-beer drinkers.

pitchers after work, it’s not even really a drinkable substance otherwise, VERY light color, skunky water flavor, lingers in the mought too long for the american light lager that it is, and the hangover in the morning is wicked bad.
Was barely able to consume the beer that someone bought for me at the Farm Show in Louisville.  Not sure how people can drink this when there are so many more options available.

Can.  Typical straw color, almost no aroma, some very light corn and Clearasil.  Taste is extremely smooth, more like beer-flavored water than anything, but there’s nothing particularly offensive here.

To the user who wrote that this tastes like cat piss -- how exactly would you know that?
On a hot summer day working in the yard.  I am not ashamed to say I will put one of thesre down.  I will drink anything (except any of the other macros).
This beer really isn’t that bad.  Obviously nothing special, but 1% seems a little elitist.
Low quality macro lager that typifies the style.  Worse than other similar beers due to the nasty aftertaste.

The only good thing about it is that it looks like a decent lager in the glass. Aroma of nothing. Flavor of corn, water, and a hint of bittering hops. A bit overcarbonated, but in reality I think the carbonation masks the lack of taste here. American macros get a terrible rep amongst us enthusiasts, and rightfully so, but the reality is that for the most part they aren’t offensive-tasting and you can do much worse. This is one of those macros that I will only take if it is free.

Bottle. Pours pale yellow. Small fizzy white head.  Smells like lite beer, sort of yeasty breadish but faint. Tastes like watered down bread. Very thin, no palate to speak of. Pretty typical of a lite beer.

Ahhh, good ole Miller Lite...I finally got around to reviewing you!  The choice beer of my college days, it remains the one ’Cheap American Beer’ that I will still willingly drink when I’m sober.  Nothing spectacular, this beer will generate a nice head with an aggressive pour.  Obviously watery in flavor when comparing to about any other beer, the taste is at least pleasant, not offensive, and relatively drinkable...albeit a much better summer beer than a cold, dark, winter night beer.
Who wins the title between worst light beer - Coors or Miller?  Who cares - they are both horribly watery and have the taste of cat piss.
Pours a pale yellow.  Aroma is dull.  Middle of the road macro brew...........
Out of the major light beers, Miller Lite will give you the most true beer taste, but not by much.
thin, watery "brew" that smells bad and has little going for it other than $1.69/24 oz bottle.

My favorite "lite"  macro beer...my lips won’t even touch Bud or Coors lite beers....  This beer has always surprised me at how much body it has compared to the other lite macros.  Especially nice to have when ice cold on a on hot summer’s day.
The only reason to ever drink this is if a friend offers you one and you don’t’ want act asinine.  I’d use it in making chili.  Anything else, you’re wasting your time.

as far as american lite beers go this is the best one. i enjoy miller lite when my bank account is low and my spirits are high. the beer has flavor wich is uncommon amoung american tailgate style beers. i tast a hint of wheat and a heylike aroma is evident. this beer dusts Bud lite and there is no comparison.
The only "regular beer" i drink.  When i dont want specialty beers this is what i do.  Much better than bud or coors products.  When i wanna slam more than a few,  cant go wrong here
Pours very pale yellow, with a very quickly disappearing head. Watery, flavorless, but smooth.
Another american lager. I would wather drink Goats piss than this. Or Bud Light.
What can you say? Another American Light Lager.....thats about it. I do prefer it over Bud light and Coors though

This is the same as Bud Light.  It just tastes a little better.  It still has the watered down taste that all these High Profile pilsners have pretty much.  Great again for college students (at least it was for me).  Not much to it.

I only review this lame beer out of anger over their idiotic comercial showing them winning a medal for best American Light Lager. That is like saying that a 1986 Ford Escort won a medal comparing it to a Chevette and a Yugo. Who gives a shit which beer won this category as they all SUCK!!!!!  I only give this a 2 overall as I believe that there are worse beers out there and I need to leave room for them beneath this one.
If I had to choose a light beer to buy this would be it. Really not much flavor to speak of but they all lack flavor, just a simple light beer, no much to it.
Miller lite has a dirtier aftertaste than most beers. I’ll take bud or coors over this any day.

Drank it cold and drank it fast.  The aroma is non-existent.  The pour is clear and yellow with no a paper thin white head.  The flavor is some sort of sweet corn and hops that is overwhelmed by an overly carbonated, astringent mouthfeel.

12 oz bottle, fresh from an ice bucket. Serve very, very cold. Tastes of sweet corn. Adjuncts, adjucts and more adjucts. Goes down like water. Somewhat refreshing. I suppose there’s a time and a place for just about every beer. This would be my first choice among American macros, but that’s not saying much.
I was offered one of these at a buddy’s place recently. I should have declined!  The company should stick to making cigarettes.

This was the same as all other highly advertised BMC’s.  Aroma is grainy, flavor is bland and palate is stale. Cheap and tolerable when it’s served very cold, and there is nothing else available, but needs to be avoided if other decent, non-BMC choices,. If I I have to drink a hgihly marketed "light" beer, I’ll stick with Amstel.
almost had to get a new roommate due to the taste of this beer. Has more flavor than your  average lite beer (macro)
Typical domestic light beer but better than most.  Easy to drink all day (or night) long.
Mass produced as they come.  I will say that Miller Lite does beat out Bud Light in taste, but it’s just not that good
A decent lite beer.  Definetly better than Bud Light.  Seems like your only choices in many places are miller lite or bud light so this one is the choice.
An all day beer affair.  Not much to it, which is nice if you’re going for bulk. Doesn’t leave a bad taste in your mouth.  Preferable over bud light
Fairly smooth, not to bad ending either. Drinkable beer all day, pours a mild yellow with some white foam. One of the better light beers.
As far as mass-produced beers this is my favorite and the beer I chose when I am broke and want to pound ’em down.
This beer is great for tailgating and camping. Of all the mass-produced watery beers, I like this one the best.

Not my favorite beer but definatly good when it comes to availability and price. I enjoy the taste more so than other lite American, mass-produced beers. When it comes down to that, Bud Light, Bud, MGD, or Coors which is what most sports bars around where I am from serve, I have to go with Miller Lite.

So you are mumbling ‘This can’t be the first time he’s tasted it?”  No it is not….. I’ve had this countless times before I became an amateur ratebeerian.  First, I wanted to get some experience with about 200 ‘good’ beers and really give this brew equal footing before I BMC step on it.  So, this is neither a number padder nor a memory rate.  This beer is being sampled as I review.   It is from an 8 oz, pop lid can, how quaint.  It says ‘true pilsner’ on it. The can is dented and has dust on it but it pops with the vigor of a new canister.  Pours like any other good pale yellow beer I’ve poured in my former stooges and present steeler stein.   In a couple of places there is some carbonation rising.  Has an aroma surprisingly like many ‘quality’ brews, perhaps a little like a clean dishwater rag with hints of yeast.   Nice tingle on the tongue. No bitterness what so ever but there is still a hint of hops in there. This may be considered clean because it lacks an overwhelming taste impact.  This must be what the americans like. It’s easy to drink, bubbly and well behaved. Finish is crisp and there is absolutely no astringent linger. Rating: 1 | 1 | 1 | 1 | 2. --

Aroma: Thin, corn, and just a smidgen of hops.

Overall: The basic light beer.  Not much to speak of but there are worse on the market.

Tall boy can poured into a lager glass for a compare/contrast vs. Fish Tale Ales Poseidon’s Imperial Stout. The reason for this tasting is to prove beyond a shadow of a reasonable doubt that Miller Lite is the ultimate quaffable liquid. I think it’s very humble of them to claim to be a "True Pilsner" on the front of their can. I like to think of it more as a true, genuine Bavarian Pilsener, steeped in a long history of an honest testament to only the finest ingredients combined with the most meticulous brewing procedures to produce God’s gift to us in a tall boy can. PHASE 1: Both beers are at about 40 degrees and have been poured into their appropriate glasses. Oh, the MIller Lite is much better looking. The can is better looking even. It tells me up front that it only has 3.2g of *puke* carbs and only 96 calories in a serving. I shudder to think how many carbs Poseidon’s Stout will pack onto my man hips. I might not even fit into my Girl Scout uniform if I drink dark beer like this all the time. The pulchritudinous pour of watery urine and a soapy head adorns my lager glass in a true display of aesthetics. The lovely aroma on this True Pilsner is heavy of soap, aluminum, dirty socks, and yummy diacetyl. Miller LIte wins phase 1 hands down. PHASE 2: mmmmm. After drinking that dark beer I had to clean my palate out with some tortilla chips just so I could detect anything in this fine lager. I mean, that stout tasted like coffee and stuff. yuk. MIller Lite delivers a thin, sparse mouthfeel with flavors of corn, cardboard, and a very remarkable amount of mineral water. This is almost unfair. Poor Poseidon’s Stout isn’t even in the same ballpark of a true, flavorful beer such as this award-winning pale. PHASE 3:Both beers will now sit and warm up to cellar temp and eventually even beyond that. This is obviously a stupid idea because real, true beer is meant to be consumed in an ice cold mug and poured out of a can that has been sitting in a giant tub of ice. Actually, I wish I could get all beer even colder than that, perhaps by using dry ice. Well, after waiting, I bring myself to consume this warm pale lager. Mmm. It’s still delicious. More chemical notes are detectable now, kind of like toothpaste with baking soda. Paper and ink flavors are there. The finish would be harsh, but there it’s so weak and watery that it can’t really offend. So, what has this tasting shown me? What I already knew: Miller Lite is a real American brew that triumphs over all other lesser beers. This is further evidenced by these facts: Miller Lite sells a hell of a lot more beers than probably all of Fish Tale Ales’ stuff combined. Miller endorses a NASCAR, Miller has a great taste, and is less filling.It comes in a can. I can get it at a baseball game.  And, of course, Miller Lite is about a fifth the cost of the Poseidon. This is what a True Pilsner is all about. 


[October 20, 2010]


Vortex Bottle best before January03, 2011. I hate this crap. A lot of craft beer drinkers complain about this stuff saying that it "has no taste" or it "tastes like water". Well, I wish that were entirely factual. The real problem is that it tastes like dirty seltzer water. It is a fair assessment to say it has very little flavor, but what flavor is here is disappointing. Imagine your favorite soda water. It’s clean, bubbly, not much going on. Take that soda water and put in a few flakes of cheap cereal, a couple kernels of corn and the top off the cereal box. Voila! you have Miller Lite. Just barely enough flavor to offend. Great!

Draft - Anderson Township Bar and Grill with a burger watching Carson make his post surgery debut.  During the first half of that preseason game, watching a healthy Carson play like he did - this was one of the finest brews I’ve tasted.  Who-Dey!

Was it awe or disbelief, the complexity of this beers nose was obvious as the golden elixir swirled into my glass.  I’m still not sure if it was the faint odeur of urine, or sweaty old socks which availed itself of my nostrils first.  Fortunately my olfactory ecstasy was settled by a nostalgic whiff of stale frat-house pillows.  Mmmm . . . you know what I mean.  I was please to see the brewer had correctly identified the  "rich full-bodied beer taste" - full of decaying  wood and rotting  corn husks.  I found it to be a stroke of genius that the palate was slippery like water - that wonderful, free, life-giving beverage we drink so much of - perhaps the brewer meant to send a subliminal message of comfort and trust.  In the end all I can say was this was a succulent sewage, that was indeed cold and frosty and unfortunately quenched my thirst on the hottest day of the summer.
(Tap) Pours yellow without head. Corn and grain notes with hops being almost non-existant. Very light and watery.

From the tap, served in a restaurant mug.  Seeing the commercial description, I also have to wonder where the pilsener comes from.

Poured a clear pale golden yellow with a fizzy, foamy head that settled into a thin sudsy lacing, actually a surprising amount of laced sticking.

Big nose of cooked corn and husks, with a very light sweet graininess.

Good fizzy carbonation and a softly crisp, watery smooth light bodied mouthfeel.

Not as repulsive taste as most light beers, sweet grainy metallic malts, cooked corn and a light husky flavor, a very subtle lemony flavor towards the end and dryish sweet metallic malt finish, for a light beer, o.k. drinkability.

Had this with a polish sausage and ’krat for lunch today, not a bad, cheap lunchtime light beer, there are a lot of worst light beer choices out there.
If I have to drink a mass-marketed lite beer, this is the one I go with.  Its relatively smooth and doesn’t reveal much of a palate or an aftertaste going down

Typical american macro.  Very thin, very watery.  Not as carbonated as usually american macros.  A touch more flavor than the likes of Natty light.  But still very lacking.

Thanks Josh your a real pal :/ eeeehhh ewe. Tasting this after a couple of nice craft beer from Great Divide was not a good plan. Boy I need to go back and get another IPA after getting this crap in my mouth. Okay Okay lets be fair this is a light lager so I have very little expectations for it. But I think my rankings our generous enough for a beer I didn’t want to finish. My friend said well try this, "at least it is better than keystone light." That is true. It didn’t disgust me quite as much but I will never drink it again. If you really want a light beer Yuengling Light is the way to go.

Appearance: Pours straw yellow gold (though it is hardly even worth putting in a glass, just drink as cold as possible from the bottle).

Smell: corn and other adjunct create a typical macro aroma. very small. Straub has a corn aroma as well but it is more pleasant than Miller Light IMO.

Taste: Dry light and watery with a sweet malt and sour corn flavor that doesn’t taste at all like the beautiful hops I love in an IPA. In all fairness this is supposed to be a light larger so I shouldn’t complain about light flavors but there are certainly better (and worse). 

Mouthfeel: very dry and fizzy. Watery!

Drinkability: If you are looking for a guzzler beer for beer bong this will do like any swill. Outside of ’party beer’ there is no other need for this.

Hope this is helpful.
Cheers!

Or they can call it Hops Water. Wow, this used to be my beer, then I was enlightened by Immy. Went camping this weekend, this was the beer of choice, and I wasn’t willing to sacrafice anything from my cellar. It was like lightly hopped water. Amazing. Still better then bud.
Why can’t they just call it "Light"? Not that good of a beer. Very watery, taste isn’t too good. Pretty much as bad as Bud Light.

can and bottle. Pours like stained water with  a white head.Smells like stagnant rain water in a mud puddle.This taste is a sweet bitter grass water with an awful aftertaste of soured corn.

gross...can i say much more?  It tastes like nothing more than water.  The only reason to drink this shit is if you plan on getting wasted at a cheap price

Tap.  Aroma: Very little.  Slight grainy smell and plastic.  Appearance:  Clear pale yellow.  No head at all.  Flavor:  Cooked corn, faint grain taste.  Very, very little flavor at all.  Slight rice flavor in the finish.  No aftertaste.  Palate:  Light, watery body.  Medium carbonation.  Overall:  It’s not that this beer is bad, it’s like a beer that’s had the soul crushed out of it.  There’s a big hole left in this beer and nothing to fill it.  This beer will quench your thirst, get you drunk, and that’s about it.  Depressing.

This is the beer I drink day to day.

This beer can only be described as the beer of the kids in their mid twenties. Everyone drinks it. I don’t know why, it is waterful, flavorless, expensive, and always in 30 packs. The douchbag’s choice.

Ignore the numbers above, they dont apply to this beer.  I will say this is one of the most flavorless of the American domestics.  It is one of my favorites in that it doesnt have any ’bad’ flavors, just an extreme lack there-of.  The aftertaste reminds me of the flavor in my mouth before I took my first sip... Flavor was very light, with lemony acidity standing out first, leading to some burnt corn and dry toffee.  Almost no finish to speak of.  Light fizzy body. Honestly, I like this beer. It doesn’t compare to any of the other beers that I’m begining to get into but it’s where I started. If it’s at the bottom, it’s all uphill from here.

They aren’t kidding when they say ’lite’.  Tastes empty.  Still, cheap, easy to down a 12pk, and does the job better than the rest of the ’lite’ crowd.  Like others said, ’the go to beer’.

Probably drank about 100,000 bottles and as someone else mentioned, it is the easily accesible, when you don’t have anything better, go to beer.  Nothing special but better than most of the other macro brewed beers.

I have had this about a million times and am now just getting to rating since I had a few over the weekend (forgive me - it was either this or Coors light).  Totally typical mass-produced American pale.  Totally unassuming and without any real merit.  Ice cold, goes down pretty easy.
More iced dog piss from Miller brewing. Smells like toilet water, tastes the same. Avoid like the plague.
The goto beer, unless I have something special.  I always keep a 12pk in the fridge for company.  Its I guess legally a beer, but not special.

bottle .. urine yellow color pour , no head, no lace . i cant for the life of me smell anything , maybe a pilsner smell . flavor is skunky hop water , with hardly any hop flavor . so light i dont know its beer .

Beer has aroma similar to lion house at the Milwaukee Zoo.  This product was marketted by Phillip-Morris after banning of cigarette advertising.  Worked fro Schlitz in the 1970’s, Lite would always be rated poorly during taste test triangles.

Yeast cannot be reused, bud scars and stability issues.  Where the concept of taste came from is up to the imagination of advertise, not a product of formulation,
Good macro beer.  It is getting too expensive to keep buying.  Will rely on some very good eastern european lagers that are a better quality and better buy.

Not a bad beer, but not a great beer by any means. Good for going fishing, camping, or playing poker. 1/2 the carbs of Bud Light, and twice the taste. If you are in the mood to pound more than 6, Miller Lite is a good option.

Tasteless,wastery, overfizzy garbage.  Little aroma, insipid appearance, minimal ’clean’ flavour, with a finish so short, you wonder whether one is actually drinking beer, or water with a tablespoon of beer added. No hoppy bitterness in the finish, and no lasting complexity after swallowing.  This is ’beer’ for people who either dont know how beer tastes (and dont know any better), or dont like the way real beer tastes, if the latter, then this is really sad, as good beer should be as complex and satisfying as wine. The only way for the US breweries to stop making this tasteless drivel, is for Americans to stop buying it. SO STOP BUYING IT!!!!
It’s a clear, watery beer that can be good on a hot day.  Better than Bud Light.

Bottle, Can  -  The beer of choice by several friends.  Always get it free whenever we are together.  Not my first choice but does the job.  Pours a yellow with a hint of tan.  No head.  Just an average macro.
This is tolerable for a crappy light beer. If it’s really hot outside it’s almost refreshing....like a glass of yellow water.

Can.  Out of the can.  Super bowl leftovers.  Clear, yellow, fizzy, a little bit of head, but no retention.  Pretty much no aroma, smells like yellow, fizzy american pilsner.  Tastes cold and refreshing, but a little rough and a tad too fizzy.  I can appreciate a BMC when it’s time and place is right, but this is one of my least favorite.  I can’t pin down the flavor, but there is something that makes this one of my least favorite BMC’s and therefore one of my least favorite beers ever.  Palate is light and really fizzy, highly carbonated.  Crisp and refreshing, but that degrades quickly if you don’t pound it really quickly.  It’s one of my least favorite bmc’s.  I’d take a PBR, Bud, High life, mgd, coors light, or coors before this any day.
Tastes like water with a couple of hops thrown in for good measure. Tastes ok cold and HORRIBLE warm. Yikes. I can get good wheat beer for the same price as a 6-pack of this crap.

From a can.  This beer has a hoppy and slightly skunky aroma and pours a very clear yellow-gold color.  The flavor is sweet and only a little hoppy, a bit skunky, and quite watered down.  It has a sweet finish that lingers on the tongue.  I tolerate this beer, but I don’t know why.  Drink fast while it’s still cold, because as bad as this beer is cold, it’s especially no treat when warm.

Pours a three finger, white head that quickly fades leaving some lacing.  Insipid pale yellow color.  Very light carbonation and very light bodied.  Faint skunky nose.  Has a tinny watery flavor, faint hops in the background, good lawnmower beer if you can stand the tinny flavor. $4.99 for a 6-pack from Market Basket Concord, NH.  Needed to buy this stuff for a party, amazing how quick it goes!!
It was yellow in color with no head at all.  Does not have any flavor to speak of.  If you want a nice buzz on a hot day this is the beer to drink.

a usual in the hand of american teenagers, at least where i’m from.  it pours a small white head and is very thin and watery which is how we like it.  This is a great beer for beginners gets u drunk before u know it cause you can just keep on drinking and drinking

Barely yellow.  Beware:  May cause nausia if temperature reaches above 33 degrees.  This is the beer that the really cool yuppie with the pink Izod shows up with at a byob event.  Drink only if beer is your least favorite beverage but must drink some kind of beer.
(On tap) Pale golden with a small, white head. Very thin and watery, no malt, no bitterness. No nothing. 280306

This is a beer that I am sure many raters have had alot of in their days.  As a beer this does not rate high.  its better in a can so you don’t see what your drinking.  As a drink I like it on a hot summer day or inbetween a few good ones.  Terrible beer but it got me through college and thats worth something.
This is tough......sports stadium if need be....other than that give it away.
I’d rather drink fish aquarium water.     Why do people drink this..........
Clear yellow with waterish taste. This is really one of the worst beers I had.
This beer is not worth buying if you are a true beer fan. The color is yellowish, not golden. The taste is below good.
meh meh meh meh this is a beer and that’s about all you can say about it. another good one for gettin drunk with the boys if you want to do it quickly and painlessly and tastelessly
clear with yellow tint similar to urine.  It really has no taste.  better than some macro worse than others.

Pours out a urine type color.  Head was big and it over flowed my pint glass.  Had to mop it up with my giz rag.  Anyways the taste of a beer thats been made with corn, then filltered about 10 or 20 times thru the Sausage Haus at Miller Park.  Why do people drink this?  I really wish one day Tyranena, Founders, Three Floyd’s, and Bells would just all buy the rights to only sell their beer at all stadiums insted of this crap we call Miller beer.  (This is just the opinons of KingpinIPA and is not afliiated with any part of well crafted beer).

The only reason that i drink this beer is if i am really really drunk and have nothing else to drink, or i am in someone else’s house and this is all they have.  For the love of God, buy something better.
OK as far as light beers go, I suppose. Better than Bud Lite, but that isn’t saying very much.
One of the better american light beers.  Better than bud by far.  Low calories, and actually a decent alchoal content.
awful tastes like hell and there is hardly any alcohol in it what good does this beer do for you??
Well of all the swill out there this is the most palatable if drunk when it is very cold.  If you are broke go brew your own and enjoy the beer rather than drink this.
Ide have to say that they are right, this si better than bud lite or coors lite but whoopty do, thats still ranks it way at the bottom of the list

Pours a straw yellow with a small quickly diminishing head. Barely any aroma present. Light sweet corn taste, overly carbonated.  There are a number of better light beers than this on the market.  This beer benefits from its heavy and clever marketing. If you must go light, try something else.
Nothing much I can say here, if you haven’t had this beer before think tonic water with a   thouch of alcohol and yellow food coloring.  Good for NASCAR fans and when the in-laws visit.

Yellow tinted water.  Some bubbles.  Tastes fizzy, watery, metallic, a small amount of grassiness and hop presence.   Tolerable for when I’m at the Bears game.  Though I could be drinking something far better for $6.50 a pop!  Still better then drinking Bud light at the Cubs game.
Way overrated.  If I bathed a sweaty dirty bum in water, carbonated and bottled it, it might compare to this.
The best tasting of the macro light brews. It is my bare minimum in beer drinking. I may drink it if handed to me, but theres no way my money is going towards this.

Good thing this was free. Not much to say really. classic major american brewer. If you like frat girls then stock this garbage. I guess Ill tell the story as to why I drank this. Midweek, late day at the office. They all know I like fine beers. Well someone suggest someone go get some beer. And of course, i get to go. walk across the street to the gas station on the island.  buy a 12 pack of miller light. walking back sans no brown paper bag, some bloke in a convertable mustang pulls up asking me where port saint lucie is. Im like yo man, you missed it by 45 minutes south. dude then ask me, a guy *walking * carrying some cheap as swill, money for gas. So I pointed out that im on foot, walking with cheap ass beer, and he wants money. I was like, go make out with your mum pervert. Had I been equiped with a molitove cocktail, I would have lit that Ford POS american garbage up like Chernobyl......anyways, I had 2 of these things and woke up feeling like shat the next day. Do not drinK!
Bright yellow, Sweet, corn taste, slightly carbonated, all around mediocre.  Very little smell.

I have to give Miller Lite a better score than the other two.  I used to hate this brew because it seemed too sweet.  I realize now that beer is supposed to have flavor and my tastebuds have changed.  At least this beer attempts to have a different flavor.  If I was having a party, I would choose this over Bud or Coors.

Pours a pale yellow with a small quickly diminishing head.  Smelled of tainted water.  Lightly sweet corn taste, very lightly bitter finish, lively carbonation.  Rich?  Come on.  Full bodied?  Pffft.   Just about the only thing properly advertised is it’s calorie count.  For some reason people are duped into thinking that this is more of a beer than the other lights.  Well it’s not.  It’s not that it’s going to make you sick (maybe in the morning after 12 too many) but if there’s plenty of cheaper ways to consume alcohol that taste better and are overall more enjoyable.
If you’re dying of thirst, drink your urine, or this beer.  There’s really not much of a difference...

This was served up to me in a 32 ounce mug ($3.90) at Monterrey’s Mexican restaurant in Tucker, GA.  When it got to the table it still had a head, but that didn’t last long.  It was a medium golden color.  I couldn’t smell anything despite repeated attempts.  Maybe it was because I was in the restaurant.  Maybe there was nothing to smell. (Truth!)

There is also not much of a taste, but it did leave a bit of a sweet after taste.  It has some carbonation, so, it wasn’t totally unpleasant.
 I once sat out on Monterrey’s patio and had two of these.  Thank goodness I ate some food in-between.  Point is you can drink a lot of this.
I drink this when I go to Monterrey’s because it is the only light beer they serve in the 32 ounce mug.
This is the best out of the big companies.  If I"m stocking my fridge its with miller lite.
I’ll only drink BMC when I have to but this is ok. I suppose. You have to drink a few to feel anything though.
bottle - minimal aroma, pale yellow, fizzy beer, minimal head, minimal taste.  This lousy, club soda like beer that somehow sells quite well is more proof that most people don’t actually like beer.
Pours witha tiny head, piss yellow, no aroma at all. Taste is very sweet adjuncty and really crappy.

I cant deny that this beer has more taste or looks better than bud light, but the taste is grainy crap. This grainy crap will actually turn in to crap real fast too. If you drink more that 6 of these beware the next morning, because you will have either major craps or the worst gas of your life.
Simply digusting. There is not more I can say for this mass produced American beer.
Ack.  Grainy aroma. Very clear, straw color, with tons of bubbles.  Slight grainy flavor.  No bitterness.  I guess this is refreshing if its 150 degress out.
A pale gold beer with a moderate white head. A very slightly bitter taste. I got a sample at a Super Bowl party after I had finished my 3 bottles of Rogue.
Gross, that is all this beer deserves for a comment.  It’s not worth my time

Has an unappealing very pale yellow color, more like tinted water.   Weak aroma.  Lousy, almost non-existant taste.  Very light body.  Overall, not good.  Dare I say it... Miller... BAD CALL!  That’s right!  You heard me!  I’m taking your slogan and stating the opposite.  The delicious irony...

It looks like a beer but thats where the similarities end.  Tasteless, except for a foul aftertaste that you try to wash away with another swig but sadly it always returns. Worst of the Big Three light beers in my opinion.

As soon as I opened this bottle I was slapped in the face with a sulfur arroma similar to striking a match.  Gave that appearance a 2 only because the color looks as it should, almost like a 
port-a-poty.  No flavor, crisp, refreshing if stranded on a deserted island.
Pale lager?  Try pale dish water.  Though drinkable, you’ll have to drink a ton of this to catch a buzz.  The cute commercials can’t cover up the crap.

I guess the point of a pale light lager is to be pretty tasteless, light, refreshing, almost like bubbly water.  If so, this is a good example of the style--light, pale straw, bubbly, but so little flavor that I think I would have preferred the sparkling water...of course, this was cheaper.
These is the lowest possable rating I can give, or it would be worse. It may taste a little better than Bud Light, but the hangover is not worh it!

I think this is the best mass produced beer there is.  Pours nice and golden with a perfect head.  and the taste is as good as it gets from a mass producer.  Just like the ads Taste great Less filling
A definite college beer, not very good, but like others have said it is better than bud light, if you are going to try it my advice is to keep in the bottle so the aroma is minimal
liten up guys.  this is good diet beer.  crisp and when fresh, not too bad.

Tremendously transparent, pale golden hue, slim slab of froth that disappers assuredly, while bubble float up from below. "Looks like a beer."

Aroma: wispy corny sweetness, and little else. 

Taste: soft, then crisp, then gone. Lightness is indeed represented in full here, and any flavor that is present is absent before you notice. Doesn"t taste "bad" mind you, and there"s a brief bit of malt and grainy, enough thatI’d say it lives up to it’s advertising. (Not that says much, being better tasting than Bud Light doesn’t say I’ve sampled.

Dry, lightly citric finish, intensely carbonated, faint body. It does what it’s supposed to....

Could it actually be happening that i"m saying good things about miller lite? What’s next, I’ll join the Garth Brooks fan club? Eat all my meals at Hardee’s? Throw out my book collection and spend all my time in front of the Tee Vee?

Well, if that’s all you want from a beer, lightness, wetness, a modicum of flavor, and the usual amount of booze, here it is, enjoy.

I’ll still opt for more hops, more malt, more actual taste, and count us all lucky that such things are indeed in plentiful supply.
Its pale.  I use this again, like the other big american light beers, as a tailgate or drinking game beer only.  Has bad smell to me, drinks quickly though.  The aftertaste isn’t as bad as others.
"wow what an awful beer. Was at a buddies house and that was all that was there. So i gave it a try, 1. tasted like can, watery without much flavor ugh mistake trying this."
Samples again after a long abstention, I think it got marginally better, little aroma, mild malt flavor, not bad for 96 Calories, much better than bud light or coors light
Now this shows how low you can fall.  The only thing I can think of that is worse is Corona.  Not a real beer by today’s standards.
Bottle/Can.  Same as MGD, just another average American light beer.  Not as good as Bud Light or Michelob Light.

Pours a golden color with lots of white head.  Aroma of grains and corn with some hoppiness.  Meant for drinking and drinking a lot in one night.

Comparable to Budweiser in quality and color and only slight differences in taste... blah blah wheat blah blah rice, etc.

Typical beer for non-beer drinkers.
Nothing special, but I’ll take it over Bud Light anyday!  Pours medium golden yellow, taste is a little bitter, alittle metallic. Kind of a funny aftertaste, but brings back many a memory.

let me jump on and beat the dead horse.  Why is this called beer?  You have rotten sour water with a slight aluminum taste and then evey once in a while you remeber your first girl friend and how you drank this and you grab one, sip it, an realize... there is no going back and this should die too.
Pours a medium golden yellow.  Aromas of corn, hops, and something metallic.  Flavor is the worst of all american lagers, it has a bitter metallic aftertaste.
This is the beer that many of us owe the loss of our virginity to. Goes down pretty well and is easy on wallet.
Hey, cmon if you are drinking this then you usually know what you’re in for.  A light beer that goes down easy and gets you drunk, and is better than coors light and bud light.
does not taste great and is not less filling.  if you want to pee alot and have a bad taste in your mouth have a go
Only good for people looking to spend little amounts of money and want to get drunk. Not very good at all.

This beer is just awful. No real flavor & a nasty aftertaste. I have some friends who swear by  it...but they are good friends so I haven’t disowned them...yet. One beer I simply can not drink under any circumstances

Bottle.  Grainy pale malts explode up to the nose, but the alcohol and impurities are there too and you just know you’re going to have a headache.  Mmm, corn syrup!  Clear pale yellow golden with a scant white head.  Sweetish pale malts, leaving a slightly bready aftertaste, but really there’s not a whole lot to remark here – except for the too-strong carbonation/crispness.  Medium body.  Better than several of the macros, but still part of that nasty triumvirate. [12/11/2005, re-rate 8/3/2008: 1.0]

Update from the 24oz can.  Pale, relatively still yellow-golden with a very short white head.  Nose nose to speak of, medium body is very smooth with very, very little carbonation (well, let’s be honest, it’s flat), very low bitterness and relatively dry, no hops despite the annoying advertising.  No floral notes, no corn, no grain, about as watery and bland as an alcohol-delivery mechanism can be.  Perhaps its ultimate doom: I vastly prefer the Keystone Ice just had.  Vastly.  Wow.  [08/11/2013: 0.5]
Only when the guys buy pitchers of it when its on special.  Less filling means no taste.  Not really worth the effort to drink.
Dirty aroma with malts in flavor.  Better than most low costing beers.  Carbonated and watery.
yellow straw color.  fizzy white head.  light  carbonation.  watery.  some grains in flavor.    pretty tasteless stuff.

Drank in a blind taste test which compared Bud Lite, Coors, Light, and Miller Light.  Miller Light finished first amoung these macro pale lagers.

Best of the worst.
Has a flavor that reminds me of watered down dish soap.  I can’t bring myself to drink it under any circumstances.
It’s a pale lager and I don’t like pale lagers.  Only marginally better than Bud Light.  If it comes in a keg for a party I will reluctantly drink it.

Ok, first off, any Miller beer is never a good call. Where do I even start? Sour aroma, generic appearance, is this bitter water I’m drinking? Again, mass commercialized crap, only for the sole purpose of getting drunk.
slight grainy aroma.  pale gold color, nice white head.  flavor so inoffensive s to be non-existant.  just an easy alcohol delivery system.

My favorite of the Big 3 American light beers, which really doesn’t mean much.  Doesn’t taste bad but it doesn’t have any real redeeming qualities, other than to get drunk.  My choice for football tailgating.
Ok listen here if you are an American and are used to drinking American beer, how can you rate this beer bad?  When it comes to domestic "LITE" beer Miller lite is by far the best tasting!!!!!!!
Good for ice cold summer and for fall football.  Obviously not a beer that you drink for anything but an icy cold one or for getting drunk.  My favorite if that’s what I’m looking for though.
Again, a beer that should only be consumed for the purpose of getting drunk, or catching up to those who already are.  There is no other value to this abomination.
American classic?  No wonder American beers are getting such a bad wrap.  This one is just a well marketed, small flavored beer.
very little taste, commonly available, always on sale, very little taste of malt or hops, watery, american staple

Can, 24 oz.  Got it at a Tampa Bay Lightning hockey game.  Poured out a very light gold, with a medium sudsy white head.  Malty in the aroma.  Flavor was mainly light malt, little yeasty bread.  Palate is very watery.  Sucks I had to pay 8.00 bucks for a 24 oz. beer but that’s part of the deal of going to a game I guess.  I drank a lot of this in college, didn’t love it but it gets the job done.
another great example of what great advertising can do to sell beer.Nothing memorable here,just had to rate it.
Sigh. Another crappy, cheap, American light beer. "Great taste, less filling" goes the slogan. Compared to what?
Uggh!!!  Why am I rating this beer?  It donsn’t smell like anything I want to consume. Oh, yeah I don’t!  Not unless I want to fill room in my stomach with nothing.  Goes really well with rice cakes.
Does what it is intended to. No complex taste, not intended to have one.  Enjoy a very, very, very cold one on a hot day.
Bottle. What can you say about this? Well, cool commercials. That’s about it.
Dotn bother, just go buy some quality microbrew.  Remember, you get what you pay for.
Not the worst cheap beer ive ever had. Kinda tastes like bread. Shitty bread. Pee-pee yellow. No flavor really except for the hint of bread. So overall its watery, cheap, bread-flavored urine.
another standerd in the cheap beer market i would puor this on a person that was on fire
Another great light American Beer.  This is my wife’s favorite, but second only to Bud Light for me.  So American it should be painted by Norman Rockwell.

The quintessential American beer and all time favorite of all beers. When God made beers he broke the mold on this light clean crisp refreshing American classic. Barely edging out it’s two nearest competitors Bud Lite and Coors Lite for Beer Gold, this beer tastes great and in addition is less filling. The favorite of hard working Americans and partying college kids everywhere, Miller Lite will bring back memories of the best times of your life. Do yourself a favor and go out and get a nice frosty mug of this brew asap!
You could do worse. Tastes less like water than Coors light. Tastes less like human waste than bud light. If you don’t want real beer this is okay.
Miller lite has no taste. There’s a reason why it’s British owned and operated. Stick to the American light beers. Miller lite is right there with natty light in my opinion.

To be quite honest, my palate is not refined enough to tell one mass market light from another. They all taste like water to me . OK, they’re carbonated, so I guess they’re different than water, and there is some alcohol.
Pours a yellow color, the head is white mostly diminishing and some lacing. Aroma is a little bit like beer. Tastes metallic and sweet. pretty awefull.
Pours very pale yellow with foamy white head. Aroma is very faint and what I can smell is corn syrup. Flavor is sweetened water with a touch of metal.  Excuse me, I now have to go pour this out.

Out of the macro lights I’d have to say this is sadly the best. Still have no idea how they get away with calling it a pilsner. Malt on the nose. Taste is mostly malty, but a slight note of hop, thats why I give this an astounding rating for this style
Best of the cheapest beer out there.  Not quite great taste, but I can live with it.
not one of my flavor beer but is cheap to drink but may leave u with a bad hangover

Bottle poured a clear very pale yellow with a quickly dissapating white head. Aromas, well there really was’nt much just a faint whiff of malt and corn. Palate was very simular to water. Flavor tasted like water stirred with a sprig of barley.
I hate to say that this is the best beer that I have had that is Miller. Even though I think that Miller beer taste like piss in a bottle.
MMMMMMMMMORE TASTE THAN BUD LITE OOOPS..... LIGHT.... I WOULD RATHER HAVE A HIGH LIFE.....IT IS CHEAPER
Light urine color with fast dissipating white head. No nose.  Tastes like carbonated water.   Aftertaste is of stale garbaje.  Arguabely the worst beer ever.  Cheers!!!
Just another flavorless offering from Miller.  This seems to have less off flavors and vegetal garbage than Bud Light for what it is worth.  Skip it and go with a nice hoppy craft-brewed IPA :)
Good for mass (and quick) consumption, and that’s about it.  Not the worst American macro, but by no means the best.
The best lite beer there is for your money. The taste is smooth and goes down nicely. Solid beer.
Miller Lite has no aroma and is a pale straw like color with a rapidly diminishing white head. The body is light and the aftertaste is nonexistent.
This tastes like carbonated water.  I guess it worked well for rehydration while tailgating in a hot parking lot.  Hard to believe this is a beer.
I hate this less than most light beers.  Tastes good floating down the Salt River in Mesa, Arizona on a 115 degree day.  Higher level of diacetyl (butter) flavor than most light beer.

Another average beer from Miller only this time it’s an extremely "lite" one. It has that  trademark miller taste of a wheaty hops finish and pours a golden yellow. Just to watered down for my liking.
This is a mediocore beer at best.  It tastes best with cheap pizza and after you’ve already drank all your good beer.

Looks like absolute piss... and doesn’t taste much better either....   one of those beers you only drink in absolute desparation, and never tell your geeky beer friends about... it’s kinda like an easy fat chick...

Ehhhhh, why the hell not rate it? It goes to me total and I did drink it today while  watching some college football w/ friends at a sports bar which incidentally has a terrible selection. Closest non-macro they had was Fat Tire which was awful and expensive so why not go for the cheaper route if both stink. I used to drink this all the time growing up and thought it was OK or at least tolerable. Now that my palate is much improved, I realize this is really bad. Didn’t even taste like beer. In fact it tasted like medicine. But hey, it was cheaper than Fat Tire and is still leaps and bounds better than Bud Lite.
Not much to say here.  This is a great beer for a time when self-loathing stops just short of slitting your wrists.
Yellow, pissy like decent bready/corn/malted base. There is so much beer better than this a person can buy

I like this beer if I am at a place withan absolutely terrible selection.  Or if I’m at a place where the bar maid is too busy to tell me what else they have.  Basically it has no smell, and tastes like watered down beer.  But it is definately my favorite of the American lite beers.
Not only is it bad, but you can be alergic to it. Water down but still manages to have an unpleasant taste.

FIzzy, water/metallic taste. Hrd to swallow like Coors original. This isn’t the light version of MGD, it’s supposed to taste like Coors light to combat the lead Coors took in Light beer distribution inthe early 90’s. As a MGD and High Life fan, this is crappy. Still way better than any Coors product or Michelob ultra.

Not that great of a beer, but doesn’t give me hangovers after overindulging.  One of those beers that you wrinkle your nose up at the beginning because of the overwhelming sour, fizzy shock, then drink more to kill the taste buds off so you can drink even more.

I def do not think miller is better than bud light or even busch light. its better than Natty ice./ Its cheap you get what you pay for. watery. little to no flavor. mass consumption easy to do. headache in the morning.
Not a great beer at all, even stacked up against its other domestic large breweries.  If I will drink any major LIght beer it would be Coors Light not Miller.

This is a great lawn-mowing and camping beer.
I don’t like it that well with pizza and pasta, but it goes good with burgers and steak.
It beats Coors light hands down.
This beer enjoys itself.  I can’t type.  Why?  For the same reason this beer likes itself so darn much.  Those twins.  Get over themselves.  Hot ladies != good beer.  Me = cool.  Got it?  Beer.
popular with girls, cheap, ok taste.. bad headache next day! will buy it for my dates cuz I wont spend much and it’ll get her drunk!
Well, it has this going for it, its better than Bud Light, Natural Light, Corona Light, and Michelob Ultra.  Other than that nothing.  If you must drink light beer this won’t kill you.

Large Can- Head is screaming at me. White as a cloud. Lots of bubbles, and then in a wink........gone. Aromas are tin, followed by immediate corn, and some malt type aromas. Taste is sweet, corny, minerals. Thin, short finish. Not very good.

What is there really to say that hasn’t been. It’s a nice shiny clear bubbly yellow that’s gotta count for something.  I know I’l take some flack for this but I’ll drink it if it’s a choice among other bmc’s.
If it’s really cold or on tap at happy hour, I’ll still occasionally drink this, but I’m not happy about it. It’s drinkable but I won’t go any farther than that.
