A highly carbonated, watery pils.  There isn’t much flavor to this at all.  It’s very pale yellow with a drizzle head, no lace.  I think most people view this beer terribly (as do I), but come on, a "1" for overall?  There are FAR worse beers than this out there, and slamming a macro just to slam a macro is far from healthy.  An honest review?  Ok....  Aromas of plastic, hay and faint sweetgrass.  The flavor is much less cloying than some of its other "macro" rivals.  It does linger in the palate though, somewhat awfully.  The light mouthfeel is almost as advertised - very watery palate.  It’s almost like chewing on an old eraser -  the aftertaste.... very processed.  When I was a heavy drinker, there were times I’d drink a ton of these just so I could.  Now, things are much different.  It’s not very appealing, unless (1) there’s nothing else in the fridge, (2) it’s over 85 degrees outside, and (3) my car’s broke down.  So there.... yes, an overly produced beer.... and yes, not very pleasing.... but an honest effort at a rating, and not just "macros suck!"  Sorry for offending anyone.

16 oz plastic bottle.  Somewhere between translucent and light yellow.  A true pilsner, as it states right on the bottle.  Can’t tell if I’m smelling rice or corn.  Water and foam in the mouth.  Almost no aftertaste...or any taste.  Probably will get you drunk though.

Tastes great and is less filling!!
I got nothing left for these.  Typical American light lager, overcarbonated and low on flavor.

I think this stuff is crap.  Easily one of the worst light beers I have ever tasted.  If you dont want calories just drink everclear or something.  Way too carbonated for beer too, you can’t even chug this stuff to try to get drunk fast.

Recently at a cookout, an enthusiastic host declared “I’ll get you a beer!”. This is what I got… my first ever miller lite. Anyway, extra point for appearance. It is very clear, after all. Faint, faint aroma of grass clippings. Flavor was so barely perceptible that it was hard to describe. The absolute minimum threshold of taste. I finally settled on either swimming pool water or glossy magazine paper, MDF sawdust, and unexpectedly, green banana(!). In all seriousness, I can honestly say that my tapwater at home has more flavor than this “beer.” The palate, if anything, is less than water. To think that people actually pay money for this... unbelievable!
Although I despise the mass produced American water (I mean beer), I can actaully drink this one.  There is so little flavor, that I can imagine it being Evian.
Great brew.  Cheap, tasty, and is great for shotgunning/power hours.  Highly recommended.
This is the example of Macro Brews - mass market "beer" at it’s best (worst).  Not much taste, not much color - not much else to say.
I really hate this beer. IT’s as close to water as you can come. small head, light light color. Very corny tasting if you call that taste.

I dislike all llight beers, but this one wasn’t as bad as I expected.  Indeed, this is my favourite among the American macro-lite beers.  Very thin, weak aroma.  Has a pleasant dry taste.  Not sweet.  A hint of the funky chemically-taste, but overall, fewer objectionable flavours than some macro brews.
this is bad tasting.  Itwould be better if it had no taste at all.  But it does and its bad... just bad

12 oz bottle pours light golden with a short white head.  Aroma and flavor both of light grains and a touch of corn.  It works for throwing back a bunch on your deck, but not much there if you want taste.

My wife drinks this exclusively and I don’t understand why.  This beer is an excellent replacement for water after a long day in the sun (provided it’s very cold).  Other than that it is boring as hell.  It’s not that it tastes bad just that it doesn’t taste like much at all.  Light yellow color with a head that looks like soap suds.  I don’t know exactly what I’m smelling in it.  I just had a dogfish head 120 IPA and this beer tastes like nothing.  I can’t give it a 1 in any category because there isn’t anything bad tasting about it (I guess that’s the public appeal), there just isn’t anything particularly good about it.

The original classic light beer.  Unfortunately showing its age.  Good for drinking lots of it while camping or fishing, or if you just finished a softball tournament in 90+ degree weather.  Not much taste, but inoffensive at the same time.  Some hops taste and aroma is there, but very little.  Kind of a dry finish to it, which if it isn’t cold enough comes across as bitter.

Still,. Bud Light seems a tad more tasty to me, as do several others.  Still, I can tolerate it in a pinch, though Busch Light is cheaper and, in my opinion, as good.

Im not a big fan of any off the mass produced beer companys.  With that said saying something has more taste isnt necessarily a good thing, because Im pretty sure a glass of piss has more taste than beer, but I would pick a beer over piss any day.
Their recent TV ad campaign says ML has more taste than Bud L or Coors L problem is it tastes bad. I’ll take BL or CL over ML any day, has a weird after taste and makes me burp.

Quite possibly the worst beer I’ve ever had.  My first major introduction with this crap was at a new years party.  We had a keg of this feces to kill.  Later in the morning and after a couple of keg stands, I realized that Miller Lite tastes better coming up than going down.  Avoid at ALL costs.  I won’t drink it if it is the only ’beer’ available.  I’d rather piss in my mouth.
If i have to go for a light beer this would probably be it.  not nearly as bad as a coors light because it actually has a taste and not as watered down.

Desparate times call for desparate measures. If I’m strapped for cash or just want to drink a beer like a Coke then I’ll go for Miller Lite over any of the other craptastic domestic swill beers out there.
Corn, rice, sour hops, and malt that only a mother would love make this one a forgettable beer.  Better than Bud Light, but that’s like saying herpes is better than gonnorhea.

See rating for Bud Lite...CRAP with a capital C, R, A, P!!!  No hops, no malt, just pale yellow fizzy water with a little corn alcohol added to give the college kiddies, and bar slobs a little buzz and a lot of gas.

I actually think that within the last few years miller decided to put a lil more hops in the beer.  Did it help, not really...?
This is one of the beers that I will drink that is in the camping cooler on a hot summer’s night.  It can handle a kicked around cooler and a lil bit of sun without a huge taste difference.  Aroma:  Corn, skunk, tiny amounts of hops, more dried, twigs and wet grasses. Appearance:  Clear water with corn juice poured in at bottling time.  Flavor:  Far from offensive, far from greatness.  Palate:  The corn hop flavor is not very hard to put down; in fact it goes down ok on a hard hot night around the camp fire.  Overall:  This beer is just another lite beer with some added hops that gives a lil bit of flavor, but not enough to really make me jump out to buy some.

Pours pale yellow with little to no head, which is to say this is meant to be consumed from the bottle.  The over carbonation is intended to hide undesirable flavors and leaves me with annoying burps.  Taste of stale corn with the slightest hint of hops.  Made the mistake of letting it warm in an effort to capture the bouqet of aromas, and I was left sniffing.  No redeeming qualities.

If you suffer from taste loss grab a cold Miller Lite.  That’s their latest marketing campaign right.  This couldn’t be farther from the truth.  If you’re suffering from beer taste loss, then grab something besides this.  Should be thier slogan.  Watery waterof a beer with heavy alcohol overtones in the smell.  It’s like stale skummy water.  It goes down like H2O with a bitter aftertaste.

If I wanted a bottled water... that’s what I would have ordered. This beer brings a new meaning to the word "lite" beer. It’s so lite as a matter of fact you may as well have spent your money on a bottle of fine artisian well water. Oh... by the way... this brew is perfectly safe for children.

Completely worhtless. If you feel the need to drink a "lite beer" then perhaps you should switch to diet colas, they have more taste. People that drink this typoe of swill in mass quantities are responsible for the death of great world breweries. What frightens me is that people all over the world are starting to drink this stuff (I refuse to call it beer). Please, switch to white zinfindels or Zimas, but stop calling yourself Beer Drinkers.
where did the head go? as it disappears into yellow water, dont waste time or money on this beer.

Poured a golden yellow with what looked like a 1/2" synthetic white head.  There was some wheat, I think, in the aroma.  Beer certainly went downhill as it warmed.  Not a whole lot of flavor going on here.  Seemed to be infused with an excessive amount of carbonation.  If you must drink it, make sure it’s extra cold!

Hmmm... how to go about this...Clear golden color with a fast disappearing head.  Light vegetal aroma with a whisper of malt.  Very little flavor.  Aggressive carbonation.  Dry finish.  Somewhat drinkable for it’s style, but the carbonation is just too harsh for me.
Had this time on tap.  well carbonated, pale color, mild-little taste.  Not much to say on this, not skunky.

So, I went on the Miller tour, and I must say: On tap, fresh, and served properly at the brewery, this was an enjoyable beer.  No off-putting aromas or flavors, simply easy drinking.  Creamy white head and lots of carbonation on a golden body.  Typical pale lager, but due to freshness, I could actually drink this all day.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>
Old rating:
I finally broke down and rated this, the beer that makes Milwaukee.  This is simple: skunky aroma, malted barley flavor, refreshing yet crappy.  Sample poured from a can.  Buy something else!  If I recall, Blatz tastes better than this stuff.
Second favorite in this family, but once again I have to be low on cash and ICE COLD.  Can’t have too many because causes headache like Bud.  Pretty much like MGD, but with less flavor.
not the best but not the worst..it tastes better than it smells...like skunk urine..tastes not as bad...good to drink to get drunk!

The beer that got me into drinking beer in the first place.  However, my tastebuds have evolved to the point where I hate it.   Smells of adjunct/corn.   Pours a yellowish color with bubbly head that diminishes faster then a snowflake in hell.   Tastes of grain/hey but it has a weird taste in the finish, like lightly roasted corn.  Light bodied and very watery.  Carefully crafted???  Don’t think so.

Actually has some identifiable beer aromas of grains and malt.  In all other respects, however, this is dreck.  It’s the same color when you drink it as when you send it down the drain, if you catch my drift.  Overly carbonated to mask the rancid sour entrance and finish.  It’s pretty bad.

If I have to drink a light beer (aka out bowling, at a party), I’ll drink it ... sometimes. Other times, I’d rather have a soda. However, it’s one of only two light beers (Amstel is the other one) that I’ll even drink. Possibly the worst beverage in the word when not ice cold.

The best of the "big three" light beers. I know, not saying much...but this has SOME flavor.  Unlike other lights, actuallt taste some hops. Pretty drinkable and doesn’t leave the headache while your drinking it like the bud products.
Do I have to have a Light Beer.  Well, Please, anything but a Miller Lite.  How about a glass of water.....
Pours a nice gold. Impressive for a light beer. Best on draft, has a buttery flavor with a clean finish. Lightly hopped no malt. Best light beer around.
Palel yellow, clear, white head.  Aromas of corn and hay.  Flavored like water, ice cold to hide anything else in it that most likely would taste like skunk, or something worse.  Thin and watery.
this beer is one of my favorites to drink.  good beer to have while watching the packers or badgers play.

Pours a nice non-existent head, which soon dissipates.Ha-Ha. No malt flavor or hop characteristics. Only a slight corn taste with water mixed in. A lot more water than corn, I might add. This is one of the worst beers I have ever had.
Good beer to drink when doing house work.  Bland and no taste.  Feels like drinking carbpnated water.  Yet many people drink this crap, like it is the best beer.  How uneducated they are.
Best of breed in the BudCoorsMil "lawnmower beer" style, but still rather light in body, taste, aroma, etc.  I’d rather have a homebrewed cream ale.
Slight darker than Bud LIght and Coors Light(not that that is saying much).  It does have more flavor than those 2 as well.  Not very bad, but not good either.  Good to drunk off of.
2’s across the board.  I do drink this at the beach when it’s 100f and you don’t really care when the waves slosh in your beer can while you’re taking a leak wading in waist high water.

If you are a light beer drinker then this is worth trying.  However, if you like to taste your beer then don’t even pick this up.  Typical of a light beer.  I have noticed that Miller is running a lot of ads against Bud Light saying that Miller has more flavor...well I guess it may have a bit more flavor (considering that Bud Light has none at all), but I still don’t think it’s better. Still, if you like light beers then give it a try, otherwise leave it alone.  I do recognize the value of low calorie, low carb beer but if you drink beer to enjoy the taste then you don’t have to drink 10 of them to be satisfied so it doesn’t hurt to go with something a little less healthy that you’re just going to drink 2 of instead of 10.  If you just want to get drunk, however, then be my guest and have a few Miller Lites.

Bottle.  Sweet, a bit of corn and malt....so I thought this was a Pilsner?  Aren’t they supposed to be hoppy and a bitter?  Because in breaking from the norm Miller has decided to go with crappy and crap.

12oz bottle ice cold. I thought I would give it a try since it was one of the few light beers I had not tried. My hopes were not very high since I have only tried a few that were even drinkable. This one started out like so many bad light beers. It had only a light alcohol and malt smell almost undetectable really. And the color was also very pale. And, on top of all that a very small head. But, in spite of all that I won’t say this is a bad light beer because it has something that almost none do and that is a hops presence. Not a strong one mind you but detectable right away and more alcohol than most light beers. So much so your mouth gets a burning sensation (maybe it’s chemicals). Of course it is a light beer so its got that watered down taste and the only real malt taste you get is in the aftertaste and its faint. Certainly, not a bad shot at a decent light beer. If its a choice between this and the other major light brews, I’ll take this one.
ummm, yeah, this stuff is good to get drunk on, and doesn’t fill ya up, othe than that, it’s good for homeless people to drink it
One of the top 5 worst beers for me.  Ugly color and aroma, flavor has a nasty sharp bite thats far from pleasant
Bottle. Decent aroma.  Clear golden appearance with nice, white head.   Not the tastiest beer, yet of  all the macros, this is the best in my opinion
another mass produced light light light lager.  it doesn’t have a bad taste.  indeed, it doesn’t have any taste.
probably the best american brew that i enjoy. pretty light beer with not a bad taste, but different from a bud and a coors light. still an enjoyable beer to have after work
Sorry to say that when I started drinking beer I drank Miller & miller lite.  Very lite color and very little taste.  Nice little head that fades very fast.  little malt or hops in the taste.
light yellow, thin white carbonated head. tingles a bit in the mouth. pretty gross overall.
swill..period.  the only time i’ll buy it is at a game where i cant get anyhting else or at jose frogs, 3 bucks for a 32oz glass.  1st beer i got drunk off of so thats some points i guess
I can’t believe how high this is rated......................................

looking to prevent taste loss?  don’t drink this one.  it’s pretty bad when your competition for taste is bud light.  absolutely a waste of time, money and effort.  to simulate the experience, do a headstand after drinking some good beer and piss in your mouth.
The official brew of the Carolina Panthers.  I drink Icehouse at the games because it gets you drunker.  Miller Time will live forever.

rate it for what it is.......the best keg beer bar none.  Easy to drink, cheap .... not alot of flavor but after 9 who cares....... any you CAN drink 9 and still be waiting on that buzz to come around.  plan on pissing alot if you are trying to get drunk.

My favorite beer before I knew what beer was. Still a good stand by when nothing else is around. By far the best of the mass produced beers. As far as taste and aroma, who cares. I have to rate it semi okay being I have consumed 500 cases of the stuff.
My favorite Lite beer.  Low carbs to boot.  Drink enough of them and you get a buzz.  What more do you want?
Probably the best of the mass produced cheapies out of bud, miller, and coors.  It has a slight taste, but not much to speak of.
Well another light beer another low score.  Maybe busch light will rate higher and be better.

Had to rate this for kicks now that I have been sampling so many great beers. The only good things I can say about this beer is that the hundreds of kegs of it that I sampled in college brought some great memories! WOW, this beer really is carbonated water!

again had about 20 (12 to 8 mgd) over the past weekend at the golf tournament...the only beers available.  the lite version more astringent and somewhat metallic and down right offensive if breaks the 33 degree mark....god bless the swill!!!
One of my least favourite beers, very white, almost no head, prefer a bud light anyday

Medium golden in pour with thin white head.  Very clear.  More malt in the aroma than other lite beers.  Very thin in flavor with almost vinegary taste.  OK, now I’ve had one swallow and its time to pour the rest out.

I give it a good rating because it really is a good low cal/low carb choice.  That being said, it has no real flavor to it.  Much better than the other light choices that are available at your local watering hole.

Light skunked smell.  Pours an almost completely transparent gold, with virtually zero carbonation.  Flavor is flat, uninspiring, and boring to say the least.  Drinkable if only due to its complete lack of smell, taste, and palate.  Much more drinkable than its domestic brethren (Bud, Pabst, etc.), but that isn’t saying much.
When Bud Light’s watery taste gets too old for you, I guess Miller Lite is next in line.  Anything but Coors.
Better than Bud Light.  Better than Busch Light.  Better than Coors Light.  It’s still just thin, bad, metallic beer.  Not bad in a keg, or off tap on $5 pitcher nights.
This is better than Bud Light but not Coors Light. Well its all water anyway. Its golden and it smells like corn. No this is not a "good call" at all. Screw the refs!

Miller’s awesome -- maybe try funneling it for those that didn’t like it?

I dunno, even without funneling it goes down real smooth and stuff...
BOTTLE. BETTER THEN SOME OF THE OTHER ’LIGHT’ BEER ALTERNATIVES OR WATER. STILL IN THE CATEGORY OF MOIST AIR.

Less taste. Less filling. Not as bad as Bud light or Coor’s Light. 
Taste is very close to being seltzer.
Pours yellow piss color. Not an impressive beer, but that’s what you get when you taste the multi-million dollar beer coorperations. Very bitter.

I can’t believe I’m doing this... aroma of corn. Pours a light yellow (slightly darker than the average Jay’s potato chip). Bright white head, minimal lace. Taste of ginger ale... without the ginger... more like mineral water with... corn.  Cost-effective. Gives me gas



Re-rate, March 31, 2005 I am forced to re-rate as I just review Bud Light and it ended up with a higher score. Side by side, Miller Lite is far less offensive on the nose, has a richer mouthfeel, and is actually a hair deeper in color. It also doesn’t make me gag.

Mein Got, vas zat ein leedle flavor I be tastink into mein mouth. Zis bier a teaser it iz cause I had to trink anuzzer to get any bier flavor on top of mein buds taste. I don’t be believink ze alcohol iz at ein 4.5% houseever.
The first time I had miller lite I woke up with a ponding headach.  I rarely drink it but when id do > HEADACH>.  When miller bust on bud I can’t stand it becuase bud light does have more taste.
Yellow color pale; limpid and enough bubbly. Scent nearly absent. Extremely watery and lean. It seems nearly mineral water for the lack aroma and taste.
Great for low crabs and for mass consumption!  That’s about it.  Just a decent party beer and I’ll drink it if I have no choice.

No matter how much carefull consideration, deep thought and personal introspection I devote to the topic, I just can’t decide where I come down on this "Great Taste/Less Filling" debate, which seems to be dividing this once great and formerly United States  of ours, threatening to further rend the fabric of our society, perhaps beyond the point where it could ever be made whole once again...
This should only be bought when it’s $1 for a 23 oz draft, period. It has more beer flavor than bud light

Average.  Unoffensive is probably the best term to use.  Definitely not a pilsener, but you knew that already.  Whiff of corn aroma.  Fizzy but no head retention.  Probably is more flavorful that bud or coors light, but thats not really saying much.  The finest hops?  Yeah right, let me know if anyone finds them in here.

Can pound these beers all night without getting drunk enough to have a serious hangover the next day. Why? Because it is glorified water. I guess if I had to drink macro light swill this would be my choice.

meh, nothing exciting about this.  there are commercials fighting over which is better Bud or Miller.  Besides being kind of pointless, maybe someone should let them in on the fact that they taste the same.  watered down taste is maybe a little stronger in miller.  good to drink if you’re broke and wanna get drunk, though it might take you about 20 or so beers compared to 10 of anything else.

Well, I finally tried this beer.  It’s mediocre at best.  Tastes of straw and a little wheat.  Not much to it.  If  you’re looking for a light pale lager, go for Amstel Light or at least Southpaw Light.
Well on the positive side its better than Coors light.  Watery slightly sweet and not much else to speak of.  But not to bad for a light beer.
I would probably like this if i could tell i was drinking beer.  Tastes watered down.

this beer is definitely nothing special and not one I would pay money for.. Had it here from a family get together and decided to rate it.. little to no flavor.. Like drinking carbonated water.. Will do if nothing else is available.

It scares me that I’ve not rated this POS beer to this point as many times as my sister has brought this over to my house!  Anyway!  Medium gold color, lasting white head:    grainy malt & corn DMS aroma w/ green apple. Well balanced, very light grainy malt flavor, and not much else.  Thin, watery, highly carbonated.  Very few redeeming qualities with this beer. Not really any flavor, aroma, or mouthfeel.  No wonder I don’t buy it.  But Oh yes!  I can get this in bottles, cans, & on tap....Almost anywhere!!!!!  Beermail me if you’re interested in a trade!!!!!

Many people just drink this beer because of the tv ads. That is my belief. Over comercialism may or may not of hamppered the the ratings on this beer. But good for tailgating and playing cards with the family.

I can’t say too many things about Miller because of its positive impact on the local Milwaukee area.  I can say that this beer goes down easy and is refreshing when used appropriately.  Read the other reviews if you want some dirt.
I feel is does have more flavor then the other BMC lights, it’s still nasty.  Why do people drink the carbonated corn juice?

Of course this beer has no taste.  Its not supposed to, cuz that’s the way millions like it.  But its much better than the alternatives, ie Bud Light, Coors light.
Bottoms up
No good, not in any form. Draft, bottole. or can. Watered down. No flavor, no smell.
Not the worst beer in the world - fine for tailgate parties or other such events if you’re too broke to buy anything else.  Certainly better than Coors and Natural Lights, but that isn’t high praise.

Nonexistent aroma, palate, head... taste a bit hard to describe although overly familiar to most buds.  Extremely bitter but offset to a minor degree by effervescence of carbonation.  Miller Lite is probably the best low carb beer out there, which isn’t saying much, but if I’m watching my Atkins diet I’d either go with Miller Lite or not bother with beer at all.  Michelob Ultra and (gasp) Aspen Edge give new meaning to the term "small beer".
well, another christmas party, and this is what there was . No real taste, but, want to give a good inpression to the clients.
Typical garbage american lager, no  taste, bad odor, bad headaches afterwards. The kind of beer you only drink when nothing else is around. Avoid the can.
Is this beer or piss, i would rather malt liquer..... well maybe not but magnum is atleast cheap and 6% but both taste like piss
tap - bottle, its all the same.  a watered down version of what once was beer.

Light Yellow.  Putrid, sickening aroma of algae, mop water, green plants and pale malts.  Torturous, unrelenting flavor.  I could barely choke down this stuff.  I’ve now tried and rated Bud Light, Coors Light and this stuff, and this is by far the worst.  I’d rather drink ocean water.

Light, watery. Nearly undrinkable unless you plan on doing it fast, or starting on this one when you are already drunk. Has a really sweet taste unlike most lagers. This one always feels like carbonated water with an artificial beer flavor added to me. Would be my last choice amongst this, bud, or coors light. This hardly a step up from cheap malt liquor.
Clear light yellow color, short white head. Aroma is quite sweet, some hops and grain. Tastes like a normal lager, bit more sweet and bit more watery. It lacks body, but it’s easily drinkable.
Sweetish, hoppy aroma. Clear, yellow aroma with a white, thin head. Taste is sweet, grainy some hops, some malt. No balance. However, it’s not really bad. It is drinkable.

Bottled, Pasteurised. Pale yellow with highly carbonated head. In a trawl round the ’lite’ (sic) beers from the USA, this was marginally better than the Coors. Smelt like stale wee, grainy thin rice flavour with little going for it. Does nothing for my USA average, which is close to being the lowest of all countries for me.
revisited this after a 10 year absence,  for the price and expectations (minimal) not as bad as I thought (for a light beer)
It’s not that it tastes bad neccesarily.  It’s that it lack taste period.  It could be worse though - its called Bud Light!
I tried to scroll up to give zeros and couldn’t.  Having this at a Mets game was the worst beer experience of my life.  They might as well of called it water.
I am not a fan of this beer. I prefer bud light to miller light, however in a perfect world I would not drink either.

I have to admit Miller LIte is my favorite Light beer.  When I mow a yard it satisfies my thirst.  If I’m going to be in the situtation where I’m going to drink a lot of beer in an evening I’ll choose this one. Much much better than Bud Light if that means anything.

First, let’s rate this like a good beer:  Soapy and rice smells with a standard lite beer look (actually hard to replicate on the massive quantities they produce).  Lite yeast and malt flavors with a grassy grain like taste.  Basically if you use the standards of good beer, this blows (as everyone knows).  The flavor and aroma are enough to turn any connoisseur off.  Never the less, I like Miller lite.  Not for it’s fine qualities mind you, but for the simple fact that it’s one of the few crap lite beers I can drink, and have been drinking, for a long time.  Also, when served ice cold, it’s a solid thirst quencher while performing heavy manual labor (not going to drink an imperial stout while digging a ditch).  For this latter part, I’d give the beer a 4.5 for being almost the king of crap.
An emarrasment to the Miller family. I am pleading with this country to stop creating a demand for low cal/carb beer. That is where the rep comes from (in domestics).
Terrible at best, but seems to surpass other mass-produced pale lagers.  If pressed, I would take this over budlight, coorslight, buschlight, and other light beers.
Taste (or lack thereof) is just like all the other light macros.  This one’s not even good to get sloshed on...gives me ridiculous headaches!

Bottle, can, draught.  This is a light colored macro that sometimes tastes OK to me (ok for hanging out at a ball game or something).  Sometimes it has a funky harsh quality to it.  Must be bad corn that week or something.  Nice and carbonated...
it gave me a better buss than reg miller but after a wile it got old to so i dont touch this crap anymore

The fizzy head started out so nice, then fizzled out into nothing.  A faint yeasty aroma, a little metallic. 

The slightest yeast flavor, barely perceptible yeast finish. Surprise: Metallic taste got worse as it warmed up. If I’m drinking Miller Lite, I usually don’t let it sit long enough to get warm.

At least the color is pretty.

I gave it  a “3” overall because, though it’s not good, it’s not bad either.  Lowest scores should go to something that is deeply flawed.  This isn’t. It’s more like a politician—bland, inoffensive, trying to step on as few toes as possible.
If I have to drink a lite beer, I always go with Miller.  Easily the best tasting of the major lites.  Can’t really tell it’s a lite if you have it on tap and ice cold.

Usually when at the bars or events, this is what I will choose if other better choices are not available.  Much better than Coors or Budweiser, but just consider the class of both of these comparisons.  Below mediocrity.
Another beer with water taste, I don’t know what was the deal with it. Clear but tasteless. Only good for a gameshow.

Sniffing it blindfold, I would have no idea that it was beer--not much there and what is there is not particularly beer-like.  A hint of malt in front, but the flavor really just disappears after that.  This sample did not have the particular stomach acid finish I associate with Miller Lite.  There was very little finish at all, actually.  There is much better crap beer out there.
Slightly worse than Bud Light but it is drinkable.  It is definately not the President of Beers.
almost water in a bottle, but still slightly drinkable.  sad to say ive had more of this than anything else.  its pretty bad; however, i prefer it over bud lite

A better low carb beer than the low carb beers.  Having the slightest bit of taste gives this beer an edge over Bud Light and Coors Light, which lack taste entirely.  Sadly, while this is a light beer it still has a better flavor than Anheuser World Select.  If you’re counting carbs but still want a modicum of taste, please indulge in Miller Lite, which has half the carbs of Bud Light and is far less EVIL than any Anheuser-Busch product.

I’ve heard a lot of people compare this to deer urine. Soooo, i did the taste test for myself and actually i prefer the deer urine. This beer has an after taste of unwashed mushrooms and the head is as thin as childrens blow bubbles.

Re-rate. Okay, so I was far to harsh previously. I mean, this is triple hops brewed and all. Actually, very clean and easy to drink. Not much going on, some corn, some crisp hop notes (rather than acetylaldehyde as in Bud), inoffensive. Meh.
It’s like Miller, but it’s worse. I can drink it if it’s really cold or if I’m being social, but I’d rather refrain from alcohol entirely than drink Miller Lite.

Not much to brag about, but I tend to pick this over the other widely available domestic light beers when out having a few.  Faint, flavors and dry finish.  Many better choices in the light beer group.
Another disgusting American megabrew.  Coors Light is better because it tastes slightly less like deer urine (whatever that tastes like, it’s just a metaphor)
watered down and weak, this is how you could describe this beer, oh well, i don’t care for it
Eh. Harmless. Not bad if you’re watching the game or hanging around. Not as bad as people make it out to be in my opinion. A-ypical American swill light beer, but not bad.
Watered down and practically tasteless.  Drink real beer instead.  This isn’t a pils... it’s scented water.
I drink this for the nostalga sake of the old commercials.  "Taste great, Less filling."

Had a can of this left over from my tennis league party, so I drank it after working in the yard yesterday. While not a great beer, it at least had some flavor, and was not near as watery tasting as low carb and light beers I’ve had before. If I had to swill with a light beer, I wouldn’t turn my nose up at this one at a BBQ.

Bottle:  Aroma is malty and a little skunky.    Pours a pale transparent yellow with a white head that actually has some retention, but not a whole lot.  Initial sweet taste with very little finish.  What finish there is a ever so slightly bitter.  Slightly skunky tasting, but just a tad.  Very dry.  More flavor than Bud Light but that doesn’t mean a whole lot nor does that make it any better.

If you reeally want to lose weight, drink water.  I’d never had the pleasure of drinking the American version of this "Lager".  While visiting my Uncle in Chicago, he handed me one of these and welcomed me to his home.  It would have been rude to pour it down the drain, so I endured.  Metallic, fake and utterly ridiculous.

Of all light beers, this one does not kill my stomach.  It’s probably my fave of light beers since it does not taste like water (Coors light is like Evian).  Hot day beer to drink for the sake of drinking.
This so called beer epitimoses the all American tradition of producing shallow and meaningless drivle. It is hard to differentiate between a spillage of Miller Lite and a puddle of cats piss.
Watery macro swill that is worse than coors light but better than bud light.  Little flavor.  Only good thing about this beer is its easy to drink alot of it so it’ll eventually getcha drunk.
Sickly pale color,aroma was almost non existant. Watery swill that left me wanting a tongue scraper and wishing I had grabbed a soda instead.
I’ve had worse. A BIT of flavor, but basically tasteless & watery. Good for watching football, etc...ice cold, preferably. Better than most lights, however.
The only "macro swill" I’ve ever finished.  Certainly better than similar offerings from Bud and Coors.
Pretty much flavorless, but if I HAD to pick a macro lite, I would pick this over others.

Can. You know what it looks like. You know what it smells like. And if you are on this site, you probably know what it tastes like. In case you don’t know the answer to the above questions, it is all the same answer: shite.

Draught.  Pretty bad beer.  Flavorless, aroma of 
water.  Slightly better than bud lite.

Ok, lets be honest, it’s not a 1 or 2 out of 20...so I gave it a 5 overall. One thing I’ll say for it, it beats bud and coors light. Strong following here also, these miller people are like a cult. I’m not sure it’s worth $8.50 at the ballpark but hey, we gotta have something to drink.
For a light beer, it has a smoother taste, flow, and aroma than many other domestics in America.
Golden color, light weak aroma, watery taste, light body, light watery finish. Water.
Better than most light beers, but still watered down and it doesn’t taste all too great.  If I had to choose a light beer to drink just to get drunk at a bar etc this would probably be it.

Definately the best (god I hate to use that word to describe this beer) of the "Big 3"...yellow and bubbly...tastes like ambrosia when you are on the lake and you have six of those beautiful shiny blue cans...

Typical Miller swill.  No taste, horrid 
port-a-john smell.  If you must buy Millers, get Highlife or Beast Ice.
Very bland beer. No aftertaste. Light, crips. Good for a hot summer day and goes down like water.

What is better then a beer brewed with rice/corn? A beer that is brewed with less rice/corn! Good cheap beer to get someone drunk.......then again rubbing alcohol and 7-up does the trick too. Sad that this is actually a "popular" beer in America.

From can.  Pours pale yellow with very little carbonation.  Head dissipates almost immediately.  Aroma is cheap beer (maybe some corn)(.  Flavor is same.  Not as bland as some macro swill, but really no hop flavor despite the claim on the label.  Does pacxk a decent alcohol kick (4.5%) for a light macro though.
An alright tasting beer, but gets boring quick.  If your just drinking these its okay, but it really has no taste whatsoever.
Its flat,boring it’s miller lite!  Its yellow and nothing is really there.  Tastes like the can it came in.  $1 for a 32 oz can, i think I want my money back.

Flat, with no head and little carbonation.  If there was any less color it would be clear.  The flavor reminds me of corn.  There is a lack of body, bitterness, and flavor for an overall balance of nothing.

Hmmmm...the only time I’ve purposely bought this beer was because the keg was alittle more expensive but alot better tasting than keystone.  This pours with quite abit of carbonation and isnt bad tasting but then again it isnt very tasting at all.  Not much to dicuss here.  I’ll give it a few points because its been a good beirut partner.

So, yeah... I guess it’s better than some I’ve had because it didn’t taste like skunk piss, but that’s about all it’s got going for it.  There’s no head, no aroma, no flavor.  It has a nice golden color to it; I’ll give it a mercy point.

Just another crappy lite beer. bland, boring, and sad. With countless good beers on the market why drink this? Maybe if you live in a REALLY small town. Like the ones with one house, one gastation and a bar. Where this is the ONLY beer you can get. You might be forgiven..........maybe.
Yellow pour, medium white head and some lacing. Slight alcohol aroma with some corn and faint hops. Light malts and hops in the flavor. Very bland. No palate really.

Let’s face it....we’ve all drank it, and probably in large quantities.  I’m not proud of it, but neither am I very embarrassed.  Come football games on the party bus to Tallahassee I’ll have some more.  I can justify it because I know what I’m not getting right from the get go----a good beer.  I just don’t mind it as much as I do Coke and the like.  Let’s see....minimal aroma, stale malt at best; reasonably golden yellow;  carbonated weak malt-hop taste that fades just before you can taste it.  Gaze upon this swill and behold the power of marketing media....ya just gotta love it.
A classic!  honestly a classic.  This was my daily beer for a long time in my life.  What else can be said for miller lite?

This beer makes me sick to my stomach.  I’m only reviewing it because I’m bored and so I can get more ratings.  If you actually came to this site to see what other people think of this beer, you may be retarded.  If, when asked what your favorite beer is, you ever distinguished between Miller, Bud, and Coors, as in "well I’ll usually drink anything, but I like Miller the best," then you are white trash.  I’m sorry.

Pours a very urinish yellow color, with lots of carbonation and a very active and large head.  Aroma is very sweet corn and maybe even a little rice!  Imagine that...  Flavor is weak, sweet, and cheap.  Almost no flavor at all, just some sweetness and some wateryness, and a very slight grassy sensation happening far to late to save this "beer".
I think Miller could have done better with a lite macro. Aroma is of Metal! along with rotting hay..... the flavor is undescribable

Have you seen the miller lite in the plastic bottle?  It’s like they made a sport bottle.  "Miller Light....Sport!  For the active drinker"(picture a woman jogging around a track with one of these in hand).  But honestly it’s one of the better cheap beers out there.  One of my favorites for playing beruit.

pretty bland but seems to have a crisper taste than bud light.
of course when you can buy a beer in a 30 pack it is pretty obvious that yo uare after quantity and not quality
A light beer with taste. Does that make it good? Not if that taste is bad...
Watery, over carbonated, unclean, metallic, grassy flavored crap that will engage the gag reflex if drunk too quickly, or at a temperature above 33 deg F.(yes, even Mich Ultra is better)
This is for the lifetime career swill drinkers who instead of cutting back find something even more repulsive...
Always tastes of metal and grass for some reason. Generally Miller Lite gives me a headache after drinking it.
Of the big 3 light american macro beers this is my favorite. That being said there isn’t much here. More bitterness than coors or bud, but leaves a lot to be desired in every way.
Bitter, unpleasant watery flavor.  Tons of carbonation supplies the only flavor in this beer.  No hops or malt character at all, metallic taste even from the bottle.

I’m giving this beer a 5 for very personal reasons.  Before I was turned on to craft beers, Miller lite was my "get your drunk on" beer.  Sure, you have to drink it a degree or two above freezing to avoid it’s real taste.  Sure, without the added "beer smell", you would think you’re drinking water.  Still, when you’re looking for something really light, not looking to fall asleep after several, and don’t care that the craft beer community thinks you’re an idiot for drinking this one......it’s a perfect choice.

Can, snifter.  Small, fizzy white head is quickly diminishing.  Body is a light yellow with visible carbonation.  Straw malt (L); grassy hops (L); honey, dust, vegetable aromas.  Lightly sweet, lightly acidic flavor becomes a lightly bitter, lightly acidic finish.  Light body, watery texture, lively carbonation.  The bottom line is: boring and flavorless...good for target practice.
For a low carb, Adkin friendly beer, this is about as good as it gets....Micky Ultra.. blek...but then this is light beer, 1/3 less filling and 2/3's less taste

Bottle.  Sour malt aroma.  Pale yellow color with decent head if you pour fast enough.  Light sour malt flavor.  Light body.  Probably the best light macro for what it’s worth and with the lowest carb count.
Light straw color with a wispy white head. Neutral to nonexistent nose. Sweet, yet bland flavors of grain. Right up there in the light category.
never liked it unless i added a lot of salt,,this is the beer that i realized what the term skunk piss meant!!
I dont really care too much for pilsner beers.  And this is not one of the better ones either.  pale  with whtire head and not a lot of flavor here

I remember all the great TV  commercials where drunk people in bars would get into hostile yelling fights over whether this beer tasted great or was less filling. Imagine the concept: selling your product based upon the possibility of it inducing drunken violence in a bar. Maybe they could extend it to drunken domestic abuse, or possibly fatal car accidents. I guess my point is that they built their marketing empire out of violence and that makes me ashamed to live in a land where that’s all it takes to make this one of the mega-best-sellers in every town. Buy lots of this and drink it all the time, you automaton.
A friend left one of these in my fridge, I drank it, thats about it.  I would never pay for this beer

I’ll make this quick. This and Coor’s lite are the beers that I order my girl friends when we’re out drinking.
I’ll give it one plus, it’s easy to drink - any 150lb dude could hammer 12 of these things before 10.
Let’s settle the arguement.  Less filling, less taste, less body, less character, less ... need we go on?

stinks less than the non lite versions.. the watered down flavor actually improves when ice cold and nearly tasteless.. this is a fairly tastless beer and I’m glad there are no longer any more in my fridge.

I don’t know how these other guys try beer, but when I’m on the beach catchin some fish..I grab an ice cold Miller light out of the cooler and it tastes great. Don’t worry Miller Brewing...Show them your sales numbers. If all Americans drank beer that tasted like Campbells soup, we would all live in cottages, smoke pipes and cobble shoes!!

Pours with almost no head to speak of. Had to rate this cause its my sis’s and bro in laws fave. Go figure. Some scent just don’t know of what maybe corn mash and some hops. Tastes like fizzy water with a hint of beer flavour. The Mouthfeel is  again watery and fizzy. I am done. If there was a choice I would prefer its brother Miller High Life for more flavour and for less money. Adios!

I was given one of these by my neighbor because they found out I recently turned 21.  Against my will that is.  I turned around and then there was a Miller Lite in front of me, so I had to oblige.  Very tastless, no head, the True Pilsner on the label made me laugh though.
A classic American beer, goes down great when ice cold and serves its purpose when you looking to get loaded.
An inoffensive beer.  Little flavor but as all mass produced huge volume beers... drink them cold at a party if that’s all there is.

Another piss yellow macro. Head is decent sized, but it fades fast. Somewhat hoppy in the nose, actually. Slight cardboard corn taste. One of the reasons why I like the Miller "lite" beers... light in ass flavor.

Ugh, oh god.  Terrible.  One of the most watery and grassy beers I’ve had.  I ordered it because it was a dollar draft--I consider the 60 cents worth of it that I dumped to be no skin off my back.  People could only get drunk on this if their mouths were already numbed with spicy food, and it is a hot summer day with no water in sight.

Draught at the Pig n Whistle, Hollywood, Los Angeles. My first light beer of the holiday and almost unbelievable. I’m not one to criticise beers unreasonably, and let me say that I’m firmly in the ’any beer is a good beer’ camp. This was not unpleasnt, it was just totally lacking in taste. I took a big swig, and did receive some required refreshment, but the flavour evaporated within a second, and by the time I swallowed, there was no flavour, just a watery mouthful. All right for about a second, then gone. Looks pale, no aroma or head.

It’s Miller Lite, what else is there to say...stereotypical old-man beer.  I’m trying to change the stereotype before I become that old man. It’s fine if there’s nothing else to drink, better than Bud any day.

Probably one of the best tasting commercial crap beers out there, compared to bud and coors lite’s its amazing...it actually does have a flavour.  It will do in a pinch if you dont have anything else.
Not very good, there are other light beers that are much better (Yuengling, for example)
My favorite American light beer. Lots of flavor. Much better when served ice cold.
My "get ’er done" beer of choice.  If that makes sense.  Must be cold as all get out and out of the can/bottle.

I dont ever approve a macrobrew being consumed, but of the light beers this one of the better ones.  
Warning!!  Drink Cold or you might taste this beer!!!
Tasting this beer is bad for you.

Only good for hot days, served ice cold.

Probably the forerunner for "get the job done" college/working man beers. Bud Light? Not really. Coors Light? Ever heard of water? So Miller it is, for all us carb conscious calorie counting health nuts. Because beer should be good for you and your figure. At least that’s what the marketing types push. A true pilsner. Choicest hops. No, just a watery can of metallic, pale piss that happens to make the grade over most of the other crappy offerings from the big 3 and their dreadful imitators. I’m sorry Bud, but Miller’s the king of sh*t beer.
typical light beer, just adding my rating because i’ve had it before......f*ck
Same old story...simple domestic brew..only good on a 100 degree day ice cold...Go Milwaukee.
It’s better then bud. I don’t know if it’s the bottles, or the stores I buy it at, but the "taste" of this beer varies from time to time.
Not the worst beer I ever drunk, but sure is bad just the same.  I suggest using this beer for cooking only.  O.K. you can clean urinals with it too.
The best light out of the big 3 (miller, coors, bud), but this beer is watered down and has no substance to it, just like many of it's drinkers!

Bottled.  Preface: not that this beer has any substantial redeemiong qualities, but it lacks the flaws that make so many others of its ilk undrinkable.  The pour is uneventful.  The aroma is mild (bready), yet not unpleasant.  This looks like a run of the mill light lager.  The (corn)flavor is thin (as expected), but with no harshness or metallic bite.  Short, calm finish.  Not much here to like.  Not much here not to like.  Sure beats the rice funk called Bud Light.

On tap.  Clear light colden yellow with no head (a function of the mug being completely filled).  I can imagine that there are beers that look worse than this one, but I haven't seen one yet.  Honestly it still doesn't look horrible.  Faint aroma of light bread, cereal, cardboard, an odd sweetness - not quite honey, and a hint of pepper.  Light watery body with a moderate to lively amount of carbonation.  Slightly refreshing.  Weak flavor of light bread, honey with adjunct related sweetness and a hint of pepper. Not as bad as I expected, but then again I won't be drinking this again unless it is free.  I still have a hard time giving this one a low score, since nonexistant flavor and aroma is still preferable to BAD flavor and aroma.
For a lite beer it does not really sacrafice flavor and aroma, compared to most macro American Light beers, nice corn smell and taste. smooth palate and sweet aftertaste.
Out of the big three, thsi is my favorite.  It wasn't at first because the corn taste really bugged me, but it has grown to be a favorite un-costly selection.
Color is typical of all mass produced American beer.  Gold.  Flavor is a little on the sweet side.  I can't drink more than one.  Not bad if it's all you've got.
I used to drink this all the time.  I don't know why but I preferred it over coors light and bud light.
Ahh, yes I did drink this.  Was it hideous, No.  Did it taste like anything, No.
Out of the three light beer kings (coors, bud, miller), this one is the worst in my opinion. Its not that it tastes bad, it just doesnt really taste like anything.
I used to like think this one was OK.  Then, it just got bad.  Very bad taste with very bad aftertaste.
Dont like the idea of making fun of budweiser which is the better beer. But i will drink it if it is there
I prefer this to Coors light or Bud light, which is like saying I prefer liver to kidney or haggis.
This is the worst beer in the world not made by Coors.  Lacking any amount of flavor worth the admission price, this is the only beer that I can't drink.  It makes me sick to even think about it.

Pours a super clear gold color with a big rocky head that looks somehow fake.  Aroma is chemicals and corn...yummy...not.  Flavor is mild, much more so than the chemical smell let on.  Some malt and I may have detected some bitterness in the finish.  Body is pretty watery.
Whats to say about this American Light beer.  Bland nothing to it.  Clean and crisp finish.
I like the bite this beer has over other swill like domestics. If I must choose a oderless nearly clear beer this is the one I choose. Less watery than the other Millers

Virtually no aroma or flavor.  There are two reasons that I buy this beer:  It has the highest alcohol-to-calorie ratio in a cheap macro brew that I know of, and it is cheap.  Better than, say, Bud Light and Michelob Ultra and a slew of other crappy light megabrews.  I just wish it didn't cost more than High Life.  It goes down nicely on a hot day, though, especially with a lot of standard American cuisine.

Sorry AB, but no macros' American Standard swill is ever going to get anything but straight ones across the board.  Oh, and a 0 for ingenuity.  However, I admit that in the past (<21 years old) I have stooped to stealing these from my mom.
This is a very mild quaffing beer that is more like water than anything.  Mild hops, little malt, and no finish.
Bottled at a wedding. Why else would a drink it. At least it was a free rating. This had no flavor at all. Loked like a lite.

This is just a decent beer. If I have to drink a cheap American beer, this is the one. Isn't nearly as watered down as the other cheap corporate "lights/lites". A little better than Icehouse. Give me a stout instead anyday.

The problem with this product is that people call it beer. Now if this were Ratevacuums.com and Miller Lite were a vacuum cleaner, it would probably get a great rating. 'Cos it's great at sucking. Miller Lite is only slightly better than Miller High Life.
You know, I don't really like it, but it is pretty refreshing. A hell of a lot better than Coors Light. For a "standard" light beer, this is the one for me.

As far as macro-crap goes, I must defend Miller Lite. It is a decent American light beer if your watching your carbs and calories. It’s not supposed to compete with the great beers we love. It just is what it is, a decent American light beer. And it doesn’t taste like shit either.

tilt your head back and throw these down your face.  if you just want to pound a ton of beer, this would be for you.  everyone knows that this beer tastes like nothing and hence its appeal to dumbasses everywhere that drink beer just to get loaded, like myself.  i think that anyone who is open minded and will try any beer might agree that this beer isn't undrinkable, but it is very boring and watery.  millions of people make this their beer of choice so we cannot argue that miller is doing something right with this product.
This is beer??? I didn't notice. Another minimally alcoholic carbonated waterbeverage as far as I'm concerned.

pours a nearly clear color (if you can call that a color) with a very slight yellow tint, kind of looks like my piss after a night of drinking.  a thin white head diminishes quickly...carbonation is very apparent.  slight malt and straw aromas.  very carbonated mouthfeel with more bitterness than anything else, maybe a a slight malty flavor...dry finish.  good for those nights you want to get ripped and have little molla.  if they tried i bet miller could produce a fine pilsner...being from milwaukee i hope this is true some day!!!
This is great for low carb diets but not much else this is just another cheap macro better then some worst then others
This beer has little to offer in terms of taste and quality. ..............
I cannot understand why this stuff is popular.  It tastes horrible.  Way too carbonated - leading to excess burpage.  Not for me at all...better on tap if you can find it that way.

Pours a pale, watery urine-yellow(what else) with minimal head and lacing.Aroma was of corn, maybe a little malt.Flavor is actually decent, at least better than the other big lights.Mouthfeel and body is thin and watery.Too carbonated and fizzy.Pretty lame and not to mention light! Oh well, but it's the best of the Big Three Lights, in my humble opinion.
Ugly yellow, fizzy head. Very light aroma, sweet corn. Mild sweet adjunct flavor. No body. I can't taste my beer! Oh, wait, I can! It sucks!

It's Miller Lite is really all I can say...
It's only redeeming quality is that pitchers of it are 4 bucks at the bar down the road on Friday nights
not good watsoever, worst of the mainstream light beers ive had, id go as far as saying id take natural light over it
Whenever I go out with friends, this is almost invariably their drink of choice. Why? Why oh why oh why?
Bottle: Pale yellow pours a decent head that clings to the glass. Couldn´t make out any distinct aroma, taste is slightly chemical couldn´t make out anything else.

This is a terrible beer, no matter how you drink it. The head is a frothy muck, the color is urine yellow, and the taste is a too sweet cheap taste that leaves a funky aftertaste, and gives me a headache. I have a hard time drinking these even if they're free. In my opinion, this is the worst of the mainstream beers, making it quite possibly the worst of all time.
Perhaps the only beer I like less than Bud Light.  Very watery and what little flavor there is, is bad

reviewed earlier this week.
Bought in the 24 oz can.
Usual subpar American lager look about this beer ( guess its not meant to be poured into a glass)..very very carbonated.small white head..pale yellow.
The smell wasnt TOO bad..least it was fresh and there does appear to be a hint of the hops..just a hint.
taste was non-dememo  thin and watery small acrid bitterness near end.
bad feel on the tongue just too spritzy.
Not drinkable but not a total drainpour.

While not a beer lover's beer, it is the best of the mainstream lights (what the heck is mainstream?). No question.  Heavy emphasis on the qualifiers...For a low cal, low carb,  "light" beer, it has surprising flavor and is "okay". Period.
yummy water!  For the price, your just getting a buzz.  If you want tase, look elsewhere.

ok these ratings categories cannot capture the beauty of this beer, so lets try the companies ratings.
great taste? Hell NO
less filling? Nope

so what does this leave us? exactly what this crap is, nothing!
Pale.  Almost no aroma or taste.  No head.  Less carbonation than other domestic macros.  No lacing.  No finish.  If it is to be consumed at all, must be ice cold.
A watery beer with little flavor. Hints of hops and flavor leave you wishing you were drinking something fuller. Sits fairly well in the palate. Better than it’s domestic light beer competitors.
gross but drinkiable if they sit in the 14 degree weather and ur super poor and having a party with cheap fucks
This is watery and thin but drinkable.  I would choose this over most other light beers right now.  It strikes me as being better than all the other light macros.

as i get older, lower carbs seems to be more important.  this beer seems to be one of the better lower carb beers.  it's initially refreshing with the typical thin watery texture of most american macro brews.
Better than most of the other watery domestic lights.  Not great, but if I'm going to drink really, really light beer, this is it.
Very light beer with white head that didnt last long.  Not much aroma or taste.  Not quite as good as MGD light but can be refreshing on a hot day.
Light beer with weak flavor.  Minor suds head; not long lasting.  Disgusting.

This canned tall boy poured a small head of white colored finely sized bubbles that left behind a transparent carbonated weak urine yellow colored body and a poor lacing.  The aroma is another one of those mild malt almost non-existant ones.  The mouthfeel is very bubbly thin and mildly conductive in the finish.  Its flavor is a very mild malt hop one.  Hey, can we make this one contain more fat and make it more filling please????
[can] Very pale yellow with a weak head. Hardly any aroma or taste. Very watery. Good for warm weather drinking, but not in December.
Straw yellow. No head. No aroma to speak of. Weak malt flavor. Can taste corn in there as well. A Summer barbecue beer.
I guess it's one of the better macro light beers.  It seems like many of the partys I go to this is there.  Not much to say other than, I need to learn to BMOB.
Virtually no taste, but the slight hint of one that is there isn't terribly pleasant.  I would drink it if it was free, but I'd rather buy a bottle of water.
Perhaps the best of the cheap light beers, but water none the less.  Standby for barbecues, etc.
My favorite of the light beers.  It doesn't have much taste but it's not bad.  I prefer it to MGD.  Bring a case to a party and, trust me, noone will complain.
Your average American Light beer. Somewhat of a watery taste with a little aftertaste to go along with it.
If you have to drink a lite beer, this is better than average. Pale, no aroma, very little flavor, but what there is isn't bad.
A "friend" bought me one when I met him at a bar.  Thank God I picked my next one.  Not much here.  Just low aroma with a watery flavor to match.  If I were on a diet, maybe (or maybe not).

I can't believe I have never rated this beer before. I've drank Miller Lite so many times. It's better than a lot of other light beers but it still sucks. I'll drink it if I HAVE NO CHOICE when I am at a party. But if I am not at a party and someone offers me this beer or soda. I take the soda.
I used to think that this beer was ok but now I can barely stand it. corn dominates what little flavor there is. there is a little bit of hops thrown in but almost undetectable. watery mouth feel.
out the miller style i feel this is a good tasting beer but as you see the name i am a MGD FAN!!!!

Light hop and malt aroma with somewhat of a body odor smell.  Pours a sparlking yellow with a small white and foamy head.  Bitter-sweet flavor.  Light and watery on the palate with a slight creamy texture.
Very easy to drink, surprisingly smooth flavor. Doesn't offer too much taste, but is mild and refreshing. Fairly cheap and has less calories than almost anything out there.

Post party fridge find. You know what it tastes like, looks like, smells like, etc. I get a point for having no particularly awful flavors, but really, there isn't much going here. It is beer seltzer. I can understand the amount of quality control that must go into making a product taste exactly the same for millions of gallons, but I don't rate on degree of difficulty.
Not completely terrible and when you're drunk/broke/thirsty/counting calories its certainly not the worst option.  American-crafted by union workers.
Its cheap and low in calories.  Not a beer for the lover of complex beers but it has a decently crisp taste.

Had a few sips of this out of a can.  That's all I could tolerate.  Pours a light sparkling straw golden.  The monster white creamy head is fully lasting with good lacing.  The nose is yeast, a hint of perfume, and some sulfer.  There isn't much happening in the wold of flavor, but what would you expect from 96 calories?  The body is watery and soft.  Like soda water.
like all low quality beers, this thing really knows how to foam up. Despite scoring below average on every category, i have to score it above average overall simply because it has 3 carbs!

Bottle. I'm still not sure how Miller Light slipped through the cracks for me all this while. I have probably consumed this beer more than any other light beer since my first Ratebeer logon. I just figured erroneously that I had rated it. Very faint aroma. Hard to pick out much of anything there. Pale gold color with lots of carbonation and a small, mostly eroding white head. Excellent latticework lace. I could have sworn that Lite had a little more of a hop profile than I taste right now. Lite has the most flavor of the Big 3 lights (others being Bud Light and Coors Light), but Coors Light has the most distinctive flavor. As much as I love great, full bodied craft brews, it's nice to knock down a bunch of these every now and again.

I rate this beer high not because I like it all that much, but because it is and tastes just like you would expect it to. It's a light beer and it tastes light. They don't try to make it taste like something it's not. The best light beer.

Would you believe there's legalized beer pong in San Francisco?  (Shhh, don't tell the Dean of Students.)  It's the most expensive thing going in this purportedly hip youngish bar.  12 bucks a pitcher and not worth the ping-pong balls to play.  No aroma, very fizzy, and little taste from malt or hops.

Among the darker of the lights,couldn't detect a molecule of aroma, seemed overly carbonated,actually was a little malt corn sweetness with a little hop aftertaste. Probaly the best of the lights but so what.
Pale yellow in color, small fizzy head. Aroma is faint grain. Flavor is water with meatalic notes. Finish is bland and slightly sweet.

Im sorry,but I have to give this beer it’s props,It got me drunk through college!And it’s still my beer of choice when I want to get loaded.It tastes Ok and it’s pretty cheap.Its a hell of alot better then that Bud Crap!
Just when I thought that Bud Light was the worst beer I ever tasted, this was even worse!
A grainy corn with some hints of metal and grass. An offensive bitterness of flowers and some grains. A horrible beer.

Wow.  Like so many domestic (read USA) beers, this one is a variation on the Bohemian Lager called Pilsner.  In Montana we get a 3.2% version of Miller Lite, but as the ads say "less filling and it tastes great."  Miller is another of the lawnmower beers, but when I was on the Adkins Diet, I could have one of these suckers from time to time.  Lite is a decent American Pilsner with fine clarity and a white head of foam.  The nose is virtually non-existent, but has hints of the traditional light lager hops hiding behind huge amounts of CO2.
When on sale and the wether is hot, the price is right.

I found a can of this in the fridge yesterday.  Who knows how it got there.

Can.  Looks like it was artificially colored.  Decent head, quickly dissipated.  Strong metallic taste.  Not much taste that can be attributed to the brewing process.  I guess it's better than budweiser.  I drank a lot of this beer in the past and I have no nostaligic feelings towards it whatsoever.  If you're broke, go for it.
decent light beer for what it is. Slight aroma, not sure if I tasted the hopps at all. picture of beer shows thick head, this is obviously a sham, small head on bear lasted only seconds.

This has easily been my favourite mass-produced brew whenever I got to the US. Decent in the bottle and decent on draught. I can’t find anything nice to say about it but I have found it to be dependable. It doesn’t suck, but it doesn’t dance on your tonsils either. A good quaffer while in the boozer.
RE-RATE: Oh my God what the hell was I thinking? Tried this a week ago on a visit to Boston and Chicago and it tasted of soda water. This is pure crap. I must have been young and foolish.
This is my go to beer.  It is good when you are really thirsty.  It is darker than other comparable light beers.  I like it.

i must first say that for schwag beers nothing in the world compares to miller lite...mmmmm good. forget those other half assed schwag beers like bud and natty , (sclitz doesnt count cause its pure nostalgic) everyone in my home town agrees when someones making the packy and names are being thrown up (among other things) when someone yells miller lite the crowd goes silent we look around and its agreed, a silent agreement based on the collective opinion of a room beer barins. anytime is the right time for miller time

I feel a little ashamed that I didn't just hate this beer, but it wasn't offensive so it can't score too low. Plus I was a little surprised that it did have a nice gold color instead of the thin yellow stuff I was expecting and it had a head that didn't instantly fizz away. The flavor wasn't much, mostly an interesting applely flavor when really cold, then joined by a faint huskiness a little later on.

I fly 8 hours to get to another country and what do I do? Well, by arriving on a Saturday night I have a day off before da business starts on Monday. As a ratebeerian I go to find beers that I haven't tasted. I knew of the microbrews here so that wasn't so hard as they were pretty good. But then I see this one. Hmmmm, I know I have tried MGD but this one? Methinks that I am looking a drain pour. Mesright. I paid $3.25 for a 330ml can of this beer just because the RB disease says I have to. Damn you Ratebeer, damn you, your kiddies, your momma and papa and your faithful dawg named Old Shep. If this is American Light please forget to pay the bill so it can be turned off.
ok his is a week beer that i have to gve props to it is an okay one. bu arogant beats it by far...another crock pot cooker
now this is what a light beer is about fantastic tasting very low carbs compared to other light beers.cheers
That boy is a P-I-G, Pig... gotta love Belushi for endorsing this beer after he departed
I just drank a forty of this stuff.  Hey, could have been worse.  Less filling, tastes great?  Maybe not but not disgusting

Bottle. This is a very non-offensive beer. It's watery, tasteless, but doesn't offens in the slightest. Very little flavor, no off-flavors (mainly because it has no flavor), no aroma... I actually think this is the best of the american macro beers, onlyu because it doesn't offend...
This is your typical American light beer. Bland and uninteresting. Don't let the marketing fool you.

What can I say - years ago I used to drink   this swill regularly. Youth . . . I guess it's most prevalent characteristic is a hefty amount of carbonation. Less filling, Less quality, I've spent too much time on it already.
This is tough, how do you rate nothing?? No taste, palate or anything resembling beer.
I had it so I'll rate it.  Best thing about this beer is the catfight commercial.  At least it's made with corn not rice which makes it slightly more visually stimulating than Bud Light.

A terrible, terrible "beer."  I am really at a loss for words when trying to describe this stuff.  Almost flavorless except for a vodka-like aftertaste.  Terrible color, flavor, everything.  Too bad this is one of the most popular beers around.
This is probably the worst American beer I have ever had. It is horribly watery stuff. I will drink it at parties if I have to.
A popular American pilsner, but not a good pilsner.  I like the commercial description "full-bodied beer"???  Only good if you are at the ball park.

strangely enough, it was kind of sweet like a hefeweizen, only not. it was the same as like bud or something, but this was light and beleive me...a pitcher dindt even get me buzzed. whats the point? i ordered a pitcher you know, so the waitress brings me this long straw to dirnk it with, that was cool.

It is less filling but certainly does not taste great. That being said, it isn't as bad as the Bud products and has a bit more hops.  If Genny advertised as much as those macros, they'd blow them out of the water.
Well, its lite beer.  To expect real beer taste in a lite is unfair.  Actually it isn't all that bad ..... for a lite beer.

Well, I probably shouldn't review this because it's so boring.  But I will.  Pours yellow and boring with very little white head that dies out quickly.  Smells kinda skunky.  Tastes kinda skunky - but that's all you pay for because it is a fairly cheap beer that is mass produced.  This is one of the few that it doesn't matter if you have it out of the can or off the tap, it still tastes the same (a little skunky and cheap).
DIE, DIE ALL OF YOU SCUMSUCKERS WHO PERPETUATE THE MYTH THAT THIS PONDWATER IS BEER! Truly an awful brew with awful qualities!
boooooooooooooooooooo.  Like sex in a canoe, close to water.  Beer? I think not!
Truely a budget beer with tons of adjuncts. SAB made a huge mistake......if Phillip Morris new it sucked......hello?

better than I thought.  really a good value.  very light and drinkable out of the bottle.  yeah it's not a quality brew that like tastes like beer or something, but it had less off flavors and wierdness than the other cheap light beers i've had recently.  less filling can be a pretty good thing too.

24oz Can 1st ImpressionAroma is loaded with enough DMS to kill a horse, also a little burnt plastic background. When I first opened this and smelled, I questioned myself if I had just let one rip or if this beer was truly the source of the putrid smell. Pale urine color with an endless supply of carbonation that bubbles up from the bottom. Where is it coming from?!?!! Flavor is bland, very bland, almost like water, but a slight hint of hops as if they accidently dropped about 1 oz of it into their Goliath brewkettle that concocts this foul beverage for the masses to consume in honky tonk fashion. I'd rather choke the nun than have another one of these.
Continuing on...WHY DID I BUY A 24oz CAN?!!?? At least my gag reflex is getting a work out. mmmmm burnt corn. WTF?!
Bottom of drinkNext time I see someone buy/drink/talk about/look like one/or in any other way shape or form remind me of this, I will spontaneously combust and have multiple seizure from the horrible flash backs of this disgusting beer. In retrospect, after putting this foreign liquid into my body, I no longer have any fear of death. 
THE END

Very pale yellow appearance.  Maybe some light fruit in the nose, that's being generous.  The body is very dry, that's using a nice word for saying no taste whatsoever.  Sweet and nothing happening.  As terrible as everyone says.
I've consumed allot of Miller Lite in my day. Not a bad beer. Great ice cold. Wisconsin makes better beers than my home state of Missouri. Sorry AB.
Less filling, tastes great, less filling tastes great, less filling, tastes great, less filling, tastes great (am I over my minimum word limit yet).

Fizzy, straw-colored water.  One time I was at a party where they had two kegs of this.  I ended up letting some drunk guy shave my head with some razor he found in a drawer.  I woke up with a quarter of my hair missing and band-aids on my head.
Sadly, I used to think this was good beer.  Thank god I am over that.  I will say that it is the best macro american domestic.  That is not saying much at all.

Pale yellow color with a white head that was gone quickly.  Stale beer aroma with alot of carbonation in the taste. I had it again yesterday playing beer pong and while I was drinking it I could have sworn there was a faint taste of hops in there somewhere, so I added another point to flavor.
Sunny coloured beer. Very carbonated, more head than I expected although they don't stay long. The rest is boring and unworthy of your time.
I know Pilsners......I've drunk many Pilsners.....I make Pilsners....this AIN'T NO PILSNER.  Typical light overly carbonated, under flavored swill best for getting drunk, not for enjoyment.
Better than Bud Light. I have nothing else nice to say......................

Can't believe I'd forgotten to rate this one.  This carefully crafted pilsner uses the finest rice to stretch their beerlike substitute.  There really is very little taste and the smell is altogether unpleasant.  In other words, it's an American Light.

People are too hard on this beer--it's a good happy hour beer and usually pretty cheap during happy hours to boot.  Smooth and less watery than other Lite beers.  I read that it's the second most popular beer in America and it can't be just because of mass marketing (then again)....

The beer to drink when you're drinking more than ten. This is my favorite domestic macro brew. Goes down easy and it really doesn't taste bad. Quenches my summer thirst. No discussion of aroma, appearrance, or flavor needed.
Sorry, but I have to say that I LOVE this beer.  I had to rate it first because it is simply the best.  That might set some people off but it is mt favorite from first sip to last.

Typical macro American light beer. Better than most though. Good for getting drunk, but not much else. Low in carbohydrates and low in flavor/aroma. Too bad they canceled the ad with the hot chicks wrestling.

From a can at my brother in-laws. All I taste is Dimethyl Sulfide. It's a pale yellow, fizzy alcohol delivery system. Nothing of note except that I wonder why such flavorless swill sells as well as it does, and why people don't count the 14g of alcohol in the beer towards their carb intake. Ethyl alcohol is called "sugar alcohol" for a reason.
Pretty good light pils. Pours nicely with a decent head wich rapidly disappears. Smooth and easy, drinkable when ice cold. The same as all the rest, but the commercials are incredible.

Hey kids, it's Miller Fuckin' Lite. Prosu sponsor of some crap I can't remember anymore. Slightly flavored water, don't you think? It could be worse, like Blatz or something. Bebí este crap junto con un emparedado del pollo de la Jack-in-the-Box la otra noche y pagué ella toda querido por la mañana.
Artificial aroma, pvc's I think, with a pale yellow colour, some white head, oops it's gone now. Almost no taste, bland.
The only lite beer I'll drink, miller lite is nice when I'm feeling out of shape and haven't worked out in a while. Certainly not a real beer but not TOOOO bad.
Pale, fizzy yellow. White fizzy head. Fizzy aroma of corn, cardboard & perm solution. Fizzy feel. Thin, watery, fizzy flavour of corn & cardboard. An American classic for sure.
I used to drink this because it ( I ) was cheap. Pale yellow fizzy beer. Nothing bad, just not much there.

First, let's put all of this "it's all about the numbers crap" by the wayside, shall we.  This is an American classic, so what else would I drink on the 4th of July.  Besides, it's the taste of a true pilsner.  Apparently, Pilsner Urquell has it all wrong, which is funny because they're owned by the same company.  D'oh!  Pale yellow. Strange, I was expecting a rich bronze.  After all, both Miller and Michael Jackson think that this is a pilsner.  Aroma of cardboard, DMS and plastic.  Since Jackson reckons this is a pilsner, and Miller says so themselves, I was kind of expecting a boatload of saaz or hallertau, punctuated by clean, refined continental pale malts.  Undaunted though, because the world's top beer writer thinks this and its ilk are pilsners, I must be the one who's wrong.  Now, I thought that maybe things would rectify themselves in the flavour and mouthfeel - you know, rich and hoppy, clean straw notes and a full rich body, leaving a lingering bitterness on the tongue.  Yet strangely, this pilsner is completely different - vague DMS and pretty much nothing else.  You know, when something is totally different than something else, it is kind of idiotic to suggest that they are the same.  Anyone who wants to call beers like this pilsner is being terminally assinine.  Thank you.  And yes, it's all about the numbers.
Just save your body the trouble and dump it in the toilet. Hows that for a rating.
I gove this the same I gave bud light.  I would prefer this in a bottle and bud out of a keg.  I stay away from both of them now.  If it's 75 cent domestic pints I usually go for this.

My father-in-law says,"here, take these home." He bought them for a friend that came over the previous night and he didn't want to drink the stuff. So I rated it. My wife says, "it's already pee." That about sums it up.
i'm surprised at some of the low ratings on this beer.i'm not a huge fan of light beer but i really love this beer.one of the best tasting beers i ever had.i recommmend it to everyone.
My favorite macro brew (interesting considering I'm a strong ale fan). Perhaps it's because you can eat a full meal and still put down 9 or 12 without feeling over full. I agree with the brunette.
For a light beer that has a similar price to bud and coors products, this is a superior beverage.  It is one of the few light beers with any flavor at all.  Very nice color.

This  beer has the same color as water, has no flavor at all, and gives you a headache that will bring you to your knees the next morning.
