DO NOT DRINK THIS BEER!
Cold it tastes like carbonated water....warm it tastes like old water.  Avoid if you can.
Bottled.  Not much flavor/aroma here.  Nothing "bad" stands out (see Natual Light for skynky metallic favors) but this is one watery, light, flavorless beer.
one of my favorites.  the long necks are to die for.  cans have some foaming problems.
Better than MGD light (ugh) but not as good as coors light or bud light in my opinion. No taste to it but I do detect a lot of stale tasting water.

Ugh, typical fizzy yellow tastless beer.  No head to speak of, no lacing.  Very thin bodied, little flavour.  While it doesn't taste *bad* it doesn't taste good, either.  For comparison's sake, I'd rather have a Bud Light, but that's not saying much.  Concurring with another rater - it's not even good when it's free.

Aroma? None. Flavor? Not bad, cause there is none. I have to give it points for looking like a beer. Was served this by someone who still thinks beer tastes best in a glass that's been in the freezer. Tried to get him interested in a Yuengling I'd bought, but no dice.

This stuff is really nasty. A really metallic, corn bite that leaves a horrible after taste. One of my best friends has drunk this for years and I take my hat off to him every time he pops a top. A good Sharps beats this stuff. One of the few beers that isn't even good when it's free.

What a waste of 96 calories. Have an onion ring instead. I bought a bottle of this watery excuse for an American light for my wife and had a few sips myself. I'm now starting to have second thoughts about Rusty Wallace....

Draft.  After volleyball, someone else bought the pitcher.  Overcarbonated, held a nice white head.  Smelled of faint grain and something kind of like a sweaty jock strap.  Or maybe that was me, I'm not sure.  The palate was thin and watery.  Flavor was negligible, almost no discernible hops and the obvious taste of something other than 100% malt.  I suspect that "select cereals" were used.  Sucked, but nothing truly "wrong" with it.  Pretty amazing they can make this stuff at such a massive volume and have it taste the exact same time after time.
This is the typical, American light beer.  It's better than Coors, but not quite as good as Bud.

Goes down smooth, nothing special though. I really can't think of anything to complain about with this beer. It's not trying to be something it's not.
No unpleasant aftertaste, I've had much, much worse.
Loved the old beer advertisements with the sports stars... those were the days... when I thought this was a good beer.

01-Jul-2004  Actually stole another can of this from a party.  Did not realize that I had rated this goodness before.  So I decided to try this blissful nectar of the gods in my Orval Trappist glass hoping that being surrounded by class, history and quality might inspire this insipid swill.  Oh, woe is me for disgracing the holy relic of Orval.  I should be crucified never to drink a trappist brew again.  Once again, doesn't matter how you dress it up.  Crap is still CRAP!!!

Wow.  What can I say to this modern marvel of craft brewing.  The brewmasters must be  pure geniuses to be able to produce a beer of this quality.  My hats off to them.  To make a beer so devoid of color, flavor, texture and aroma with the same ingredients that go into other "microbrewed" beer is cause for a nomination for this years Nobel prize for science.  I guess the real geniuses are the marketing people who somehow can convince the worlds discerning beer drinkers that this is actually beer.  Should really be consumed from a paper cup to get the full drinking pleasure.  Don't waste your time!
absolutely horrible.  havent drank this in a while, and for that very reason.  beer has no head, no taste, and no bite.  drink this if you wear panties

Never bought this stuff, but was invited to drink some at a friend's house (he keeps it for guests and does not drink himself). A very thin watery beer with a very weak taste, very inferior to Bud Light.
All is all a decent beer.  Much better out of the can as you dont have to deal with that rust taste from the bottle cap.  This is a great lawnmowing beer.
A light beer. YUK! pale color. No head. Watered down taste. A waste of time drinking this piss water.

I actually liked this beer at one time, but that was long ago, when it first came out. Light yellow with a snow white head which
didn't last long enough for me. Tasted smooth, though. Not over carbonated like most Miller products. Actually has some hops
flavors & aromas to it, but not much. To me, it actually sorta tastes like a draft beer. Well, kinda anyway. Still has that grainy,
midwest taste to it, however. Not such a bad beer, for a macroswill.
A pale golden color with a lack of head. A citrus, metallic, hop aroma. A very small hint of citrus and hop flavor.
A pale golden color with no head. Basically piss water but, better than Bud Light.

The aroma is light and sweet.  The appearance is a clear gold with a thin white head.  The flavor is light almost nothing, yet has hints of cardboard, maybe some light hops.  The beer is crisp and easy to drink.  Overall averager for the style, and what you would expect.
Has a very light golden color with a lot of carbonation and a light rice/corn smell.  Taste is similar and very light.  Overall not bad for a light, well at least it didn't make me sick.
I just can not choke this beer down, it has a bitter/sour taste too me.  Not a quality brew.

Had some on draft at a party recently.  I don't know how, but I managed to drink a cup and half of this swill before I came to my senses.  Still though, wasn't entirely repulsive.  

I must comment on the insanely bad ads for Miller Light that call it a Pilsner.  Whatever. They should be sued, you here me SUEEEEEDD!!!
About the same as my rating for regular MGD, overall, not bad as far as the big three are concerned.  Still fairly foul, though.

This is a great beer for the old standby in the 'fridge.  My opinion is that it is a good value and it far exceeds Coors Light, Bud Light and everything down from there.  At a party, this beer will disappear first among the "regulars"

Had this after the beer tasting and after a Stone Ruination IPA. It's all I had left in the house. My brother left it in the fridge and I needed something during the movie I was watching. Very unpleasant rice/corn aroma. The taste is worse and seems kind of skunky. Perhaps a bad bottle but isn't it all bad even if it's fresh? Why do I still drink this stuff? Damn Ratebeer.com! I have to try and break into the Top 50 but this is killing me.
Before I was old enough to buy beer, I thought that this was what beer was supposed to taste like.  Now, I know differently.  You're better off buying a bottle of Evian, you'd get more flavor.

I rated this because you cant avoid it really. Better than Bud/Coors light but thats like saying its the "Baldwin with the best acting ability". It is a little darker in apperance than bud and may even have a tad more flavor. But overall just light pissy water. Give my regards to Dick in advertising.
Greets you with an extremely pale yellow and a faint hop aroma. The flavor is a subtle hop/malt mix. Finishes dry. Thirst quenching, little more.

I had you in green on tap last night/threw ice at some patrons, almost got in a fight/but cup after cup you guided me home/just for that, Mr. Lite, I wrote you this poem.

Like green-dyed water your taste was so bland/your blonde body quaffed from a cup in my hand/your head was crazy till the bartender repoured/your energy yet pulsing, my mood was not bored.

At the end of the night I wondered aloud/I just drank a Miller Lite, I feel quite proud!/For an amateur beer snob still needs his swill/to keep up his mood and sharpen his will!
There's movies you wouldn't want to see unless you're drunk.  The same thing applies to drinking this beer.  Can't say much other than the fact it delivers alcohol.
this beer is not worth the bottle that it comes in. You migth as well drink flavoured water.
A standard very boring beer.  It has a thin watery appearance.  It is notable that this beer is not foul.

All the men in my family drink this like it's water, which isn't far from the truth. Not as bad as Budweiser products, but still pretty bad. However, on a hot day, so hot you head is swimming, an ice cold miller lite (or six) can be quite refreshing. Or is that my genes talking.

If I have to choose an American light beer it has to be this one. Being a poor college student, I have gotten used to the taste and can actually drink this stuff without cringing. Granted, it's still not a very good beer, but it is halfway drinkable. Has a sweet taste with a pure white head. Better in a bottle than in a can.
i was snowed in at my grandfathers house and the only beer was this junk. thankfully he had some champagne and sauce. blech.
Drank this stuff when I was underage and had to rely on somene else buying the stuff. Wouldn't drink it now if I could help it.
very carbonated, watery, sweet/tangy/ sourish aftertaste to it, perhaps a trace of hops, quickly disappating head, do not recommend.
Another watered-down American beer - good for commercials and NASCAR sponsorship, but look elsewhere for taste.
This is pretty nasty stuff.  I guess if you're totally broke and need a buzz...I think water is actually stronger.
Hardly anything to speak of.  But if you want to drink 30 beers in one night, this is the beer to do it with.
Pretty similar to coors light, and maybe a tad better than bud light, in my opinion.

Light golden color with a head that disappears quickly.  This lacks taste as I expect from a light beer.  Very thin.  My friends who don't like the taste of beer drink this.  Try Michelob for a better light beer.
Call me crazy, but i kinda like this stuff, better than I thought it would be. A good option when wanting to drink something on tap. and left with nothing to choose from but bud or some local swill.

I bought a 40 of this in support of their catfight ad.  Good head on pour, but lousy taste going down.  Flavor lingers better than Busch.  Bad associations that didn't help, as it's the same beer my grandma drinks...
Wow.  Took me a long time to try this one.  Much less offensive than I feared it would be.

I am sorry to say that I have consumed more than I should have of this beer.  It's great for college parties, and that's about it. Nothing special here except for the commercials.  Rerate:  This stuff is total crap, I am just about sick of it.  Its all my roomates want to drink when we go out, and so we do over and over again.  It tastes like the dirty water from a washing machine, and looks almost as bad.
Not for me... Yellow water with some carbonation. Not much of a nose. Little malts and hints of hops.
Best cheap american beer.  Much better than any budweiser product.  It is what I would drink if I am at a bar without good beers on tap.
By far the best American lite beer. It's my everyday beer. Far superior to Bud or Coors. I love it. It's Miller time baby!!

Again I have to agree with the other reviews.  I had a good friend that I would take out to nice pubs with a 100 or so other things to choose from and he would always order frikkin Miller Lite.  You could hear a pin drop when he said it too, quite amusing.  Everyone just kind of turned and looked like why are you ordering that?

Went to a bad beer party during the summer and the host had this on tap, I wanted to vote for this as worst beer. I am always amazed at people who order this at bars when there are 24 other beers on tap that are excellent.
I must rate this as a warning and as penance for past consumption. Drink water its better
very very bad and also something my dad drinks, which makes me unable to ever have it again because drinking this beer makes me feel like my dad.
This used to be one of my favorite beers until I visited Germany and discovered wheat beer.  Now I know why they serve it cold.

Yea, miller lite is the classic american slop light beer. There's nothing wrong with that. It's easy to drink, with enough of a hops bite to get your attention, and with a light body which can let you drink a few while watching a Phillies game at the Vet.
I''m rating all the crap I drank way too much of before I knew what beer really tasted like.

Horse piss!  By far the worst beer I''ve ever tasted.  Those who like this beer don''t really like beer, they like getting drunk.  Even such discount beers as Natural Light or Milwaukee''s Best are preferrable to this swill.  At least they have no flavor at all versus the dirty, soapy dishwater taste of Miller Lite.  Thank God "there''s only one Lite Beer!"

Back during my amateur alcoholic days everyone was shoving a can of this stuff at me.  I recently tried this stuff again and it was really a disappointment. I wanted to like it but it was disgusting. Watery, with a nasty skunky taste.  Hard to believe this stuff was considered the Coors light of the 80''s.  Tastes like a low end Pabst product

Looks almost like beer, but a little too light, too straw colored.  Not much nose.  Palate is thin, bitter water.  Taste, why have taste?  I used to drink Millers Genuine Draft in grad school because it was cheaper than Coke.  I would drink this only if it were cheaper than tap water.  Overall, it is really bad and it gets worse as it warms up.
this tastes good.. not a bad beer.. nice and watery.. can drink lots!!!.....
Better than Miller High Life though not by much. Tolerable for a light beer.

Oh bloody Hell!  Did someone wash out my beer glass with dish soap and then forget to rinse it?  Sheesh, I think I''d rather drink the dishwater--though at least Miller Lite looks slightly better in the glass.  Pale yellow, impressive initial head that quickly disappears.  The taste isn''t exactly foul but it''s certainly not pleasant.  I guess "soapy" describes it best. At least there''s some buzz potential from the alcohol...
Thin, flavorless beer.  It''s like having sex in a canoe....................

Very pale yellow with a thick white head and a fair amount of lace.  Almost non-existant aroma - Bitter and Slightly hoppy.  Basically water however a little maltiness is detectable on the tongue.  Very light and smooth.
from a tap, slightly better than budweiser, other was boring and unoriginal.
Terible stuff.  Avoid at all costs...drinkk a Blatz instead!................
A decent Light beer. Very widely availible. Has a rather pleasing flavor to it.
Hell ya, beer from texas is the way to go...................................
Good for boiling crawfish or cooking sausage, if someone else bought the beer.
Good beer for a long day in the sun or out in the fish house but nothing to brag about. Like most lite beers you have to take them for what they are and not what they aren't.

Typical college football beer (swill).  Mass marketed beverage that is full of adjuncts and evidence of the process that goes into making a mass quantity schite beer.  However for tailgates it is acceptable (functional) to feed the masses that know no different.
the best thing abou this beer, its for those that watch their weight, only 96 calories.
Fizzy, with a very sparse head. Really just a background beer. Slightly watery and light (lite) as can be. Can’t say I hate but can’t say it makes my mouth water in anticipation.
Not tasteless, and not tasteful this beer is at best less than a half bodied beer.
its beer... used to buy it often, but now not so much so.  will drink a few if offered.
Probably the best domestic macro light beer.  Nice color, and a refreshing taste.  I''d drink it again.
More alcohol then other light beers so it gets my vote......................
Not bad for a light beer.  Who the hell called this a "true pilsener" anyway?
Excellent when drank on tap.  Especially at a fine beer serving venue as the tavern for a price of one dollar.
One of the better mass produced American lights.............................
Thirst-quenching and superior to bud light..................................
Its like drinking out of the toilet. I''d rather have a Coor''s Light to this stuff...
Definately the best between itself, coors and bud. nothing special. I recently discovered them in pounders, but, 96oz later, my opinion remained the same.
Awful, rotten, blah---makes the holidays with the ex husband more barable.  Never drink out of a can unless necessary.
It''s good if you dont have a lot of money and your at a bar. Other than that, I wouldn''t buy it.
Slightly better than Michelob.  Had i on draft, and it was no better than the bottle.
I have had worse but not much better either.................................
I drink it allot but only because i live close to milwaukee. Not much going on, so you might as well drink it very cold.
Eating cardboard & having an anxiety attack...your hair falls out ..........
Like Natural Light... it''s a better light beer with exactly what you need if you''re drinking light beer.

Although I do not normally drink a light beer, if I do have one it is usually a Miller Lite.  Although nothing special, it still delivers a decent amount of flavor for a light beer.  And it is also good for diabetics becuase of the low carbs.
If you run out club soda, you can substitute with Miller Lite...............
Golden, malt aroma.  Flavorful for a factory light beer ... pleasant lingering.  Put aside the snobbery and admit that this isn't half bad.
Meh.  Definitely had a hoppy taste and aroma.  Not a bad one for dollar drafts.

One of the better big-brewery lights, I prefer it to bud, coors, and co. Very smooth and easy to drink, perhaps because it is so watered down? Still, I don''t mind it. A decent thirst-quencher, thats about it.
After reading all the comments below, I don''t believe there is anything else I can add.

American Macrobrew Light Beer with multiple chemical additives that make it taste somewhat like a beer.  Overall, this beer comes off as unnatural and metallic.  Relies more on chemical processes than brewing techniques.  I would avoid this beer at all costs.
About as watery as Cornoa light (you might as well buy bottled water).......
what can you say about water  p.u. still it's my old stand by when there is nothing else around.

Freebie from my Dad. I don''t know how he drinks this stuff. Hardly any aroma, it''s like sniffing soda water. Clear Golden yellow pour with a rapidly dissolving head. Ummmmm....tastes like...powdered beer mixed with soda water. Hardly any hops or malt, just tastes like adjunct brewed crap. Yummy.
The traaditional cheap beer of bars and frat parties.  Good for shotgunning, or recycling.  After two I get a headache.  Nothing is worse than this liquid when it warms.

One of the better domestic light beers. Still not worth buying unless your having a party where people don’t mind drinking crap.

This has been substituted into my regime as tap water.
Buy fresh and drink quickley as light beers go skunky fast.  I enjoy this beer when I am in the mood to drink alot due too the low ABV
At least their commercials are mildly entertaining..........................
Tasting several light beers side-by-side, this has to be one of my least favorites.  It''s extremely fizzy and has virtually no flavor whatsoever.
Why else would you drink this unless to get drunk.  Really has no rich flavor, and full-bodied, are you kidding!

~~~~~~KEG PARTY~~~~~ <--  There was a party yesterday with 2 kegs of miller light.  Since I was already drunk  off Dank beer and stoned , this beer wasnt too bad. I'll drink almost anything if it free.

I really do not understand how High Life Light is exponentially better than Miller Lite. Gets stanky really quickly. Always rough on the gut, especially draft. Absolutely no head - even from tap. Bubbles are soda-like and dissipate within seconds. Too fizzy. Sweetish taste. No complexity. Stay with the High Life or High Life Light. Shame on you, Miller Brewing Co.! This brew must represent the highest profit margin for any Miller product.
Yeah, it''s still a lite beer, but it''s better than Anheuser-Busch''s light offerings. A little more flavorful than most light beer''s but not by much.
The most that you can take away from drinking several of these are the good memories of the people that you were with or the crazy things you did.
Not a great quality beer, but always enjoyable during a game or at the local watering hole.
If you like fizzy corn-on-the-cob, this is for you..........................
Zero would be nice right now!I once took an empty six pack of Busch Light cans and traded it in for a free case of this filth.
Out of the cheap light beers, this is definately the best. .................

The only time I have ever bought this beer was when they had a new marketing executive a couple of years ago.  Their cans were very funny and their sales weren't.  I liked them, I guess nobody else did

As light beers go, this one is actually better than most...Nothing really offensive here except the watered-down quality of, well...everything...If one wants to keep it light, just drink 4 regular beers instead of a 6-pack of this swill and call it a day...
This is another terrible beer, i unfortunatly have tasted it.  If you ask me i would stay away from any miller product what so ever.  This beer is almost as good as water.
miller light is a smooth always delicious palate. this beer is very delicious and a delicious price of 1 dollar on tap at the paddock club. delicious beer delicious price.

Ok  suffice it to say that this is not a very good beer.  Had this one after a great dove hunt in 90 degree weather.  In this case this numbingly cold beer was probably as good as it gets.  As such it still is pretty poor.  Semis sweet, fizzy and watery.  Some bitterness with no malt and hence no complexity.   I would have one again in the same circumstances but will never pay for one.

I dont know how these catagories were created. Why not add some that are useful like smoothness and poundablity. This is the smoothest beer out there especially on tap. Im not alone on feeling this way. This is the number one beer in the county and i live in the richest county in Illinois. This outsells Bud by 8 to 1 and the imports well .... Plain and simple if it wasnt brewed in Milwaukee it isnt worth drinking.
I'm Rusty Wallace fan but not of his beer. MGD is much better...............

At $8.99 per 12 pack this beer is overpriced.  I'd like to find this Mr. Miller so I can slap him very hard in the face.  If I could somehow devise a tube that traveled from my genitals to my mouth, it could be Miller time whenever I needed to urinate.

slightly preferable to bud light. Must be ice cold. Can be enjoyable as a thirst quencher. Spicy food will mask aftertaste. Finish quickly. Best when free. Much more preferable than bad full-caloried beers.
I like the beer it is cheap and i'm a college student can drink alot of it at a party and still be not shitty enough to make an ass of myself
Too weak, another beer that requires a case to get buzzed.  By the way, why "LITE" instead of "LIGHT".  Sucks either way.
No taste at all. Not even as good as Coors Light............................

Miller Lite, probably, next to Bud, the most advertised beer.  A bit watery, but still not bad to stop from drinking it.  It's mostly seen at parites by the case or at softball games, but for the price it seems o.k.  Overall, i can stand it.

Rerate Hair tonic-like aroma, light golden appearance, slight white head, slightly grassy flavor, some metal, hint of hops. Thinnish mouthfeel. Still don’t get the attraction of this beer. Original 1.9 There’s a reason I waited until no. 131 to rate one of the world’s top selling beers - it is really no good.  Proof that marketing is everything with the big boys - barely discernable beer taste - slight skunky odor to it - almost flat tasting.  Sad to think that some people never venture farther than this in their beer drinking. Goes down smooth though - no flavor to get in the way.
If you like carbonated water this crap is for you...........................
smells lie cat piss.... taste a little better than bud/coors lite but nto by much. still i gt it for free an drank one warm, at leat warm  cant taste this crap.

this is the beer that i started drinking with. i cannot thank miller enough for this. the taste of this beer is irrelavent to me because it has sentimental meaning to me. but i think the taste is good for an American beer.....keep on drinking

Very carbonated, light gold, and with a fluff head that collapses like the Anaheim Angels every September. In my mind, this beer vacillates between Am. standard and Am. light as far as mouthfeel and heaviness are concerned--but it is probably not worth quibbling over the difference between light and ultra light. Finishes with a flat, cardboard feel on the palate--at least this beer is clean and crisp.
Not much of any flavor to talk about - useful when you're looking for quantity, not quality.  For the battle of the U.S. macrobrews, I give my nod to Bud.

My friend was drinking this, so I partook.  Terrible.  No flavor, like water, and just really awful.  Re-rate: I had a can at a fish fry and it was very thin, I could see to the bottom of the can after opening it!  White head, but actually not an offensive flavor, sort of like MGD made palatable.

Might quite possibly be the worst beer I've ever had.  Almost water, with a very weak taste.  The only thing it's got going for it is the fantastic marketing.  I wouldn't offer this to guests unless their sole purpose was to slam back beers until they passed out, and that's only because the stuff's not expensive.
Vintage dated Super Bowl XXXII (1998?). Clearing out the fridge before the move. Rancid foamy crap. Guess I missed the best before date by about 36 MONTHS!!!
Very watery, not much flavor at all. But nothing offensive, cheap, and it gets you drunk.
Much better than budlight or coors light. Best light beer available.........
Re-rate.  I was unfair to this the first time, I must have been in a critical mood.  It's no worse than Bud.  I like it cold in the can with fried chicken.  What can I say.

worst beer ever. "carefully crafted pilsner"... yeah, carefully crafted by who, monkeys? it's a shame im wasting my day commenting on this crap. It is the type of beer that makes you angry... why the hell do people drink this??? it just proves to you that most americans are mindless lemmings who love a good advertisement. How sad

As with most, I was at a bar with friends that doesn’t serve much so I had a Lite.  I was pleased at how clean and refreshing it was, even though it has almost no body or flavor.  Its not really that bad, it just has an absence of good.  "Like making love in a canoe..."

So here's the thing.  This beer is bad.  Very bad.  But when I was learning to bowl with my in-laws in the finest tradition of die hard competitive blue collar wisconsin style action, I drank this beer.  And now, when bowling, it seems appropriate - it goes with the clown shoes and the gum snapping teens and the rolled up tee shirts and the cheap lighting and the bright ash trays.  It's just that kind of beer.

Above average for a light beer, good price, noticeably much much better in a bottle

Head is initially small, fizzy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is clear light yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (cereal), trace hops (herbs). Flavor is lightly sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is moderately bitter. Light body, watery texture, fizzy carbonation. Plenty of bitterness, surprisingly, but virtually no real malt to offset that.

This is baseball game beer and nothing more. Its light beer...and whats synonomous with light??? You got it...crap! The taste is bleah at best... Clear color, carbonated out the ying yang..corny cardboardy flavor...do i really need to go on?
My second favorite of the American lights next to Coors Light.  A great thirst quencher if nothing else is available with a mild aftertaste.

Not much of a beer.  Still quenches better than any other domestic swill in the hot AZ sun. I drink this stuff when I'm floating down a river or getting loaded before a football game. It serves a purpose and is the best of all Miller offerings.
not as watery as bud light.  But bad beers should not have a light version in the first place
Needs every bit of the marketing effort it receives.........................
A sanctuary for those who don't want to be bothered by taste................
More beer-flavored water from one of the big three American breweries.  Ugly yellow color, thin/watery mild flavored crap.  Just don't drink it.
this liquid is the foulist sludge i have ever gagged down. i had mine off the tap, and almost puked....i tossed the whole glass after 2 mouthfuls...miller can piss blood for calling this beer!
why am i doing this to myself, this is horrid.  even more watery than HighLife.
Well it tops Bud.  That's asad when that's all I can say....................
Pours like water, has little or no head, taste like water, and looks like pee. Ohh did I mention it smells like pee too.
Whatever, it's pretty standard.  It's tough to go wrong with something this cheap, it's not bad.
Extreme amounts of acetyldehyde, just tastes like paper, stale paper I guess.  Pretty bad, but if  you’ve drunk alot of it, you can deal with it.

cheap generic light lager.you getwhat you pay for, but not worth the 75cents.

A simple beer. Not a pleasant aroma, and a very thin taste. This taste, however, is crisp, and not objectionable, even as it is unremarkable. This is a decent beer to not savor and not relish, just drink.

Big Mouth Plastic Bottle.  A fine beer for a day out in the sun at a concert of Phil Lesh & Friends and the Allman Brothers Band.  But at $7 a bottle, it almost hurt to drink this beer.  The best I can say about it is that it has the essence of beer.
yes, it is a lite beer.  good for drinking while doing household chores.  people w/o spell check have a hard time drinking this tasty brew.
Average American light,like fuckin' in a conoe(close to water). Still better than better than anything AB has to offer.
Of the light beers Miller offers this one is just ok. ......................

Just like the other two big Lights(Lites), except darker.  Drink it if offered and nothing else is available

Wow. I really didn't think it would be this bad. Believe it or not, I have never had a Miller Lite before now. Now I know why. Watery, watery and more watery. Some flavoring exists, but I can't quite tell what it is. At least it is marginally not offensive. Whew!

I would rather drink water although an ice cold one does go down well on a hot day and it is 'less filling'. Rerate: I actually taste malt in this one. Usually my go to beer when there is nothing else, and I mean nothing else.
I thought that I had picked up my water instead of my beer.  Not as offensive as Bud, though.
Why bother, seriously. At least it tasted slightly smoother than Amstel Light.
Its easy to drink gallons of this stuff - although that doesnt alter the fact that it tastes like cheap, bog standard lager.  On to avoid.

After 4 years of college, i've had enough miller lite to have my face pictured on Rusty Wallace's car.  However, I'm not a huge fan, in fact, I see little point in wasting so much dough on a beer that tastes only minimally better than the cheaper beers, so usually I pass right by Miller Lite and grab something else.  Overall though, its a status beer for yuppies and college girls, so I try to avoid it.

Not quite as bad as Coors Light, but not much better either. This is one of my friend’s beer-of-choice… yes, we question his sexuality too. If you are looking for a decent light (should one actually exist), you’d be well advised to try Molson Light.
One of my first few beers....sigh, memories. That doesn't change the fact that this is just about as bad as most of the major American "college" beers. Leave this one at college, please.
Great for festivals/ballgames, etc, but not a bar drink at all.  Don't quite understand the big hype over all the miller products, but its a decent light beer.

Ya know my buddy "Moose" (The name should say enough) swears by this monkey piss.  He always tells me that "He can't drink the laaaaagers" with a horrible PA accent.  And I always tell him that this is a form of a lager, but he never believes me.  But I'll leave that damn fool to drink this foolish crap.  This isn't for me.
Better than bud light, but nothing to get in a fuss about. It's a good "common" beer.
Yuk. No flavor, no aroma, no character. A guy must have to get used to this and not drink anything else to actually purchase this stuff. I will say it's a step up from Natural Light, though.
It's ok.  Did anyone else notice the metal like taste that is most apparent in the can. Hence the nickname "DeadlyMetally"
Overall a poor beer, but still better than bud light, if its real hot out, and this beer is really cold, can quench your thirst, but otherwise its not worth drinking

Free sample, via a wedding reception. Actually has some color, with trace yellow tints. Foamy quickly fizzling white head. Moderate carbonation. Aroma of some strange plastic laden chemical, corn syrup and light pilsner malts. Taste is heavily carbed with specs of sweetness and a malt depth that is intolerable, even for a Light beer. Even my wife asked me why I even bothered. Why? A friend walked by and said "Oh good god man what are you drinking?". Enough said.
Ok, every once in a while you need a macro brew, and Miller light and MGD are the two beers that are the tops in that catagory.  What beer is supposed to be without the frills and BS.
Although domestic and rather light intaste, this is definately the best major domestic brewed light beer.  Simple and refreshing.

Obviously swill. Aroma was

Watery, light colored, small dissipating head. Smelled sort of sulphury.....
worst smelling beer I have ever experienced.  Flavor is not really anything,  Some what like Mic golden light.  I doubt I will ever drink this beer again.
This is one of the best fire extinguishers you can find. But you shouldn't drink that mix ...

Better than other Lite beers, I have tried, but still pathetic for a beer...
Yes, I confess -- I have actually consumed Miller Lite.  It was free, and I was young, but those are no excuses.  Sweet, corny-malty carbonated water.  If that's what you like, by all means enjoy.

not a good beer, more expensive than Natural Light and it can't even beat that, it is way too carbonated, has hints of piss, this beer makes me sick, I'd only drink one if it was free and I didn't know what the hell was going on.    

A friend of mine buys 30 packs regularly so I get stuck drinking some of his if I run out of mine, man these are terrible, you can taste the metal, is too highly carbonated, & I swear it tastes like the Beast.

My roomate drinks it, so I have a few every now and then.  I really dont like the aftertaste that it has, and the wide can just doesn't set the mood for chugging, or even taking big swigs.  Not a very good beer, but drinkable.

25 Years Old and Still the Number One Lite Beer in America. Contains a profuse amount of carbonation and a produces a very thin foam head when poured. It smells of perfumey yeast and corn, and has a very faint hop nose. It finishes very flat in taste.
This may be the worst of all the Miller’s, which is saying a lot. Looks terrible, tastes terrible, and that inflatable chair I got from them fell apart in minutes.

this is really an Average beer, nice looking can, good sunday football bar beer

hideous beer.  not nearly as cheap as it should be thanks to involved market campaign--but still pretty cheap...  there is no reason to be drinking this sort of beer, under any circumstances.  if you ever find yourself in a situation where miller lite is your brightest option, END YOUR LIFE.
Relatively smooth beer for cheap beer.  good for parties.  No unpleasent or overpowering aftertaste
Id consider this brew to be about as pretty close as u can get to average...
A relatively good beer for the price. Great for parties.....................

Really not a very good beer.  Unless you're looking for something better than Keystone and that's it, you can do a lot better.  Weak flavor, weak aroma, weak appearance, weak beer.  Just weak.  Give me a Bass any day.
Miller Lite is the shiat.  It runs in the fam so i had to hook up it's rating. for sure, peace
do not like this beer, just don't like the taste at all.....................

For a light beer, not one of my favorites. Lite is so innocuous and picture perfect that it is almost like it has been cloned. I believe that Miller now makes light beer for several other brands, Pabst, Old Style, Old Milwaukee etc, and as far as I am concerned, they all have more character than this, and are far cheaper too.
Now this is o.k.  I can drink a few of these...then use the other 4 in my barbacue mop sauce.
In my opinion this is the worst domestic lite beer on the market.  As sad as it is, I'd rather drink Natural or MBL.  Or better yet, wait till I can afford something worth drinking.
Not too bad. I would not buy it but it is decent and would drink it at a party if nothing better was there.

Here on Guam, this is known as the "Beer of the Islands". I'm guessing is it's because it's one of the few beers the welfare receipients can afford. At most parties it's this or Bud, hey, it's free and better than Bud so I choke it down. Good for washing BBQ sauce off of your hands.
This is some nasty crap.  Watery with nothing flavorwise except for the slight rancid pilsner taste.  Give me a Miller High Life over this anyday.
Ugh.  Blah.  Water tastes about the same, and is much cheaper...............
This is a good beer, but I think it is over rated. Yet I'm from Milwaukee, so naturally I think it is a lot better than Bud Light. Ha ha!!
Hey, when I want to get hammered for just about nothing and don't want to defile myself with the low-brow malt liquors, this is the way to go.
Certainly above Coors Light, and right below Bud Light.. I take that back, right next to it.
stupid advertising has forced this beer into my head, and it wont go away.  i dont know why i drink it, its not good.  but for some reason, i keep on drinking it.

This tastes just like its stable mate Magnum malt liquor but with less alcohol.  If you like the taste of this, save money and buy the Beast.  If you must drink "lite" beer, buy Amstel.

smells like dirty socks, tastes worse

Sometimes you look at the beer menu and weep. "I'll have a Lite" just seems to come out.  Not much on flavor. After a few it's a bit better. The additives give me a bad headache.

Good for pounding with your frat brothers...................................
the True Pilsner kicks ass.  great for bbq's in the summer..................
The only massed produced product I'll buy, it is usually kept in standby for when there isn't anything else available or mass quantities of company are coming.

Not a fan of light beer. Better than Bud light. If you like light beer and you don't like coors, I guess this is the beer for you.

good when you go to a friends house or a bar/danceclub,because that is what everyone else is drinking.

no too bad but should have a little bit more alcohol in it.

One of the better American light beers. Doesnt taste great, isnt less filling except in my craving for good beer.

Applies to rainbow warriors, we know most of you like the kielbasa, but miller lite does not and i repeat does not provide good lubricant for another man's ass!!!!  drink this if you are gay, don't if you're not.

Its a college beer.  You get what you pay for I guess.......................
crap...tasted like garbage and was only beer at the bar being served........

If it's free, and it's all there is, still better than Pepsi (nowhere near Coke).  What's with the adds anyway, "Less Filling" maybe, but those who say "Tastes Great" really need their head examined.  Still, because of the commercials, I'm glad this beer exists.
crap...was drinking it while stoned and it still tasted like garbage...rule of thumb..never drink anything spelled "lite"

Disapointing. Awesome commercials, but the beer doesn't live up to the hype. I expect better from Milwaukee.
Not the worst I've ever had but it is good for something different..........
Yet another staple from my college-days.  Why were we drinking a "Lite" beer in college anyway?

Another Miller product---oh joy.  Now what are the others again?  As far as Lite beer goes, this one is ok.  It is slightly less sour, and better than Bud Light but that is about as far as it goes.  It has more body than Coors Light but so does Dasani bottled water.
I can drink this regularly.  This will always remind me of my dad, grandpa, and uncles at the cottage when I was a kid.  It was always in the cottage.
Not great, prefer High Life, but a good party beer..........................
I don't know why I bother with these lite beers anyway????..................
Remembering good times...Friday when school is out, what time is it?........

Not bad for lite beer. This is a beer you drink when your hanging out with all of your friends down the shore, and are waiting for the bad load to pass out so that you can  piss on him. But if your looking to tie one on this my take some time.

You know, as far as mass produced light beers go, this is the only one I can drink. Many time better than Bud Light, but then again, so is my own urine. I drink it when I'm concerned about keeping my girlish figure.
Hell of a lot better than that rice water made by Budweiser.................
This is the best beer I've ever tasted. It really kicks the shit out of Busch.
dont know what Rusty Wallace sees in this stuff.............................
good to get drunk quickly and cheaply...nothing special.....................
Hangover is guaranteed when drinking this shit!! The nastiest of all beers - simply tastes disgusting. Stay away from this one.
Well, I guess Coors and Busch are worse; really no nose or flavor to speak of; not as offensive as some, but as close to water as a 'beer' can be.
I encountered Miller lite the same night that my Pabst run-in occurred...One quote can pretty much sum up this beer and its not pretty: "Pabst puts Miller Lite to shame."
not a bad american choice for getting drunk.................................

Used to be a faithful bud drinker until I got a hold of a green one.  Miller Lite is the best damn beer out there for those of us who do not like all of the goofy ass beers but instead prefer the basics.
Typical mass produced watered down American Lager. Nothing much here........
its like water... which is good if you just want to get drunk...............
no matter the time, no matter the place, this beer will consistently give me a hangover...certified urine in a bottle
Fizzy in every aspect, as expected. Stale, lifeless malt and hop interaction. Ghost hop finish, very hard, and solvent laden, throughout.  This one gets three capital P’s.  Piss Poor Product.
One of the better mass-produced domestic light beers out there, still not very good, but better.
Not terrible.  But definite watery taste & you can easily find a better beer.
Horrible.  Don't waste your time.  Spend a bit more cash and get something you will enjoy so much more.

If I try real hard I can actually taste hops.  Extremely pale straw color and almost no malt taste at all,  though does not have the extremely objectionable taste of bud light.  Actually very reminicent of lightly hopped carbonated water.  I taste the bite of carbonation more than the alcohol.

I go to see a AA affiliate of the Houston Astros play here near Austin and on Thursdays they have dollar pints of this crap on tap.  I think that is the only way I can drink this beer, cheaply and at a ballgame.  But the real reason I can drink it at the game is because it is cheaper than the bottle water and sodas.
If a light mainstream beer is what you want this is amoung the best ........
A Great Beer, but I have to admit that I do like Labatt Blue better when it comes to pilsner when you are runnning low on funds, then I say go with the Miller Lite.....
kids had a keg of "real" miller lite from wyoming.  even with my normal 3.2 utah drinking i nearly died drinking it
If I have to drink american light beer this is it...........................
less filling,-yes, tastes great?????????--------i don't think so, Milwaukee's Best Light is better at a much lower price

AWFUL beer, you get what you pay for, though.  This beer made me puke after my 7th one, and that is an extreme rarity.  It really has to taste raunchy for that to occur.  DO NOT LET THE PRICE FOOL YOU INTO BUYING IT
What's the point of drinking this?  On a side-by-side comparison, I actually liked Milwaukee's Best Light better than this.
My favorite amongst the popular American Lite Lagers.  I'd rather drink this "weak" beer than some Spaten Optimator.  Great for college students...not the cheap stuff, but not too expensive.
I can stand to have a few of these, but ya have to pay for it in the morning with pounding headaches - but not too, too bad.

How sad that so many people pay premium prices for this sad excuse for a beer. Let's face it folks, one light beer isn't much different from the next. So why pay premium prices for Miller, Bud or Coors? Try Stroh's Light, Schlitz Light, Schaefer Light or one of the good regionals like Hudy, Point, etc. They usually offer better quality and flavor and you'll actually be supporting a struggling brewery that needs your support. Miller and Bud have done their best to kill all of the little breweries. Don't support them.
My ratings will skew a bit higher because it came from the tap, which gave it a freshness, if nothing else. Lots of water.
I'll drink it over Coors light or Bud light, but why?.......................
Had this at a party; it sucked. Good thing I brought some Wild Turkey with me.
Tasteless swill.  Better than Anheiser Busch beers though...................
Pretty sad when the commercials are tastier than the product itself.........
If consuming mass quantities, not too bad...................................

This is the absolute WORST beer I've ever consumed, please please please don't buy it.  It sinks next to Coors Light, Bud Light, even fucking Milwaukee's Best Light.  It's tastes like how a burp smells.  I'd rather drink Pabst Blue Ribbon, think of it that way.
The best beer.  I drink a 18-pack a day.  Great taste, low cost, and low cal.  the best!
I can't think of a worse beer, unless it's Bud light........................

6-21-01, Rating 1.6: I'm gonna go against the tide here a bit and say it's really not that good.  I don't think it's the worst out there, but it leaves a lot to be desired.  Can be refreshing if drinking at a bar watching a game, munching on nachos or cheese fries. Alone, this stuff is brutal. UPDATE: Football season is back, and so ar the $1 Miller Lites.  Quite honestly, I had to choke down my last bottle...this stuff is that bad. I guess my trained taste buds pinpoint and magnify this beers poor qualities.  I will never be able to drink this stuff again.
A truer pilsner comes out of my bladder after a six pack of Pilsner Urquell. That they use the word Pilsner to describe this pissy water is truly degrading.
Yellow water (so called "beer"). Why do they brew it?.......................
sugar water for those whose taste buds haven't developed past Natural Light.

The absolute worst beer i have ever tasted. I can not imagine how anyone can stand this stuff. Why is it so popular. I tastes abolutely revolting. A warm day old forty of OE tastes better than this and that is really a comparable taste. Miller's other beers are pretty good so i dont know why lite is so bad.

Tall can purchased anywhere. Pale strawish in color upon pouring. Smell has a light mineral/grain thing going on. A pretty flavorless brew, just some graniness and maybe a hop or two. It is not offensive in any way though. Just like a nice can of water.
I cant always afford to drink quality beer. So this comes in as a weekend favorite because of the price. Not a good beer. But far superior to annheiser-busch products.
This is sugar water. Should be reserved for hummingbird feeders only........

Ahh, what fond memories.  Two dollar picthers on Thurday at players.  The many, many keg parties with hosts decent enough not to serve Natty or Iron Shitty.  Drunken women everywhere. . . . . . . . 

Then I graduated, got a job and some sense.  This crap isn't worth two dollars.  Gives you gas something terrible.  If I make a return to PSU, I'm forking out the extra dollar for some Yuengling.

But it will always have a special place in my heart.  Thanks for the memories Miller Lite!! That's all you'll be to me!!
Somewhere someone coined the term "macro-swill" in a review.  That phrase applies here.  Yucky stuff - nasty aroma, bad watery/rice taste, bland appearance...bad bad bad

I think the heat was getting to me. Had this on a 90+ degree day in outrageous humidity, and found it to have a crisp, refreshing flavor. I'll try it some other time again to see if that was just an effect of heat stroke.
It tastes more expensive than it is, and it is a better beer in bottle than on tap.  I think because it has a more carbonated bite in bottle.

It's the best light macrobrew crapbeer out there, I guess.  I mean, when your competition is Bud Light or Coors Light, it's not saying much, but Miller Lite is at least marginally better than a sharp stick in the eye.
Looking for something to drink after a sporting event?  Better choice than Bud Light.
Not much to offer, clean tasting and refreshing, but too watery. It's better than Bud Light.
Actually Miller Lite is a decent beer, but way too expensive to get all the time.
This is a pretty good stuff. Nothing great though...........................
I agree with one of the other rate casters when i say its much better than bud light..
a pretty good lite beer. if your going for low calories this is pretty much the lowest, but it somewhat lacks in taste.
This is by far the worst beer in America.  IF you want cheep easy drinkin beer its NATTY all the way.

OK let's face it - this is the impetus for the LITE movement in America - the reason why Hellman's Dijonaisse has the caveat, "For American tastes" on the label...but - it's not that bad.  For anyone who really appreciates the best parts of all good tasting beers and anyone who also finds themselves either broke or for some reason in a bar that doesn't at least have Foster's on hand, this is the beer to order.  Tip a can back and thank God you've shown the lawn who's boss for at least another week.
Great for funneling beer. Light enough that you can drink a case and not be bloated.
this is the best beer onthe market. u cant go wrong withmiller lite baby... i dont know what the hell dolemike was thinking
I am not a big fan of the taste of water so i only gave this a 3 on my palate scale.

I would take this beer over Bud Light any day. This beer is more what a true Pilsner should taste like.
Terrible!  I don't know what they put in this but Miller altogether is the worst brewer I have ever tried.
A great beer.  Its the grey poupon of the beers.  Ill drink it any day......
